        " YSR Rythu Bharosa Scheme.": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 Launched on
 15-10-2019.
 Benefit
 
 Rs. 13,500/- per year per farmer family.
 Interest Free Crop Loans.
 Free Borewells to be provided.
 9 Hours Free Electricity for Agriculture Purpose.
 
 Objective
 
 To make farmer self reliant.
 To increase their income and support them financially.
 
 Nodal Agency
 Department of Agriculture, Gorvernment of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Applying
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Portal.
 Introduction
 YSR Rythu Bandhu Scheme is flagshp scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was launched on 15th of October 2019.
 The main ojective behind launching this scheme is to make the farmers of Andhra Pradesh Self Reliant.
 At the same time, increasing their income and supporting them financially is also an important reason for starting this scheme.
 Under this scheme, the Andhra Pradesh Government will provide cash assistance of Rs. 13,500/- to the farmers.
 Apar from cash assistance, other benefits will also be given to the farmers under this scheme.
 Like farmers will be given loans without interest, free borewells will be made in their fields, electricity will be given free for 9 hours during the day for agriculture use.
 Department of Agriculture and Cooperation, Government of Andhra Pradesh is the implementing agency of this scheme.
 Initially the cash assistance under this scheme was Rs. 12,500/-.
 But on 26-11-2019, this amount was increased to Rs. 13,500/- by the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 The best thing about this scheme is that apart from the farmers owning the land, the farmers cultivating on lease will also get the benefit of cash assistance under this scheme.
 This cash assistance will help the farmers to meet the required investment during the crop season.
 The amount of financial assistance will be given to the eligible farmer in in three installments.
 Eligibility will be determined through the existing validated land ownership datatbase.
 Eligibility Conditions
 Farmer must be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Farmers Owning the Land.
 Landless Tenant Farmers or Lessee Farmers.
 ROFR Cultivators belonging to SC, ST, BC, Minority Category.
 Ineligibility
 The below mentioned categories are not eligible to take benefit under this scheme :-
 
 All Institutional Land Holders.
 If any member of the Farmer family belongs to the below given categories :-
 				Former and Present Holder of Constitutional Posts.
 Former and Present State Minister.
 Former and Present Member of Lok Sabha.
 Former and Present Member of Rajya Sabha.
 Former and Present Member of State Legislative Assemblies.
 Former and Present Member of State Legislative Council.
 
 All retired pensioners whose monthly pension is equal to or more than Rs. 10,000/-.
 All persons who paid Income Tax.
 Professionals :-
 				Doctors.
 Engineers.
 Lawyers.
 Chartered Accountants.
 Architects.
 
 Land used for non agriculture purpose.
 Commercial/Professional/GST Tax Payee Persons.
 
 Benefits
 Rs. 13,500/- per year per farmer family.
 	Rs. 7,500/- under Rythu Bharosa from Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Rs. 6,000/- under PM-KISAN from Government of India.
 
 Interest Free Crop Loans.
 Free Borewells to Farmers.
 No Toll Tax and Road Tax for Agriculture Tractors.
 9 Hours of Free Electricity During Day Time for Agriculture Purpose.
 Distribution of Instalment
 For Land Owner Farmers :- per year.
 	1st Instalment
 
 Rs. 5,500/- under Ryhtu Bharosa Scheme.
 Rs. 2,000/- under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Total Rs. 7,500/- in the month of May.
 
 2nd Instalment
 
 Rs. 2,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 Rs. 2,000/- under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Total Rs. 4,000/- in the month of October.
 
 3rd Instalment
 
 Rs. 2,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme in the month of January.
 
 Total
 Rs.

5,500/- under Ryhtu Bharosa Scheme.
 Rs. 2,000/- under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Total Rs. 7,500/- in the month of May.
 
 2nd Instalment
 
 Rs. 2,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 Rs. 2,000/- under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Total Rs. 4,000/- in the month of October.
 
 3rd Instalment
 
 Rs. 2,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme in the month of January.
 
 Total
 Rs. 13,500/-
 
 For Landless Tenant Farmers and ROFR Cultivators belonging to SC, ST, BC, and Minority Category :- per year.
 	1st Instalment
 
 Rs. 7,500/- under Ryhtu Bharosa Scheme in the month of May.
 
 2nd Instalment
 
 Rs. 4,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme in the month of October.
 
 3rd Instalment
 
 Rs. 2,000/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme in the month of January.
 
 Total
 Rs. 13,500/-
 
 Document Required
 Valid Identity Proof.
 Aadhar Card.
 Bank Details with IFSC Code.
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Agriculture Land Ownership Proof.
 Tenant Farmer Certificate.
 How to Apply
 First of all go to the official website of Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 Click on Sign Up.
 Enter your mobile number.
 Fill the OTP and then click on Submit.
 Username and Password will be sent to your mobile number.
 Login with your Username and Password.
 After Logging In fill the below mentioned details :-
 	Name.
 Father Name.
 Date of Birth.
 Aadhar Number.
 Mobile Number.
 Address.
 Marital Status.
 Caste.
 Agriculture Land Details.
 
 After filling all the required details click on the approve button.
 The data is submitted succesfully and the application is subject to verification.
 Applicant can check the status of his/her application on relogging on the portal.
 Once the application is accepted, the amount of the scheme will credited to the beneficiary's account as per the stipulated time.
 Features of the Scheme
 The financial assistance of Rs. 13,500/- is divided into 2 parts.
 A part of Rs. 7,500/- will be given under the Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 And the second part of Rs. 6,000/- will be given under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Farmers who are not covered under PM-KISAN scheme, they will be given full amount of Rs. 13,500/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 The amount of assistance will be given in 3 installments i.e.

13,500/- is divided into 2 parts.
 A part of Rs. 7,500/- will be given under the Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 And the second part of Rs. 6,000/- will be given under PM-KISAN Scheme.
 Farmers who are not covered under PM-KISAN scheme, they will be given full amount of Rs. 13,500/- under Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 The amount of assistance will be given in 3 installments i.e. :-
 	1st Installment in the month of May.
 2nd Installment in the month of October.
 3rd Installment in the month of January.
 
 If a farmer has the following person in his family,then he is eligible for assistance under Rythu Bharosa Scheme :-
 	Government Multi Tasking Staff Employee.
 Class VI Employee.
 Group D Employee.
 
 The farmers cultivating on acquired lands who were not compensated are also eligible for assistance under this scheme.
 If two or more family members have the same piece of land, then the benefit will be transferred to the bank account of elder person.
 The tenant or lessee farmer should not have any agriculture land of his own.
 If a person has given land on lease to a member of his own family, then he will not come under the eligible category under this scheme.
 It is mandatory for tenant and lessee farmer to have the following minimum area of land taken on lease :-
 	Crop
 Minimum Leased Land
 All Agriculture, Horticulture
 				and Sericulture Crops
 1.0 Acre or 0.4 Ha
 Vegetables, Flower and
 				Fodder Crops
 0.5 Acre or 0.2 Ha
 Betel Vine
 0.1 Acre or 0.04 Ha
 
 Only one Tenant Farmer belonging to Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe, Backward Class and Minority Category will get the benefit along with the Land Owner Farmers.
 In case the same land owner has multiple tenants, preference will be given to the Schdule Caste Tenant, followed by Schedule Tribe, Backward Class and Minority Tenants.
 Joint verification will be done by Village Agriculture Assistant/Agricultural Extension Officers and Village Reveneue Officer.
 Even if an unmarried child of a farmer is a Government Employee or Income Tax Assessee, the farmer is eligible under Rythu Bharosa Scheme.
 Important Links
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Portal.

 YSR Rythu Bharosa Login.
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Application Status.
 YSR Ryhtu Bharosa Grievance Status.
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Password Recovery.
 Department of Agriculture, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Official Guidelines.
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Amended Official Guidelines.
 YSR Ryhtu Bharosa Applying Procedure.
 YSR Ryhtu Bharosa App.
 Contact Details
 YSR Rythu Bharosa Scheme Toll Free Numbers :- 1100 and 1902.
 Department of Agriculture Help Desk Email :- comag@nic.in.
 Department of Agriculture, Government of Andhra Pradesh,
 	Commissioner and Manager of Agriculture,
 	Old Mirchiard, Nallapadu Road,
 	Chatchugunta, Guntur,
 	Andhra Pradesh - 522004.

": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of The Scheme
 YSR Bima Scheme.
 Launched on
 1st July 2021.
 Beneficiaries
 1.32 Crore People Living Below Poverty Line.
 Benefits
 
 Financial Assistance of Rs.1,00,000/-  in case of Natural Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Accidental Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Full Disability.
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Labour, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Implementing Department
 GSWS Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Introduction
 YSR Bima Scheme is one of the most prominent scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It is a social security scheme launched on 01 July 2021.
 There are many families in which there is only one earning member.
 In the event of his sudden death or inability to work, that family fails to manage their daily expenses.
 Keeping all this in mind, the Andhra Pradesh government started the YSR Bima Scheme.
 Under this scheme, all eligible families will be given financial assistance on the death or full disability of their Primary Bread Earner.
 In case of natural death, financial assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/- will be given by the government within 15 days.
 Financial assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- will be given by the insurance company in case of death or disability during accident.
 A person between the age group of 18 to 70 years can register himself/herself under this scheme.
 The premium will be payable by the government to the insurance company under this scheme.
 Labour Department of Andhra Pradesh is the nodal agency of this scheme.
 Gram Sachivalayam Ward Sachivalayam is the implementing agency of this scheme.
 Objective
 To provide financial assistance in case of sudden death or disability of Primary Bread Earner.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/-  in case of Natural Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Accidental Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Full Disability.
 Eligibility
 He/ She should be below poverty line.
 He/ She should be the Primary Bread Earning Member of the Family.
 His/Her age should be between 18 to 70 years.
 He/ She must be in good health.
 Distribution of Financial Assistance
 Normal Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 50 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 1,00,000/-.
 
 Accidental Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Full Disability
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Definition of Below Poverty Line (BPL)
 Family Income should be :-
 	Rural Area :- Rs. 1,20,000/- per year.
 Urban Area :- Rs.

1,00,000/-.
 
 Accidental Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Full Disability
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Definition of Below Poverty Line (BPL)
 Family Income should be :-
 	Rural Area :- Rs. 1,20,000/- per year.
 Urban Area :- Rs. 1,44,000/- per year.
 
 Family should have Agriculture Land :-
 	Not more than 10 acres dry.
 Not more than 3 acres wet.
 Not more than 10 acre both dry and wet.
 
 The monthly power consumption of the family should not be more than 300 units.
 The house of the family in urban area should be built in less than 1000 Sqft.
 There should be no government employee in the family.
 Family should not have a car or other four wheelers.
 There should be no taxpayer in the family.
 Documents Required for Registration
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhaar Card.
 Voter ID.
 BPL Card.
 Rice Card.
 Bank Account Details.
 Good Health Certificate.
 Aadhaar Card of Nominee
 Feature of the Scheme
 Is it mandatory for every Primary Bread Earner to give the name of his/her nominee.
 In the absence of a family member, he can nominate any legal representative.
 Master policy and Unique Identity Card will be given to each beneficiary.
 The state government will provide cover under social security through insurance to 1.32 crore Primary Bread Earner.
 No premium is to be paid by beneficiaries, Andhra Pradesh Government will bear all the expenses.
 The age of the Primary Bread Earner should be between 18 to 70 years.
 The registration, enrollment and claim processing of the beneficiaries will be taken care of by the Gram Sachivalayams/ Ward Sachivalayams Department.
 Village Volunteers/Ward Volunteers will conduct door to door survey of rice card family and register them in YSR Bima Scheme mobile app.
 Village Volunteers/Ward Volunteers will help the beneficiary to open Jan Dhan Account/ National bank account to receive the claim.
 Rs. 1, 00,000/- will be given by the State Government directly to the bereaved family in case of natural death in within 15 days.
 Rs. 5, 00,000/- will be given by the insurance company in case of accidental death/full disability in within 15 days.
 The facility of changing the Primary Bread Earner or Nominee is also available which can be availed through Gram Sachivalaym Ward Sachivalayam facilitation centers.
 Primary Bread Earner can check the status of their online application on YSR Bima Scheme Portal  by entering Aadhaar Number or Rice Card Number or by Name.
 How to Avail Benefit
 To avail the benefit of YSR Bima Scheme, the applicant does not need to go anywhere.
 The Gram Sachivalayam/ Ward Sachivalayam Department will conduct the survey of Primary Bread Earner of BPL families.
 Village/Ward Volunteer will go door to door to meet the rice card holder family and enter their rice card number in the Mobile App of YSR Bima Scheme.
 After that the volunteer will have to select the Primary Bread Earner.
 The ward volunteer will take the Aadhar Card details of the Primary Bread Earner and match it with the data of Unique Identification Authority of India.
 After that the ward volunteer will enter the biometric details.
 After biometric, the ward volunteer will verify the following data :-
 	Name of Primary Bread Earner.
 Father/Husband Name.
 Age.
 Caste.
 Caste Category.
 Mobile Number.
 
 After that the volunteer will enter the following details of the nominee :-
 	Nominee Name.
 Nominee Aadhar.
 Nominee Date of Birth.
 Nominee's Relation with Primary Bread Earner.
 Nominee Bank Account Details.
 After entering and verifying all the details, all the data will be submitted by the volunteer to the server.
 
 All the details related to registration will be made available on the given mobile number.
 Nominees Appointment
 The Primary Bread Earner will appoint a nominee to receive the claim.

The following can be appointed as a nominee by the Primary Bread Earner :-
 Case
 Nominee
 If Primary Bread Earner is Married
 Spouse.
 If Spouse is not available
 Son/Daughter.
 If Primary Bread Earner is Unmarried
 Mother/Father.
 If Mother or Father are not available
 Unmarried or Widowed Sister.
 If there is no dependent
 Legal Representative.
 Claim Procedure of YSR Bima Scheme
 The nominee will first have to fill the Claim form of YSR Bima Scheme.
 The following documents will be enclosed with the claim form as per requirement :-
 	Claim cum Discharge Form.
 Copy of Death Certificate. (In case of Death).
 Post Mortem Report. (In case of Death).
 Police Final Report.
 Hospital Discharge Summary. (In case of Full Disability).
 Age Proof of Member.
 Aadhar Card of Nominee.
 Copy of Bank Passbook.
 
 After filling the claim form and enclosing all the documents, the nominee will have to submit the claim form to the felicitation center of YSR Bima Scheme.
 Felicitation centers of YSR Bima Scheme is Gram/Ward Sachivalayams.
 The scheme amount will be transferred to the nominee's account within 15 days from date of submission of the claim form.
 Documents Required for Claim
 Hospital Discharge Summary.
 Police Final Report.
 Post Mortem Report.
 Claim cum Discharge Form.
 Copy of Death Certificate.
 Age Proof of Member.
 Aadhar Card of the Nominee.
 Copy of Bank Passbook.
 Grievance Redressal
 Any beneficiary can register his/her grievance related to YSR Bima Scheme through the steps given below :-
 The applicant will have to write the details of his/her complaint in a letter and submit it to the office of the Project Director, District Rural Development Agency of his/her district.
 After receiving the grievance, a thorough investigation will be done by the Project Director.
 After the completion of the investigation, the complaint will be disposed of and the applicant will be informed at the earliest.
 If the complainant is unhappy with the disposal of the appeal, then the complainant can submit the first appeal to the District Collector's Office.
 Facts and Figures of YSR Bima Scheme
 
 Important Forms
 YSR Bima Scheme Claim Form.
 Important Links
 YSR Bima Scheme Official Website.
 YSR Bima Scheme Login.
 YSR Bima Scheme Beneficiary Search.
 YSR Bima Scheme District Wise Enrollment List.
 YSR Bima Scheme Caste Wise Enrollment List.
 YSR Bima Scheme Gender Wise Enrollment List.
 YSR Bima Scheme District Wise Claims Details. (2022-2023).
 YSR Bima Scheme District Wise Claim Details. (2021-2022).
 YSR Bima Scheme Official Guidelines.
 Contact Details
 YSR Bima Scheme Toll Free Number: - 155214
 YSR Bima Scheme Head Office Phone Number :-  08631245678.
 Gram Volunteer Ward Volunteer Office Phone Number :-  086321234567.
 Gram Volunteer Ward Volunteer Office Email :- gsws@ap.gov.in.
 YSR Bima Scheme Head Office Address :- Fourth Floor, PNB Terminus, Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh.
 Gram Volunteer Ward Volunteer Office Address :- Street#75, Autonagar, Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh.

 YSR Bima Scheme is one of the most prominent scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It is a social security scheme launched on 01 July 2021.
 There are many families in which there is only one earning member.
 In the event of his sudden death or inability to work, that family fails to manage their daily expenses.
 Keeping all this in mind, the Andhra Pradesh government started the YSR Bima Scheme.
 Under this scheme, all eligible families will be given financial assistance on the death or full disability of their Primary Bread Earner.
 In case of natural death, financial assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/- will be given by the government within 15 days.
 Financial assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- will be given by the insurance company in case of death or disability during accident.
 A person between the age group of 18 to 70 years can register himself/herself under this scheme.
 The premium will be payable by the government to the insurance company under this scheme.
 Labour Department of Andhra Pradesh is the nodal agency of this scheme.
 Gram Sachivalayam Ward Sachivalayam is the implementing agency of this scheme.
 Objective
 To provide financial assistance in case of sudden death or disability of Primary Bread Earner.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/-  in case of Natural Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Accidental Death.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/- in case of Full Disability.
 Eligibility
 He/ She should be below poverty line.
 He/ She should be the Primary Bread Earning Member of the Family.
 His/Her age should be between 18 to 70 years.
 He/ She must be in good health.
 Distribution of Financial Assistance
 Normal Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 50 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 1,00,000/-.
 
 Accidental Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Full Disability
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Definition of Below Poverty Line (BPL)
 Family Income should be :-
 	Rural Area :- Rs. 1,20,000/- per year.
 Urban Area :- Rs.

1,00,000/-.
 
 Accidental Death
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Full Disability
 
 Age Group :- 18 to 70 years.
 Claim Amount :- Rs. 5,00,000/-.
 
 Definition of Below Poverty Line (BPL)
 Family Income should be :-
 	Rural Area :- Rs. 1,20,000/- per year.
 Urban Area :- Rs. 1,44,000/- per year.
 
 Family should have Agriculture Land :-
 	Not more than 10 acres dry.
 Not more than 3 acres wet.
 Not more than 10 acre both dry and wet.
 
 The monthly power consumption of the family should not be more than 300 units.
 The house of the family in urban area should be built in less than 1000 Sqft.
 There should be no government employee in the family.
 Family should not have a car or other four wheelers.
 There should be no taxpayer in the family.
 Documents Required for Registration
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhaar Card.
 Voter ID.
 BPL Card.
 Rice Card.
 Bank Account Details.
 Good Health Certificate.
 Aadhaar Card of Nominee
 Feature of the Scheme
 Is it mandatory for every Primary Bread Earner to give the name of his/her nominee.
 In the absence of a family member, he can nominate any legal representative.
 Master policy and Unique Identity Card will be given to each beneficiary.
 The state government will provide cover under social security through insurance to 1.32 crore Primary Bread Earner.
 No premium is to be paid by beneficiaries, Andhra Pradesh Government will bear all the expenses.
 The age of the Primary Bread Earner should be between 18 to 70 years.
 The registration, enrollment and claim processing of the beneficiaries will be taken care of by the Gram Sachivalayams/ Ward Sachivalayams Department.
 Village Volunteers/Ward Volunteers will conduct door to door survey of rice card family and register them in YSR Bima Scheme mobile app.
 Village Volunteers/Ward Volunteers will help the beneficiary to open Jan Dhan Account/ National bank account to receive the claim.
 Rs. 1, 00,000/- will be given by the State Government directly to the bereaved family in case of natural death in within 15 days.
 Rs. 5, 00,000/- will be given by the insurance company in case of accidental death/full disability in within 15 days.
 The facility of changing the Primary Bread Earner or Nominee is also available which can be availed through Gram Sachivalaym Ward Sachivalayam facilitation centers.
 Primary Bread Earner can check the status of their online application on YSR Bima Scheme Portal  by entering Aadhaar Number or Rice Card Number or by Name.
 How to Avail Benefit
 To avail the benefit of YSR Bima Scheme, the applicant does not need to go anywhere.
 The Gram Sachivalayam/ Ward Sachivalayam Department will conduct the survey of Primary Bread Earner of BPL families.
 Village/Ward Volunteer will go door to door to meet the rice card holder family and enter their rice card number in the Mobile App of YSR Bima Scheme.
 After that the volunteer will have to select the Primary Bread Earner.
 The ward volunteer will take the Aadhar Card details of the Primary Bread Earner and match it with the data of Unique Identification Authority of India.
 After that the ward volunteer will enter the biometric details.
 After biometric, the ward volunteer will verify the following data :-
 	Name of Primary Bread Earner.
 Father/Husband Name.
 Age.
 Caste.
 Caste Category.
 Mobile Number.
 
 After that the volunteer will enter the following details of the nominee :-
 	Nominee Name.
 Nominee Aadhar.
 Nominee Date of Birth.
 Nominee's Relation with Primary Bread Earner.
 Nominee Bank Account Details.
 After entering and verifying all the details, all the data will be submitted by the volunteer to the server.
 
 All the details related to registration will be made available on the given mobile number.
 Nominees Appointment
 The Primary Bread Earner will appoint a nominee to receive the claim.

The following can be appointed as a nominee by the Primary Bread Earner :-
 Case
 Nominee
 If Primary Bread Earner is Married
 Spouse.
 If Spouse is not available
 Son/Daughter.
 If Primary Bread Earner is Unmarried
 Mother/Father.
 If Mother or Father are not available
 Unmarried or Widowed Sister.
 If there is no dependent
 Legal Representative.
 Claim Procedure of YSR Bima Scheme
 The nominee will first have to fill the Claim form of YSR Bima Scheme.
 The following documents will be enclosed with the claim form as per requirement :-
 	Claim cum Discharge Form.
 Copy of Death Certificate. (In case of Death).
 Post Mortem Report. (In case of Death).
 Police Final Report.
 Hospital Discharge Summary. (In case of Full Disability).
 Age Proof of Member.
 Aadhar Card of Nominee.
 Copy of Bank Passbook.
 
 After filling the claim form and enclosing all the documents, the nominee will have to submit the claim form to the felicitation center of YSR Bima Scheme.
 Felicitation centers of YSR Bima Scheme is Gram/Ward Sachivalayams.
 The scheme amount will be transferred to the nominee's account within 15 days from date of submission of the claim form.
 Documents Required for Claim
 Hospital Discharge Summary.
 Police Final Report.
 Post Mortem Report.
 Claim cum Discharge Form.
 Copy of Death Certificate.
 Age Proof of Member.
 Aadhar Card of the Nominee.
 Copy of Bank Passbook.
 Grievance Redressal
 Any beneficiary can register his/her grievance related to YSR Bima Scheme through the steps given below :-
 The applicant will have to write the details of his/her complaint in a letter and submit it to the office of the Project Director, District Rural Development Agency of his/her district.
 After receiving the grievance, a thorough investigation will be done by the Project Director.
 After the completion of the investigation, the complaint will be disposed of and the applicant will be informed at the earliest.
 If the complainant is unhappy with the disposal of the appeal, then the complainant can submit the first appeal to the District Collector's Office.
 Facts and Figures of YSR Bima Scheme

 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Launched in
 28th September 2020.
 Benefits
 
 Under YSR Jala Kala Scheme following benefits will be provided to Farmers :-
 				Free of Cost Drilling of Borewells or Tubewells.
 Free of Cost Motor Pump Sets.
 Free of Cost Installation Accessories.
 Free of Cost Energizarion of Drilled Borewells or Tubewells.
 
 
 Objective
 
 To solve the problems of farmers due to water scarcity.
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Panchayati Raj & Rural Development, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Applying
 
 Online through YSR Jala Kala Scheme Portal.
 Offline through Application Form.
 
 Introduction
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme is one of the flagship scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government for the welfare of the Farmers.
 It is also called "YSR Jala Kala - Free Borewells Programme".
 It was started on 28th of September 2020.
 Department of Panchayati Raj & Rural Development of Andhra Pradesh Government is the nodal department of this scheme.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme is one of the 9 programme under "NAVARATNALU" of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 The main objective behind launching this scheme is to solve the problem of water scarcity for agriculture and irrigation.
 Under YSR Jala Kala Scheme Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide the facility of free of cost drilling of borings and tubewells.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme also covers the Cost of Pump Sets, Cost of Installation Accessories, and the Cost of Energization of Drilled Borewells or Tubewells.
 All the Farmers of Andhra Pradesh are eligible to avail the benefit of YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Minimum 2.5 Acre of Land is required to apply under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 If an indinidual farmer does not have 2.5 acres of land, then a group of farmers can also apply under this scheme.
 Eligible Farmers of Andhra Pradesh will apply under YSR Jala Kala Scheme through following mentioned ways :-
 	Online through YSR Jala Kala Scheme Portal.
 Offline through YSR Jala Kala Scheme Application Form.
 
 Eligibility Conditions
 Farmers of Andhra Pradesh.
 Farmer should have Land Ownership of 2.5 acre.
 Farmers having Failed Borewell or Tubewell.
 Farmer should not have any Existing Borewell or Tubewell.
 Ineligibility Conditions
 Central Government Employees.
 State Government Employees.
 Retired Government Employees.
 Farmer having Existing Borewell or Tubewell.
 Farmer's Land Located in Over Exploited Villages.
 Benefits
 Free of Cost Drilling of Borewells or Tubewells.
 Free of Cost Motor Pump Sets.
 Free of Cost Installation Accessories.
 Free of Cost Energization of Drilled Borewells or Tubewells.
 Documents Required
 Aadhar Card.
 Pattedar Passbook.
 Passport Size Photo.
 Mobile Number.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable).
 Any Proof of Residence :-
 	Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Ration Card.
 Voter ID Card.
 Passport.
 Driving License.
 
 How to Apply
 Offline through Application Form
 
 Farmer can apply for YSR Jala Kala Scheme through Application Form.
 Application Form is available at the office of Village Secretriat.
 Fill the basic details such as :- Name, Address, Land Details, Crop Details etc in the Application Form.
 Attach the following documents :-
 				Aadhar Card.
 Copy of Pattedar Passbook.
 Caste Certificate.

(If Applicable).
 Any Proof of Residence :-
 	Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Ration Card.
 Voter ID Card.
 Passport.
 Driving License.
 
 How to Apply
 Offline through Application Form
 
 Farmer can apply for YSR Jala Kala Scheme through Application Form.
 Application Form is available at the office of Village Secretriat.
 Fill the basic details such as :- Name, Address, Land Details, Crop Details etc in the Application Form.
 Attach the following documents :-
 				Aadhar Card.
 Copy of Pattedar Passbook.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable).
 Passport Size Photo.
 Any Residence Proof.
 
 Submit the Application Form with the documents in Village Secretriate Office.
 Application will be scruinized by Village Revenue Officer after on field verification.
 Village Revenue Officer then forwarded the Application to Assistant Project Diretor for further scrutiny.
 If farmer's application will be approved then he/she will be informed through SMS.
 Then the drilling contractor will be assigned for surveying and drilling of borewell or tubewell.
 
 Online through YSR Jala Kala Portal
 
 Farmer can apply apply online through YSR Jala Kala Scheme Online Portal.
 Click on Apply for Borewell.
 Enter the Aadhar Card of the Farmer and the portal itself fill the required details after OTP verification.
 Upload the following documents :-
 				Aadhar Card.
 Copy of Pattedar Passbook.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable).
 Passport Size Photo.
 Any Residence Proof.
 
 Click on Submit.
 Application will be scruinized by Village Revenue Officer after on field verification.
 Village Revenue Officer then forwarded the Application to Assistant Project Diretor for further scrutiny.
 If farmer's application will be approved then he/she will be informed through SMS.
 Then the drilling contractor will be assigned for surveying and drilling of borewell or tubewell.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 Farmers having non functional borewell or tubewell is also eligible to apply under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Only one borewell per family will sanctioned.
 In case of borewell failed, second borewell will be drilled on some other place on the same piece of land.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme also covers the cost of below mentioned installation accessories :-
 	HDPE Pipe.
 Flat Electric Cable.
 Panel Board.
 
 Priority will be given to the farmers belonging to the following category :-
 	Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Women Farmers.
 
 Serving or Retired employees of Central/State Government are not eligible under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Farmers land located in the List of Over Water Exploited Villages are not eligible to avail the benefit under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Important Forms
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Application Form.
 Important Links
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Portal.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Application Status.
 Department of Panchayati Raj & Rural Development, Andhra Pradesh.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Guidelines.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Over Exploited Villages List.
 Contact Details
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Toll Free Helpline Number :- 1902.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Helpline Number :- 09121296053.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme Helpdesk Email :- ysrjalakala.crd@gmail.com.
 Department of Panchayati Raj & Rural Development Helpdesk Email :- spmucprre-ap@nic.in.

 Click on Apply for Borewell.
 Enter the Aadhar Card of the Farmer and the portal itself fill the required details after OTP verification.
 Upload the following documents :-
 				Aadhar Card.
 Copy of Pattedar Passbook.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable).
 Passport Size Photo.
 Any Residence Proof.
 
 Click on Submit.
 Application will be scruinized by Village Revenue Officer after on field verification.
 Village Revenue Officer then forwarded the Application to Assistant Project Diretor for further scrutiny.
 If farmer's application will be approved then he/she will be informed through SMS.
 Then the drilling contractor will be assigned for surveying and drilling of borewell or tubewell.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 Farmers having non functional borewell or tubewell is also eligible to apply under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Only one borewell per family will sanctioned.
 In case of borewell failed, second borewell will be drilled on some other place on the same piece of land.
 YSR Jala Kala Scheme also covers the cost of below mentioned installation accessories :-
 	HDPE Pipe.
 Flat Electric Cable.
 Panel Board.
 
 Priority will be given to the farmers belonging to the following category :-
 	Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Women Farmers.
 
 Serving or Retired employees of Central/State Government are not eligible under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.
 Farmers land located in the List of Over Water Exploited Villages are not eligible to avail the benefit under YSR Jala Kala Scheme.

": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019-2020.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Students belonging to the below mentioned category :-
 				Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 Differently Abled.
 
 
 Benefits
 
 Full Reimbursement of Course Fees.
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Social Welfare, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 
 Online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Offline through Application Form.
 
 Introduction
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme is the flagship scheme of the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started for the welfare of students studying the post metric courses.
 The main aim behind launching this to encourage students to pursue higher studies without fearing the fees of the course.
 Andhra Pradesh's Department of Social Welfare is the nodal department of this Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will bear the full fees of the course in which the beneficiary is studying.
 Only the students belonging to SC, ST, BC, EBC Kapu, Minority and Differently Abled Category are eligible to avail the benefit under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 It is a Aadhar Enabled Direct Bank Transfer Scheme.
 In the initial phase of Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme, the course fee was directly transferred to the concerned College.
 But from 16-06-2020 the entire course fee is being transferred to the student's mother's bank account.
 The course fee will be paid in four instalments in an academic year.
 Elgiible student can apply for Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme through 2 ways :-
 	Online through Navasakam Benficiary Mangement Portal.
 Offline through Application Form.
 
 Benefits of Scheme
 Complete Reimbursement of the Course Fees.
 Reimbursement of the Course Fees includes :-
 	Tution Fees.
 Special Fees.
 Exam Fees.
 Any Other Fees.
 
 Eligibility
 Student should be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Family Income should not be more than Rs. 2.50 Lakhs.
 Student should be belong to any of the below mentioned category :-
 	Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 Differently Abled.
 
 Family should hold below mentioned area of Land :-
 	Wet Land below 10 Acres.
 Dry Land below 25 Acres.
 Wet and Dry Land under 25 Acres.
 
 Student should be enrolled in any of the following institutions :-
 	Government Institutions.
 Government Aided Institutions.
 Private College Affiliated to State University or Board.
 Day Scholar Student.
 Student of College Attached Hostels.
 Student of Department Attached Hostels.
 
 No Member of the Family should be in Government Services or a receipent of Pension.
 No Member of the Family should be a Income Tax Payer.
 Ineligibility
 The following students are not eligible to avail the benefit under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 	Student studying in Deemed or Private University.
 Student studying through Distance Learning abd Correspondence Course.
 Students enrolled under Management, Sports or NRI Quota.
 Students studying PG Courses in Private College.
 Student having Four Wheeler in their house.
 If there is a tax payer in a family.
 If Student's family owns a property having more than 1500 Square Feet of built up area.
 
 Eligible Courses
 The following courses are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 
 B.Tech.
 B. Pharmacy.
 ITI.
 Polytechnic.
 B.Ed.
 M.Tech.
 M.Pharmacy.
 MBA.
 Any Other Degree Course.
 Any Other PG Course.
 
 Documents Required
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Rice Card or Income Certificate.
 College Admission Details.
 Below mentioned declarations :-
 	No Government Employee or Pensioner.
 Non-Taxpayer.
 No Four Wheeler.
 No Urban Property beyond 1500 Square Feet.
 No Agriculture Land beyond Prescribed Limit.
 
 Bank Account Details.

If there is a tax payer in a family.
 If Student's family owns a property having more than 1500 Square Feet of built up area.
 
 Eligible Courses
 The following courses are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 
 B.Tech.
 B. Pharmacy.
 ITI.
 Polytechnic.
 B.Ed.
 M.Tech.
 M.Pharmacy.
 MBA.
 Any Other Degree Course.
 Any Other PG Course.
 
 Documents Required
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Rice Card or Income Certificate.
 College Admission Details.
 Below mentioned declarations :-
 	No Government Employee or Pensioner.
 Non-Taxpayer.
 No Four Wheeler.
 No Urban Property beyond 1500 Square Feet.
 No Agriculture Land beyond Prescribed Limit.
 
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal
 
 Applicant has to visit Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal to apply for Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Click on Login and choose Citizen Login.
 Enter your Aadhar Number.
 Portal will send OTP for Aadhar Verification.
 After verification select "Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme" in Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the required details and upload the asked document and click on submit.
 Once the application submitted it will forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.
 Field verification will be done by the officials and upload their recommendations on the portal.
 After that the list of eligible and ineligible students will be in all secretariats.
 Course fee will be transferred through Aadhar Enabled Payment System in the bank account of student's mother.
 
 Through Offline Application Form
 
 Applicant can also apply for Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme through Application Form.
 The Application Form will also be available in the college.
 Student have to fill the below mentioned details in the Application Form :-
 				Personal Details.
 College Admission Details.
 Income Related Details.
 
 Attach the required documents with the Application Form.
 Submit the Application Form with the attached documents to the College Principal.
 College Principal verifies the details and upload the same in the JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Student will receive SMS as soon as student details are uploaded on the Portal.
 Then Student has to visit a Mee Seva Centre.
 He/She has to provide their JnanaBhumi Application ID and Aadhar Number to gain access to application form online.
 Student verify the details, make a modification if any and submit the application by giving their biometric.
 Once verified the list of eligible and ineligible students will be uploaded on the portal.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 75% Attendance is mandatory for the student for release of the amount.
 If student has below mentioned vehicle in their home then they are eligible under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 	Taxies.
 Tractors.
 Autos.
 
 Students having Sanitory Worker in their family is eligible under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Amount will be transferred only in the bank account of student's mother.
 Fee Reimbursement Card will be issued to the eligible students under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Students studying from ITI to Ph.D are eligible under this scheme.
 Application of the student is subject to renewal every year.
 Residents of Andhra Pradesh studying in other Telangana or Other State are also eligible to avail the benefit under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Application Process of Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme
 Following are the Application process of the Student under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme :-

 Introduction
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme is the flagship scheme of the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started to provide the financial assistance to students studying the post metric courses.
 The main aim behind launching this to encourage students to pursue higher studies without fearing the expenses incurred on their study.
 Andhra Pradesh's Department of Social Welfare is the nodal department of this Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide the financial assistance to the students studying in post metric courses.
 Only the students belonging to SC, ST, BC, EBC Kapu, Minority and Differently Abled Category are eligible to avail the benefit under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 It is a Aadhar Enabled Direct Bank Transfer Scheme.
 In the initial phase of Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme, the financial assistance was directly transferred to the concerned College on behalf of the students.
 But from 16-06-2020 the entire course fee is being transferred to the student's mother's bank account.
 The financial assistance will be paid in two instalments in July and December.

 	Rs. 10,000/- per year for ITI Students.
 Rs. 15,000/- per year for Polytechnic Students.

 Student applied under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme are automatically eligible for the financial assistance under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019-2020.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Students belonging to the below mentioned category :-
 				Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 Differently Abled.
 
 
 Benefits
 
 The following financial assistance will be provided under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 				Rs. 10,000/- per year for ITI Students.
 Rs. 15,000/- per year for Polytechnic Students.
 Rs. 20,000/- per year for Other Degree Courses Students.
 
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Social Welfare, Andhra Pradesh.
 Introduction
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme is the flagship scheme of the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started to provide the financial assistance to students studying the post metric courses.
 The main aim behind launching this to encourage students to pursue higher studies without fearing the expenses incurred on their study.
 Andhra Pradesh's Department of Social Welfare is the nodal department of this Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide the financial assistance to the students studying in post metric courses.
 Only the students belonging to SC, ST, BC, EBC Kapu, Minority and Differently Abled Category are eligible to avail the benefit under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 It is a Aadhar Enabled Direct Bank Transfer Scheme.
 In the initial phase of Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme, the financial assistance was directly transferred to the concerned College on behalf of the students.
 But from 16-06-2020 the entire course fee is being transferred to the student's mother's bank account.
 The financial assistance will be paid in two instalments in July and December.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will be provided under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 	Rs. 10,000/- per year for ITI Students.
 Rs. 15,000/- per year for Polytechnic Students.
 Rs. 20,000/- per year for Other Degree Courses Students.
 
 Eligibility
 Student should be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Family Income should not be more than Rs. 2.50 Lakhs.
 Student should be belong to any of the below mentioned category :-
 	Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 Differently Abled.
 
 Family should hold below mentioned area of Land :-
 	Wet Land below 10 Acres.
 Dry Land below 25 Acres.
 Wet and Dry Land under 25 Acres.
 
 Student should be enrolled in any of the following institutions :-
 	Government Institutions.
 Government Aided Institutions.
 Private College Affiliated to State University or Board.
 Day Scholar Student.
 Student of College Attached Hostels.
 Student of Department Attached Hostels.
 
 No Member of the Family should be in Government Services or a receipent of Pension.
 No Member of the Family should be a Income Tax Payer.
 Ineligibility
 The following students are not eligible to avail the benefit under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 	Student studying in Deemed or Private University.
 Student studying through Distance Learning abd Correspondence Course.
 Students enrolled under Management, Sports or NRI Quota.
 Students studying PG Courses in Private College.
 Student having Four Wheeler in their house.
 If there is a tax payer in a family.
 If Student's family owns a property having more than 1500 Square Feet of built up area.
 
 Eligible Courses
 The following courses are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 
 B.Tech.
 B. Pharmacy.
 ITI.
 Polytechnic.
 B.Ed.
 M.Tech.
 M.Pharmacy.
 MBA.
 Any Other Degree Course.
 Any Other PG Course.

Ineligibility
 The following students are not eligible to avail the benefit under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 	Student studying in Deemed or Private University.
 Student studying through Distance Learning abd Correspondence Course.
 Students enrolled under Management, Sports or NRI Quota.
 Students studying PG Courses in Private College.
 Student having Four Wheeler in their house.
 If there is a tax payer in a family.
 If Student's family owns a property having more than 1500 Square Feet of built up area.
 
 Eligible Courses
 The following courses are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 
 B.Tech.
 B. Pharmacy.
 ITI.
 Polytechnic.
 B.Ed.
 M.Tech.
 M.Pharmacy.
 MBA.
 Any Other Degree Course.
 Any Other PG Course.
 
 Documents Required
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Rice Card or Income Certificate.
 College Admission Details.
 Below mentioned declarations :-
 	No Government Employee or Pensioner.
 Non-Taxpayer.
 No Four Wheeler.
 No Urban Property beyond 1500 Square Feet.
 No Agriculture Land beyond Prescribed Limit.
 
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Student only need to apply for Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Student applied under Jagananna Vidya Deevena Scheme are automatically eligible for the financial assistance under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Features of the Scheme
 Financial Assistance under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme will be provided to Students for the food and hostel expenses.
 In case of demise of student's mother, the financial assistance will be credited in the account of natural guardian of the student.
 75% Attendance is mandatory for the student for release of the amount.
 If student has below mentioned vehicle in their home then they are eligible under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-
 	Taxies.
 Tractors.
 Autos.
 
 Students having Sanitory Worker in their family is eligible under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Amount will be transferred only in the bank account of student's mother.
 Students studying from ITI to Ph.D are eligible under this scheme.
 Application of the student is subject to renewal every year.
 Residents of Andhra Pradesh studying in other Telangana or Other State are also eligible to avail the benefit under Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme.
 Application Process of Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme
 Following are the Application process of the Student under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Scheme :-

        " Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Students belonging to the below mentioned category :-
 				Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 
 
 Benefits
 
 100 % Tution Fees will be Paid by the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 				(Student who got Admission in World Top 100 Universities).
 50 % Tution Fees or Rs. 50 Lakh will be Paid by the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 				(Student who got Admission in World Top 101 to 200 Universities).
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Social Welfare, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Online through JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Introduction
 Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme is the flagship scheme of the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started for the welfare of students who want to pursue their higher studies from abroad.
 The main aim behind launching this to encourage students to pursue their higher studies from worlds best education institutions.
 Andhra Pradesh's Department of Social Welfare is the nodal department of this Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Under Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will bear the tution fees of those students who got admission in worlds top 200 universities.
 The financial assistance to student will be provided through following ways :-
 	100 % Tution Fees will be paid by the Government if Student got admission in top 100 Universities of the World.
 50 % Tution Fees or Rs. 50 Lakh (whichever is less) will be paid by the Government if Student got admission in top 101 to 200 Universities of the World.
 
 Only students belonging to SC, ST, BC, EBC including Kapu and Minority category are eligible under Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevna Scheme.
 Only top 200 universities in the world with QS rank are eligible to take admission.
 Scholarship Amount will be paid to students in four instalments.
 The financial assistance will be given to only those candidates who are willing to pursue Post Graduation Course, Ph.D Course and MBBS Course from Foreign Universities.
 Student can apply for Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme through JnanBhumi Portal of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will be provided under under Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 University Rank
 Financial Assistance
 1 to 100
 Full Tution Fees will be Paid by Andhra Pradesh Government.
 101 to 200
 50 % Tution Fees or Rs. 50 Lakh, Whichever is Less.
 Eligibility
 Student should be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Maximum Age of the Student should be 35 Years.
 Family Income should not be more than Rs.

50 Lakh, Whichever is Less.
 Eligibility
 Student should be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Maximum Age of the Student should be 35 Years.
 Family Income should not be more than Rs. 8 Lakhs per year.
 Student should be belong to any of the below mentioned category :-
 	Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Backward Class.
 Economically Backward Class.
 Kapu.
 Minority.
 
 Student must have secure below mentioned marks percentage :-
 	60 % Marks in Graduation for Post Graduate Course.
 60 % Marks in Post Graduation for Ph.D Course.
 60 % Marks in Intermediate or Equivalent Examination for MBBS Course.
 
 Valid Scorecard of below mentioned Exams :-
 	TOEFL.
 IELTS.
 GRE.
 GMAT.
 
 Eligible Courses
 The following courses are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme :-
 
 Any Post Graduate Course.
 Ph.D Course.
 MBBS Course.
 
 Documents Required
 Caste Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Ration Card. (If Available)
 Birth Certificate.
 10th Class Marksheet/Certificate.
 Aadhar Card.
 Nativity Certificate.
 Last Qualifying Examination Certificate.
 Unconditional Offer Letter from Foreign University.
 NEET Scorecard. (Only for MBBS Student)
 TOEFL/ IELTS/ GRE/ GMAT Scorecard.
 Passport Size Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 Bank Account Details.
 Self Certification of No Financial Assistance is availing from other sources.
 How to Apply
 Applicant has to visit JnanaBhumi Portal to apply for Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Click on Login and choose Citizen Login.
 Enter your Aadhar Number.
 Portal will send OTP for Aadhar Verification.
 After verification select "Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme" in Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the required details and upload the asked document and click on submit.
 Once the application submitted it will forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.
 Field verification will be done by the officials and upload their recommendations on the portal.
 Students have to personally appear in front of the State Level Selection Committee.
 After that the list of eligible and ineligible students will be in all secretariats.
 Course fee will be transferred through Aadhar Enabled Payment System in the bank account through Installements.
 Features of the Scheme
 Only one student per family are eligible under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena Scheme.
 Those students who failed to appear before the State Level Selection Committee are not considered for selection.
 For PG Courses, the Financial Assistance will be provided in four instalments :-
 	1st Installment will be paid upon production of Landing Permit or Immigration Card.
 2nd Installment will be paid upon production of 1st semester or term result.
 3rd Installment will be paid upon production of 2nd semester or term result.
 4th Installment will be paid after successful completion of 4th semester.
 
 Student has to clear TOEFL, IELTS, GRE, GMAT Examination.

 Dr.

YSR Aarogyasri Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme.
 Launched on
 01.04.2007.
 Benefits
 
 Free Health Insurance of Rs. 5 Lakh per Family.
 Free Treatment for Listed Therapies.
 Free Consultation, Medication and Tests.
 Free Food and Transport.
 Post Treatment Sustenance Allowance.
 
 Implementing Agency
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Health Care Trust, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Offline.
 Introduction
 Andhra Pradesh Government started Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme to provide health insurance for the people of the State.
 Scheme is implemented through PPP (Public Private Partnership) model for better health services.
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme which was earlier known as Aarogyasri Scheme is implemented by Aarogyasri Health Care Trust, Government of Andhra Pradesh and provides universal coverage of health.
 The scheme provides cashless health benefit cover for 3255 Listed Therapies (surgeries, procedures and medical treatments) in 31 categories.
 Scheme shall provide financial security against health expenses and quality health care through identified network of health care providers (Network Hospitals).
 Scheme shall benefit 129.44 lakh poor families of Andhra Pradesh.
 Under the scheme eligible family is provided with financial insurance cover of Rs.5,00,000/- per year.
 Scheme provides cashless treatment for listed therapies through free investigation, diagnostic test, food, medicines, transport facility and follow-ups.
 The pre-authorization for treatment is given within 24 hours by the Trust and claims are paid to network hospitals by Trust.
 Out-patients shall be provided free screening and consultation in health camps and network hospitals under scheme.
 In-patients shall be provided treatment  for ‘Listed Therapies’ through network hospitals from time of reporting till 10 days post discharge medication. In case of complications 30 days post discharge medication.
 Implementation Process
 A patient can access the treatment through various modes:
 	Directly visiting nearby government hospital or listed private hospitals and approach Aarogya Mithra counter.
 PHC (Primary Health Centres) referrals.
 Health camp referrals.
 Call Centre (104) registration.
 Emergency admission.
 
 Biometric registration of patient will be done in network hospitals by Vaidya Mithra.
 After evaluation of patient, if found suffering from Listed Therapies, MEDCO (Medical Co-ordinator) shall submit for pre-authorization and upload relevant documents.
 Network hospital will provide complete treatment after pre-authorization. Enhancement of package price is possible in exceptional cases.
 Claim by Network hospital will be done after 10 days of satisfactory discharge.
 Trust shall settle claims from hospitals only for diseases mentioned in the package.
 The following diagram shows the implementation process.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Financial Insurance cover of Rs.5,00,000/- per year.
 Below mentioned services will be provided free of cost after admission in hospital :-
 	Free Admission.
 Doctor Consultation. (Every Day).
 Nursing Services. (Per Day).
 Necessary Medical Tests.
 Necessary Medicines.
 Surgery (Operation) or Treament.
 Breakfast, Lunch. (Two Meals).
 Medicine for 10 Days after Discharge.
 Necessary Charges for Going Home after Discharge.
 
 Compensation Loss of Wages @Rs.225/- per day subjected to a maximum of Rs. 5000/- per month before discharge from hospital.
 Allowance of Rs.5000/- to pregnant women for normal and caesarean section deliveries.
 Eligibility for the Scheme
 Should be resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Rice Card Holders.
 Families eligiible for below mentioned card are also eligible under Dr. YSR Aarogyasri :-
 	YSR Pension Kanuka.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 For Other Families below mentioned criteria will be apply for eligibility :-
 	Landowners holding less than 12 Acre of Wet Land or less than 35 Acre of Dry Land or Total of less than 35 Acres both Wet and Dry Land.
 Annual Income less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Families filing income tax return upto the annual income of Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Any Employee other than permanent Government Employee or Pensioner whose annual income is less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Municipal Tax payee households residing in the area less than 3000 Sq.

YSR Aarogyasri :-
 	YSR Pension Kanuka.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 For Other Families below mentioned criteria will be apply for eligibility :-
 	Landowners holding less than 12 Acre of Wet Land or less than 35 Acre of Dry Land or Total of less than 35 Acres both Wet and Dry Land.
 Annual Income less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Families filing income tax return upto the annual income of Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Any Employee other than permanent Government Employee or Pensioner whose annual income is less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Municipal Tax payee households residing in the area less than 3000 Sq. Ft.
 Families not haing more than one personal car.
 
 Essential documents needed for Scheme
 Aadhar Card.
 Income Certificate.
 Income Tax Returns.
 Address Proof.
 Mobile Number.
 Any one of the below mentioned card :-
 	Rice Card.
 YSR Pension Kanuka Card.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 How to apply for Scheme
 There is no need to apply for the Scheme separately as all the BPL /Ration Card holders whose record is maintained by Civil Supplies Department of Government of Andhra Pradesh in the BPL database are eligible to avail the benefits of the Scheme.
 The eligible person can directly visit nearby Government/ Empanelled Hospital where he will be assisted by Aarogya Mithra/ Vaidhya Mithra at Aarogyasri Helpdesk in Hospital and will be given required treatment and guidance needed by patient.
 Treatments/Facilities under Dr. YSR Arogyasri Scheme

 Pediatrics.

YSR Aarogyasri Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme.
 Launched on
 01.04.2007.
 Benefits
 
 Free Health Insurance of Rs. 5 Lakh per Family.
 Free Treatment for Listed Therapies.
 Free Consultation, Medication and Tests.
 Free Food and Transport.
 Post Treatment Sustenance Allowance.
 
 Implementing Agency
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Health Care Trust, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Offline.
 Introduction
 Andhra Pradesh Government started Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme to provide health insurance for the people of the State.
 Scheme is implemented through PPP (Public Private Partnership) model for better health services.
 Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Scheme which was earlier known as Aarogyasri Scheme is implemented by Aarogyasri Health Care Trust, Government of Andhra Pradesh and provides universal coverage of health.
 The scheme provides cashless health benefit cover for 3255 Listed Therapies (surgeries, procedures and medical treatments) in 31 categories.
 Scheme shall provide financial security against health expenses and quality health care through identified network of health care providers (Network Hospitals).
 Scheme shall benefit 129.44 lakh poor families of Andhra Pradesh.
 Under the scheme eligible family is provided with financial insurance cover of Rs.5,00,000/- per year.
 Scheme provides cashless treatment for listed therapies through free investigation, diagnostic test, food, medicines, transport facility and follow-ups.
 The pre-authorization for treatment is given within 24 hours by the Trust and claims are paid to network hospitals by Trust.
 Out-patients shall be provided free screening and consultation in health camps and network hospitals under scheme.
 In-patients shall be provided treatment  for ‘Listed Therapies’ through network hospitals from time of reporting till 10 days post discharge medication. In case of complications 30 days post discharge medication.
 Implementation Process
 A patient can access the treatment through various modes:
 	Directly visiting nearby government hospital or listed private hospitals and approach Aarogya Mithra counter.
 PHC (Primary Health Centres) referrals.
 Health camp referrals.
 Call Centre (104) registration.
 Emergency admission.
 
 Biometric registration of patient will be done in network hospitals by Vaidya Mithra.
 After evaluation of patient, if found suffering from Listed Therapies, MEDCO (Medical Co-ordinator) shall submit for pre-authorization and upload relevant documents.
 Network hospital will provide complete treatment after pre-authorization. Enhancement of package price is possible in exceptional cases.
 Claim by Network hospital will be done after 10 days of satisfactory discharge.
 Trust shall settle claims from hospitals only for diseases mentioned in the package.
 The following diagram shows the implementation process.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Financial Insurance cover of Rs.5,00,000/- per year.
 Below mentioned services will be provided free of cost after admission in hospital :-
 	Free Admission.
 Doctor Consultation. (Every Day).
 Nursing Services. (Per Day).
 Necessary Medical Tests.
 Necessary Medicines.
 Surgery (Operation) or Treament.
 Breakfast, Lunch. (Two Meals).
 Medicine for 10 Days after Discharge.
 Necessary Charges for Going Home after Discharge.
 
 Compensation Loss of Wages @Rs.225/- per day subjected to a maximum of Rs. 5000/- per month before discharge from hospital.
 Allowance of Rs.5000/- to pregnant women for normal and caesarean section deliveries.
 Eligibility for the Scheme
 Should be resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Rice Card Holders.
 Families eligiible for below mentioned card are also eligible under Dr. YSR Aarogyasri :-
 	YSR Pension Kanuka.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 For Other Families below mentioned criteria will be apply for eligibility :-
 	Landowners holding less than 12 Acre of Wet Land or less than 35 Acre of Dry Land or Total of less than 35 Acres both Wet and Dry Land.
 Annual Income less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Families filing income tax return upto the annual income of Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Any Employee other than permanent Government Employee or Pensioner whose annual income is less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Municipal Tax payee households residing in the area less than 3000 Sq.

YSR Aarogyasri :-
 	YSR Pension Kanuka.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 For Other Families below mentioned criteria will be apply for eligibility :-
 	Landowners holding less than 12 Acre of Wet Land or less than 35 Acre of Dry Land or Total of less than 35 Acres both Wet and Dry Land.
 Annual Income less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Families filing income tax return upto the annual income of Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Any Employee other than permanent Government Employee or Pensioner whose annual income is less than or upto Rs. 5 Lakh.
 Municipal Tax payee households residing in the area less than 3000 Sq. Ft.
 Families not haing more than one personal car.
 
 Essential documents needed for Scheme
 Aadhar Card.
 Income Certificate.
 Income Tax Returns.
 Address Proof.
 Mobile Number.
 Any one of the below mentioned card :-
 	Rice Card.
 YSR Pension Kanuka Card.
 Jagananna Vidya Deevena Card.
 Jagananna Vasathi Deevena Card.
 
 How to apply for Scheme
 There is no need to apply for the Scheme separately as all the BPL /Ration Card holders whose record is maintained by Civil Supplies Department of Government of Andhra Pradesh in the BPL database are eligible to avail the benefits of the Scheme.
 The eligible person can directly visit nearby Government/ Empanelled Hospital where he will be assisted by Aarogya Mithra/ Vaidhya Mithra at Aarogyasri Helpdesk in Hospital and will be given required treatment and guidance needed by patient.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme.
 Lanched on
 2014.
 Benefits
 Monthly Pension ranging from Rs. 2750/- to Rs. 10,000/-.
 Nodal Department
 Department of Panchayati Raj and Rural Development, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Offline through Application Form.
 Introduction
 YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme is the major welfare scheme of the Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started to provide the financial assitance to the needy people in the form of pension.
 Department of Panchayati Raj and Rural Development is the Nodal Department of YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme.
 Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty, Andhra Pradesh is the Implementing Agency of this Scheme.
 YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme is one of the Welfare Scheme under Navarathnalu Project of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Under YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide monthly pension ranging from Rs. 2750/- to Rs. 10,000/-.
 Amount of Monthly Pension varies according to the category of people which they belong.
 Only the mentioned categories such as Old Age, Widow, Toddy Tappers etc are eligible to avail the benefit of YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme.
 Eligible people can apply through Application to avail the benefit.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Follwoing Financial Amount of Pension will be provided to Eligibile People :-
 Category
 Amount
 			Per Month
 Old Age Person
 Rs. 2750/-
 Widow
 Rs. 2750/-
 Toddy Tappers
 Rs. 2750/-
 Weavers
 Rs. 2750/-

 Rs. 2750/-

 Rs. 2750/-

 Rs. 2750/-
 Traditional Cobblers
 Rs. 2750/-

 Rs. 3000/-

 Rs. 3000/-
 Dappu Artists
 Rs. 3000/-

 Rs. 10,000/-
 Eligibility
 Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Person should be belong to below mentioned category :-
 	Old Age Person.
 Widow.
 Toddy Tappers.
 Weavers.
 Single Women.
 Fishermen.
 ART (PLHIV) Person.
 Traditional Cobbler.
 Transgender.
 Dappu Artists.
 Person Affected with Chronic Kidney Disease.
 
 Total Family Income should be :-
 	Less than Rs. 10,000/- in Rural Areas.
 Less than Rs. 12,000/- in Urban Areas.
 
 Total Land Holding should be :-
 	Less than 3 Acre of Wet Land, OR
 Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land, OR
 Total 10 Acre, both Wet and Dry.
 
 No person in a family should be Government Employee or Government Pensioner.
 No Family Should own Four Wheeler.
 Monthly Electricity Consumption should be below less than 300 Units.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Should Own less than 1000 Sq.

 Documents Required

 Mobile Number.
 The following documents will be needed as per applicant requirement :-
 	Husband Death Certificate. (For Widow Applicant).
 Husband Aadhar Card. (For Widow Applicant).
 SADAREM Certificate. (For Disable Applicant).
 Toddy Tapper Card. (For Toddy Tapper Applicants).
 Weavers Card. (For Weaver Applicant).
 Unmarried Affidavit. (For Single Women).
 Medical Certificate of HIV-AIDS Applicant.
 6 Months Certificate for ART Pensioners.
 
 How to Apply
 Applicant can apply for YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme through Application.
 Application Form will be collected from the Office of Village and Ward Secreteriats.
 Duly filled Application Form attached with the required documents will be submitted in the Office of Village and Ward Secreteriats.
 Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare Development Secretary will upload the received applications on YSR Pension Kanuka Portal.
 Accepted Applications will be set to the Mandal Parishad Development Office for further process.
 Once the application is verified from all level, then the amount of pension will be transferred directly into the beneficiary account.
 Features of the Scheme
 Families having below mentioned vehicles are eligible to apply under YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme :-
 	Taxi.
 Tractor.
 Autos.
 
 Only one pension will be provided in the family.
 More than one pension will be allowed in the below mentioned scenario :-
 	Family having Disabled Person with 40% or more Disability.
 Dialysis Patient or Severe Mental Retardation or PLHIV Patient.
 
 Government extended the financial assistance to the people suffering from :-
 	Thalassemia Major Cases.
 Sickle Cell Diseases.
 Severe Hemophilia.
 Bilateral Elephantiasis.
 Paralysis.
 Severe Muscular Dystrophy.
 Chronic Kidney Disease Patients.
 Multi Deformity Leprosy.
 Kidney/Liver/Heart Transplant.
 
 Application sanction process will be mandatorily completed within 72 hours from the date of receipt of application.

        " YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme.
 Launched on
 1 October 2022.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance for Marriage ranging from Rs. 40,000/- to Rs. 1,50,000/-.
 Nodal Department
 Social Welfare Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 
 Offline through Application Form.
 Online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 
 Introduction
 YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme is the financial assistance scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started from 1st of October 2022.
 The main objective behind launching YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme is to provide financial assistance to the newly wed couple of the Andhra Pradesh.
 This scheme is also called Andhra Pradesh Marriage Financial Assistance Scheme.
 Under this scheme Andhra Pradesh Government will provide financial assistance ranging from Rs. 40,000/- to Rs. 1,50,000/- to the eligible married couple according to their category.
 This will help in meeting the expenses incurred on their marriage.
 Applicant will apply under YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme through :-
 	Offline Application Form.
 Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 
 It is mandatory to apply under YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme within 60 days of marriage.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Follwoing Financial Amount will be provided for the Marriage of Eligible People :-
 Category
 Financial Assistance
 			for Marriage
 Schedule Caste
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 Schedule Caste - Inter Caste
 Rs. 1,20,000/-
 Schedule Tribe
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 Schedule Tribe - Inter Caste
 Rs. 1,20,000/-
 Backward Classes
 Rs. 50,000/-
 Backward Classes - Inter Caste
 Rs. 75,000/-
 Minorities(Other than Muslims)
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 Differently Abled
 Rs. 1,50,000/-
 BOCWWB
 Rs. 40,000/-
 Eligibility
 Age of Bride and Groom should be :-
 	Bride :- 18 Years Completed.
 Bride Groom :- 21 Years Completed.
 
 Bride and Bride Groom must have passes class 10th.
 Marriage should be held on or after 01-10-2022.
 Total Family Income of Bride and Bride Groom should be :-
 	Less than Rs. 10,000/- in Rural Areas.
 Less than Rs. 12,000/- in Urban Areas.
 
 Total Land Holding of Family of Bride and Bride Groom should be :-
 	Less than 3 Acre of Wet Land, OR
 Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land, OR
 Total 10 Acre, both Wet and Dry.
 
 No person in a family should be a :-
 	Government Employee or Government Pensioner.
 PSU Employee.
 
 No Family Should own Four Wheeler.
 Monthly Electricity Consumption should be below less than 300 Units.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Should Own less than 1000 Sq. Ft of Residential or Commercial Area.
 Categories Eligible under YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme
 Married Couple belonging to below mentioned categories are eligible to apply under YSR Kalyanamasthu Scheme :-
 
 Schedule Caste
 Schedule Tribe
 Backward Classes
 Below Mentioned Minorities :-
 				Sikhs
 Buddhists
 Christians
 Jains
 Parsis
 
 Differently Abled
 Building and Other Construction
 				Workers Registered with Welfare

 Name of the Scheme

 Introduction
 The scheme was launched by Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh Y.S.Jagan Mohan Reddy.
 The scheme is to give financial support to those who are not able to bear the expenses of marriage.
 YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme will also prevent child marriage.as well as the dropout from the school.
 Applicant belongs to Muslim Minority Community are eligible to apply under YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme.

 It is mandatory to apply under YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme within 60 days of marriage.

 Applicant should belong to Muslim Community.

 	Bride :-18 Years completed.
 Bride Groom :-21 years completed.
 
 Bride or Groom must have passed class 10th.
 Only 1st Marriage are eligible, Except in case of widow.
 Marriage should be held on or after 01-10-2022.
 Total Family Income of Bride and Bride Groom should be :-
 	Less than Rs. 10,000/- in Rural Areas.
 Less than Rs. 12,000/- in Urban Areas.
 
 Total Land Holding of Family of Bride and Bride Groom should be :-
 	Less than 3 Acre of Wet Land, OR
 Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land, OR
 Total 10 Acre, both Wet and Dry.
 
 No person in a family should be a :-
 	Government Employee or Government Pensioner.
 PSU Employee.
 
 No Family Should own Four Wheeler.
 Monthly Electricity Consumption should be below less than 300 Units.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Should Own less than 1000 Sq. Ft of Residential or Commercial Area.

 Aadhar Number of the Bride and Groom.
 Marriage Certificate.
 Photo and Wedding Card.
 Mobile Number of Both .
 Email.
 Birth Proof.
 Cast Certificate.
 Income Certificate.

 10th Marksheet or Certificate.
 Aadhar Card of Father /Mother /Guardian.
 Amount of Assistance
 Financial Assistance of Rs.

 Aadhar Card of Father /Mother /Guardian.
 Amount of Assistance
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/- (One Lakh ) will be provided by the Government of Andhra Pradesh for the Marriage of Muslim Girls.
 How to Apply
 Online through Navasakam Beneficiary
 			Management Portal
 
 Applicant has to visit Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal to Apply for YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme.
 Click on Login and Select Citizen Login.
 Enter Your Aadhar Number and after that portal will verify it by sending OTP.
 After Aadhar Verification new page will be opened, now select YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme from Services List.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and upload all the required documents on the portal.
 After Clicking on Submit, portal generated the Application Number.
 Submitted Application will be forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare Secretary.
 Officials will then conduct the field verification and forward their report to Mandal Parishad Development Officer.
 Mandal Parishad Development Officer verified the application and forward it to Project Director of District Rural Development Agency.
 After that the final list of eligible and ineligible applicant will be published in all secretariat.
 Eligible Applicant will receive the financial assistance in their bank account through Aadhar Enabled Payment System.
 
 Offline through Application Form
 
 Applicant can also apply for YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme through Application Form.
 Application Form will be collected from the secretariat office.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and attached the required documents with it.
 Submit the Form with Documents in Secretariat Office.
 The DA/WEDPS will upload the documents in the Navasakam Beneficiary Portal.
 Submitted Application will be forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare Secretary.
 Officials will then conduct the field verfiication and forward their report to Mandal Parishad Development Officer.
 Mandal Parishad Development Officer verified the application and forward it to Project Director of District Rural Development Agency.
 After that the final list of eligible and ineligible applicant will be published in all secretariat.
 Eligible Applicant will receive the financial assistance in their bank account through Aadhar Enabled Payment System.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 Income should be less then Rs. 10,000/- per month in Rural Area and Rs. 12,000/- per month in Urban Area .
 Family of Applicant should not have 4 wheeler.
 Taxis,Tractors, Autos are exempted under YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme.
 Field Verification done by Welfare Education Assistant or Ward Welfare Secretary are as follows :-
 	Visit Home of Bride Residence for Marriage Confirmation.
 Verification through Neighbor.
 Picture with Bride and Groom.
 
 Consumption Of Monthly Electricity should be less then 300 units .
 Widows are also eligible to apply under YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme.
 Marriage conducted after 01-10-2022 are eligible for financial assistance under YSR Shaadi Tohfa Scheme.
