        " Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme.

": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme.
 Launched on
 2020.
 Benefits
 Free of Cost House to People.
 Nodal Agency
 Andhra Pradesh State Housing Corporation.
 Mode of Application
 Offline through Application Form.
 Introduction
 Pedalandariki Illu Scheme is the flagship scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started in the year 2020.
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Scheme is also known as Free Housing Scheme of Andhra Pradesh.
 It was a part of Navaratnalu project of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Andhra Pradesh State Housing Corporation is the Nodal Agency responsible for implementing this scheme.
 Under Pedalandariki Illu Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide free of cost houses to poor people of the state.
 Government will decide to deliver 25,00,000 houses to the people in the initial phase of this scheme.
 Scheme will be operational in both Rural and Urban Areas of Andhra Pradesh.
 Benefits of Pedalandariki Illu Scheme will be provided in two phases :-
 	In First Phase. the Housing Patta or House Site will be allotted to the beneficiaries.
 In Second Phase, House will be Constructed on the allotted House Site.
 
 Construction will be borne by the government of Andhra Pradesh.
 The total cost of the built houses will be Rs. 1,80,000/-.
 All the eligible people can apply for Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme though Application Form.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Free Housing Site or Housing Patta
 Free of Cost Construction of House.
 90 Days of Work under MGNREGS.
 Eligibility
 Eligibility under Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme are as follows :-
 Rural Area
 
 Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Should have White Ration Card or belongs to Below Poverty Line.
 Should not have any Own House or House Site.
 Should hold below mentioned amount of Land :-
 				Not more than Ac.2.5 cts of Wet Land.
 Not more than Ac.10.00 cts of Dry Land.
 
 Should not be covered under any previous Housing Scheme.
 
 Urban Area
 
 Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Should not have any Own House or House Site.
 Should hold below mentioned amount of Land :-
 				Not more than Ac.2.5 cts of Wet Land.
 Not more than Ac.10.00 cts of Dry Land.
 
 Should not be covered under any previous Housing Scheme.
 Annual Income should not be more than Rs.

3,00,000/-.
 
 Documents Required
 Resident Proof of Andhra Pradesh.
 White Ration Card.
 Aadhar Card.
 No House Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Caste Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Applicant apply for Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme through Application Form.
 Application Form will be collected from the Village or Ward Secretariat office.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and attached the required documents with it.
 Submit the Form with Documents in Village/ Ward Secretariat Office.
 Village or Ward Volunteers will check the application form and confirms the eligibility of the applicant.
 Initial eligible list of beneficiaries will be published in the office of Village or Ward Secretariat.
 Gram/Ward Sabha will finalises the list of eligible beneficiaries.
 Then the final list of the beneficiaries will be forwarded to District Collector for final approval.
 Final List of the beneficiaries will again be published in the office of Village/Ward Secretariat.
 After that the House Site Patta will be issued in the name of the female in the family and construction of houses will be resume soon after allocation.
 Features of the Scheme
 Only government land will be used for allotment of land and construction of houses.
 90 days of work will also provided under Pedalandariki Illu Scheme.
 The area of constructed house will be as follows :-
 	Plinth Area :- 340 Square Feet.
 272 Square Feet for Hall, Bedroom, Kitchen, and Toilet.
 68 Square Feet for Verandah.
 
 Illu Scheme passbook will be issued to the beneficiaries to record cash and material received.
 Once the houses constructed in a locality, they will be called as YSR Jagananna Colonies.
 The construction of more than 13 lakh houses has been completed under the Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu scheme.
 Important Links
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme Application Form.
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme Beneficiary Search.
 Andhra Pradesh State Housing Corporation Portal.
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme Guidelines.
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme FAQs.
 Contact Details
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme Helpline Number :- 1902.
 Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme Helpdesk Email :- helpdesk.apshcl@apcfss.in.
 Andhra Pradesh State Housing Corporation,
 	Plot No : 11 & 12 ,
 	Behind BSNL Telephone Exchange ,
 	Auto Nagar, Vijayawada
 	Andhra Pradesh,
 	520007.

 No House Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Caste Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Applicant apply for Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu Scheme through Application Form.
 Application Form will be collected from the Village or Ward Secretariat office.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and attached the required documents with it.
 Submit the Form with Documents in Village/ Ward Secretariat Office.
 Village or Ward Volunteers will check the application form and confirms the eligibility of the applicant.
 Initial eligible list of beneficiaries will be published in the office of Village or Ward Secretariat.
 Gram/Ward Sabha will finalises the list of eligible beneficiaries.
 Then the final list of the beneficiaries will be forwarded to District Collector for final approval.
 Final List of the beneficiaries will again be published in the office of Village/Ward Secretariat.
 After that the House Site Patta will be issued in the name of the female in the family and construction of houses will be resume soon after allocation.
 Features of the Scheme
 Only government land will be used for allotment of land and construction of houses.
 90 days of work will also provided under Pedalandariki Illu Scheme.
 The area of constructed house will be as follows :-
 	Plinth Area :- 340 Square Feet.
 272 Square Feet for Hall, Bedroom, Kitchen, and Toilet.
 68 Square Feet for Verandah.
 
 Illu Scheme passbook will be issued to the beneficiaries to record cash and material received.
 Once the houses constructed in a locality, they will be called as YSR Jagananna Colonies.
 The construction of more than 13 lakh houses has been completed under the Andhra Pradesh Pedalandariki Illu scheme.

": "Overview Of The Scheme
 Name of the Scheme
 Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme.
 Launched On
 9 January 2019.
 Benefits
 Financial Support to Mother for the Education of her Childrens
 Amount of Assistance
 Rs. 15,000/- Per Annum.
 Mode of Apply
 Offline.
 Introduction
 Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme is the prominent scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It is a part of Andhra Pradesh Government's Navaratnalu Programme.
 It was started in the year 2019.
 The main objective behind launching Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Mother to educate her child or children.
 This will help the students to pursue their education without keeping education expenses in their mind.
 Under Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide financial assistance of Rs. 15,000/- to the mother of children's for their education.
 Only those mothers are eligible whose children are studying from class 1st to class 12th.
 Children studying in below mentioned schools are eligible :-
 	Government Schools.
 Private Aided Schools.
 Private Unaided Schools.
 Residential Schools etc.
 
 There is no bar on number of children in Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will be provided to the Mother under Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme :-
 	Rs. 15,000/- per annum for the Education of her Children.
 
 Eligibility Conditions
 Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Children of Applicant should be studying in Class 1st to Class 12th.
 Should be a holder of White Ration Card/ Rice Card.
 Family Income should be :-
 	Less than Rs. 10,000/- per month in Rural Areas.
 Less than Rs. 12,000/- per month in Urban Areas.
 
 Total Land Holding should be :-
 	Less than 3 Acre of Wet Land, OR
 Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land, OR
 Total 10 Acre, both Wet and Dry.
 
 No person in a family should be a :-
 	Government Employee or Government Pensioner.
 PSU Employee.
 
 No Family Should own Four Wheeler.
 Monthly Electricity Consumption should be below less than 300 Units.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Should own less than 1000 Sq.

10,000/- per month in Rural Areas.
 Less than Rs. 12,000/- per month in Urban Areas.
 
 Total Land Holding should be :-
 	Less than 3 Acre of Wet Land, OR
 Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land, OR
 Total 10 Acre, both Wet and Dry.
 
 No person in a family should be a :-
 	Government Employee or Government Pensioner.
 PSU Employee.
 
 No Family Should own Four Wheeler.
 Monthly Electricity Consumption should be below less than 300 Units.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Should own less than 1000 Sq. Ft of Residential or Commercial Area.
 Documents Required
 Resident Proof of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Number of Mother or Guardian.
 Aadhar Card of Child.
 Student ID Card.
 Caste Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Ration Card/ BPL Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 There is no need to apply anywhere.
 School Education Department and Board of Intermediate will collect and validate the data of eligible students from childinfo or UDISE.
 After that 6 steps validation will be done to check the eligibility of students.
 Eligible and Ineligible list of beneficiaries will be displayed at village secretariat for social audit.
 Welfare & Education Assistant or Ward Education & Data Processing Secretary will prepare a final list of the beneficiaries.
 Then the final list will be forwarded to District Collector for approval.
 Ekyc of Mothers beneficiary will be done by Village Volunteers or WEA or WEDP officials through biometrics.
 Once the kyc is done, the payment will be transferred to mothers bank account in the month of January every year.
 Features of the Scheme
 Family of Government Sanitary Worker are eligible to apply under Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme.
 Families having below mentioned vehicles are eligible to apply :-
 	Taxi.
 Tractor.
 Autos.
 
 75% Attendance of child in school is mandatory under Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme.
 If the mother of the student is not alive then the financial assistance will to the guardian of the student.
 Orphans or Street Children who are admitted in schools are also eligible for financial assistance.
 Aadhar Card of Mother is mandatory to avail the benefit of Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme.
 The financial assistance will be transferred to the mother's bank account in the month of January next year.
 Application Process of Jagananna Amma Vodi Scheme

 	apcse@ap.gov.in.

        " YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.

": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance to Farmers in case of Crop Loss.
 Nodal Department
 Agriculture & Cooperation Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 
 Offline through Application Form.
 Online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 
 Introduction
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme is the prominent scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government for the welfare of Farmers.
 It was started in the the year 2019.
 Agriculture & Cooperation Department of Andhra Pradesh Government is the nodal department of this scheme.
 The main objective behind launching this scheme is to provide the financial assistance to farmers in case of their crop loss due to adverse weather conditions.
 This scheme is also called Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme.
 All the Farmers, Cultivators, Sharecroppers and Tenant Farmers are eligible under YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.
 Beneficiary has to pay Rs. 1/- as a token amount for registration under YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.
 Now the YSR Free Insurance Scheme is divided into Yield Base Crop Insurance and Weather Based Crop Insurance.
 Yield Based Crop Insurance claims will be settled on the basis of Post Harvest Losses.
 Whereas Weather Based Crop Insurance claims will be settled on the basis of weather data furnished by the appropriate authority.
 Farmers will avail the benefit of YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme by registering themselves through :-
 	Rythu Bandhu Kendra's/ Meeseva Centres by submitting Application Form.
 Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal by registering themselves.
 
 Benefits of Scheme
 Financial Assistance to the Farmers in case of Crop Loss.
 Eligibility
 Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Should be Cultivator/ Farmer.
 Sharecroppers and Tenants Farmers are also Eligible.
 Documents Required
 Aadhar Card.
 Income Certificate.
 Proof of Residence.
 BPL Certificate. (If Applicable)
 Record of Rights.
 Land Possession Certificate.
 Document Related to Cultivation of Crops.
 Bank Account Details.
 Adverse Weather Incidence under YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme
 Rainfall :-
 	Deficit Rainfall.
 Excess Rainfall.
 Unseasonal Rainfall.
 Rainy Days.
 Dry Spells.
 Dry Days.
 
 Temperature :-
 	High Temperature.
 Low Temperature.
 
 Relative Humidity.
 Wind Speed.
 Cyclones.
 A Combination of the Above.
 How to Apply
 Online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal
 
 Applicant has to visit Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal to Apply for YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.
 Click on Login and Select Citizen Login.
 Enter Your Aadhar Number and after that portal will verify it by sending OTP.
 After Aadhar Verification new page will be opened, now select YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme from Services List.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and upload all the required documents on the portal.
 After Clicking on Submit, portal generated the Application Number.
 Submitted Application will be forwarded to Agriculture Assistant for Verification.
 Village Revenue Officials will then conduct the field verification and forward their report to Mandal Agriculture Officer.
 Mandal Agriculture Officer verified the applications and forward it for the publication in all the secretariats.
 
 Offline through Application Form
 
 Applicant can also apply for YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme through Application Form by submitting it in Rythu Bandhu Kendra's or Meeseva Centers.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and attached the required documents with it.
 Submit the Form with Documents in Rythu Bandhu Kendra's or Meeseva Centers.
 The agents present at center will fill the form online on behalf of the beneficiary.
 Submitted Application will be forwarded to Agriculture Assistant for Verification.
 Village Revenue Officials will then conduct the field verification and forward their report to Mandal Agriculture Officer.
 Mandal Agriculture Officer verified the applications and forward it for the publication in all the secretariats.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme is compulsory for the Loanee Farmers.
 It is a voluntary scheme for Non Loanee Farmers.
 Farmer has to pay the premium of Rs.

1/- to facilitate the electronic tracking.
 No compensation will be paid if loss occurred due to malicious damage.
 More than 44 lakhs farmers registered under YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme.
 Important Links
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme Application Form.
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme Guidelines.
 Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Agriculture & Cooperation Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Contact Details
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme Helpline Number :- 155251.
 YSR Free Crop Insurance Scheme Helpdesk Email :- cropinsurance.ap@gmail.com.
 Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Department Helpdesk Email :- comag@nic.in.
 Department of Agriculture, Government of Andhra Pradesh,
 	Commissioner and Manager of Agriculture, Old Mirchiard,
 	Nallapadu Road, Chutchugunta,
 	Guntur - 522004.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019.
 Benefits

 				3 Pairs of Uniform Cloth.

": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019.
 Benefits
 
 Free of Cost Student Kit will be given to Students which comprises :-
 				3 Pairs of Uniform Cloth. (With Stitching Charges).
 Set of Notebooks.
 Set of Text Books.
 Set of Workbooks.
 Pair of Shoes.
 2 Pair of Socks.
 Belt.
 School Bag.
 
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of School Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 
 Offline through Application Form.
 
 Introduction
 Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme is the flagship scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started in the year 2019.
 Andhra Pradesh's Department of School Education is the nodal department of this scheme.
 The main objective behind launching Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme is to minimize the dropouts and increase the enrollement of children in the schools.
 The tag line of Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme is :-Schooling.......Now a Celebration.
 Under Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide free of cost student kits to students from Class 1st to Class 10th.
 Those student kits comprises 3 pairs of uniform cloths, Set of Notebooks, Workbooks, and Textbooks, Pair of Shoes, 2 Pair of Socks, Belt and School Bag.
 Andhra Pradesh Government will also providing charges for stitching the uniform cloth @ Rs. 40/- per pair.
 All the students studying in Government Management Schools from Class 1st to Class 10th are eligible under Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme.
 Till now more than 43 lakhs student received the student kit under Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme.
 To avail the benefit of Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme, student has to enroll in any of the government management schools.
 Student Kit will only be distributed after the biometric verification of the mother of the student completed by the school.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Free of Cost Student Kit will be provided to Students from Class 1st to Class 10th.
 Student Kit Comprises the following things :-
 	3 Pairs of Uniform Cloth. (With Stitching Charges).
 Set of Notebooks.
 Set of Text Books.
 Set of Workbooks.
 Pair of Shoes.
 2 Pair of Socks.
 Belt.
 School Bag.
 
 Eligibility
 Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Student of Class 1st to Class 10th.
 Student must be studying in one of the following schools :-
 	Government of Andhra Pradesh Schools.
 Mandal Parishad Primary School.
 Zila Praja Parishad Schools.
 Municipal Schools.
 Residential Schools.
 Ashram Schools.
 Government Added Schools.
 Model Schools.
 Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidhyalayas.
 Registered Madaras.
 
 Documents Required
 School Certificate.
 Passport Size Photo.
 Student Identity Card.
 Aadhar Card of Child.
 Aadhar Card of Parents.
 Income Certificate.
 How to Apply
 Beneficiary does not need to apply anywhere to avail the benefits of Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme.
 All the students will be eligible under the Jagananna Vidya Kanuka scheme at the time of admission of the student in the school.
 The student kit will be distributed by the headmaster or principal of the school to the mother of the student.
 It is mandatory to do biometric verification of the student's mother before giving the student kit.
 The student kit will be given to the mother of the student only after the biometric verification is done.
 
 Important Links
 Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme Portal.
 Department of School Education Andhra Pradesh.
 Jagananna Vidya Kanuka Scheme Guidelines.
 Contact Details

 	Sri Anjaneya Towers, Road No. 7-104,
 	B Block, 4th Floor, N.T.T.P.S. Road,
 	Ibrahim Patnam, Krishna District- 521456

 Overview of the Scheme

 YSR Input Subsidy scheme.

 2020.

 Subsidy to Farmers.

 Agricultural Department of Andhra Pradesh.

 Through YSR Input Subsidy Scheme Official Website.
 Intoduction
 YSR Input Subsidy scheme is launched by the Government of Andhra Pradesh in the year 2020.
 YSR Input Subsidy scheme is launched under the leadership of Sri Y.S Jagan Mohan Reddy,
 	Hon'ble Chief minister of Andhra Pradesh.
 YSR Input Subsidy Scheme was launched with noble intention of providing financial security to
 	small scale farmers of andhra pradesh.
 The scheme Provides assistance to small, marginal as well as tenant farmers.
 The scheme had been a great boon to farmers who had suffered crop lass due to natural calamities.
 Under this scheme subsidy of more than 18000 Cr had been provided to farmers so far.
 More than 21 lakhs farmers had been benefited under this scheme.
 Scientific assessment of crop loss based on e-crop data.
 Benefits
 The following benefits are provided under the YSR Input Subsidy Scheme :-
 	Protecting farmers from debt trap.
 Giving compensation for crop loss to farmers by the end of same season itself during which the loss occurred due to natural calamities.
 Subsidy is transferred directly into the bank accounts of farmers.
 
 Eligibility
 The following persons will be eligible under the YSR Input Subsidy Scheme:-
 	Farmer must be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicable to small, marginal and tenant farmers.
 E-Crop booking mandatory.
 
 Documents Required
 Adhaar Card.
 Domocile Certificate.
 Ration Certificate.
 Certificate of Residency.
 How to Apply
 Applicant has to visit Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal to Apply for YSR Input Subsidy Scheme.
 Click on Login and Select Citizen Login.
 Enter Your Aadhar Number and after that portal will verify it by sending OTP.
 After Aadhar Verification new page will be opened, now select YSR Input Subsidy Scheme from Services List.
 Fill the Application Form thoroughly and upload all the required documents on the portal.
 After Clicking on Submit, portal generated the Application Number.
 Submitted Application will be forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare Secretary.
 Officials will then conduct the field verification and forward their report to Mandal Parishad Development Officer.
 Mandal Parishad Development Officer verified the application and forward it to Project Director of District Rural Development Agency.
 After that the final list of eligible and ineligible applicant will be published in all secretariat.
 Eligible Applicant will receive the financial assistance in their bank account through Aadhar Enabled Payment System.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh YSR Cheyutha Scheme.
 Launched on
 12-08-2020.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 75,000/- will be provided to women beneficiaries.
 Nodal Agency
 Andhra Pradesh Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty.
 Nodal Department
 Department of Panchayati Raj and Rural Development, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Online Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Introduction
 YSR Cheyutha Scheme is the major welfare scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was launched on 12-08-2020.
 The main objective behind launching this scheme is to provide financial support to women of Andhra Pradesh to make them independent.
 Financial Assistance will be provided under YSR Cheyutha Scheme to beneficiaries for starting the income/ wealth generation activity.
 Rs. 75,000/- will be provided to beneficiaries in 4 equal installments in a period of 4 years.
 Only Women having Age between 45 Years to 60 Years are eligible to apply for financial assistance under YSR Cheyutha Scheme.
 Women belonging to any of the below mentioned category are eligible to apply :-
 	Backward Caste.
 Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Minority.
 
 The annual family income of women family should be Rs. 1,20,000/- per year in rural area and Rs. 1,44,000/- per year in urban area.
 Women family having four wheeler is not eligible for YSR Cheyutha Scheme but Taxis, Tractors and Autos are exempted.
 Family of a sanitation worker is also eligible to apply for financial assistance scheme under YSR Cheyutha Scheme.
 Government Volunteers can also identify the beneficiaries by doing door to door survey in the area.
 Women beneficiaries covered under YSR Pension Kanuka Scheme are not eligible to apply under YSR Cheyutha Scheme.
 It is to be estimated that more than 26 lakh women will get benefit from YSR Cheyutha Scheme.
 Eligible Women Beneficiaries can apply Online by filling Online Application Form of YSR Cheyutha Scheme at Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Women can also apply for YSR Cheyutha Scheme by visiting the office of Gram Ward Sachivalayam.
 Eligibility
 Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be a Women.
 Age of Women Should be between 45 Years to 60 Years.
 Women Should be belong to any of the following category :-
 	Backward Caste.
 Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Minority
 
 The Annual Family Income of Women Should be :-
 	Rs. 1,20,000/- in Rural Area.
 Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.
 
 Family of a Women should hold below mentioned Area of Land :-
 	3 Acres of Wet OR,
 10 Acres of Dry OR,
 10 Acres of both Wet and Dry.
 
 Family of a Women should not own any Four Wheeler.
 No Family Member should be a Government Pensioner or Serving Employee.
 No Family Member should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Electricity Consumption of a Women Family should not be more than 300 Units.
 Family of a Women should not own residential or commercial property in municipal area having built up area of more than 1,000 square feet.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following benefits will provided to eligible women beneficiary of Andhra Pradesh under YSR Cheyutha Scheme :-
 	Financial Assistance of Rs. 75,000/- will be provided to Women Beneficiary.
 This Financial Assistance will be paid in 4 years in a equal installment of Rs. 18,750.
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Caste Certificate.
 Minority Certificate.

75,000/- will be provided to Women Beneficiary.
 This Financial Assistance will be paid in 4 years in a equal installment of Rs. 18,750.
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Caste Certificate.
 Minority Certificate. (For Minority Applicant)
 Income Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 Documents Related to Proof of Age of Women.
 How to Apply
 Eligible Women Beneficiary can apply Online for YSR Cheyutha Scheme by visiting Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Click on Login and Select Citizen Login from the tab.
 Enter the Aadhar Number and verify it by OTP.
 After verification select "YSR Cheyutha Scheme" in Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the required details and upload the document and click on submit.
 Applications under YSR Cheyutha Scheme will forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.
 Field verification will be done by the officials and forward their recommendations to the Mandal Parishad Development Officer or Municipal Corporation.
 MPDO then transfer the applications to executive director of Backward Class Welfare Department.
 Final list of eligible beneficiary under YSR Cheyutha Scheme will be made available at all secretariats.
 Financial Assistance in 4 equal installment will be transferred in the bank account of beneficiary every year.
 Eligible Women Applicant can also apply offline by visiting the Gram Ward Sachivalyam Office.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR EBC Nestham Scheme.
 Launched on
 2021.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 45,000/- will be provided to women beneficiaries belongs to EBC Community..
 Nodal Department
 Backward Class Welfare Department, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Online Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Introduction
 YSR EBC Nestham Scheme is the social development scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government for the welfare of EBC community women.
 It was started in the year 2021.
 The meaning of word "Nestham" in YSR EBC Nestham Scheme is "Independence".
 The main objective behind launching YSR EBC Nestham Scheme is to encourage women of EBC Community to become self dependent in terms of income by providing them yearly financial assistance.
 Andhra Pradesh Government's Department of Backward Class Welfare is the nodal department of this scheme.
 Only EBC Community Women are eligible to get yearly financial assistance under YSR EBC Nestham Scheme.
 YSR EBC Nestham Scheme is particularly for the welfare of women belonging to Economically Backward Class.
 That's why this scheme is also called Economically Backward Class Financial Assistance Scheme.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 45,000/- will be provided to eligible beneficiaries under YSR EBC Nestham Scheme.
 This financial assistance will be provided to beneficiary in 3 equal instalment of Rs. 15,000/- each in a span of 3 years.
 The age of women beneficiary should be between 45 years to 60 years.
 The Annual Income of Women's Family should not be more than in Rs. 1,20,000/- in Rural Area and Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.
 Women having four wheeler in a house is not eligible to apply for YSR EBC Nestham but having Tractors, Autos and Taxis are exempted.
 Government Sanitation Worker Family is eligible to apply for YSR EBC Nestham Scheme.
 Aadhar Card is compulsorily needed to apply for YSR EBC Nestham Scheme.
 Eligible EBC Women Beneficiaries can apply Online by filling Online Application Form of YSR EBC Nestham Scheme at Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 EBC Women can also apply for YSR EBC Nestham Scheme by visiting the office of Gram Ward Sachivalayam.
 Eligibility
 Applicant Must be a Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be a Women and Should belongs to Economically Backward Community. (EBC Community)
 Age of Women Should be between 45 Years to 60 Years.
 The Total Annual Family Income of Women from all sources should be :-
 	Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Jagananna Chedodu Scheme.
 Launched on
 2020.
 Benefits
 
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided to below mentioned category people :-
 				Tailor. (All Community People are Eligible).
 Washerman. (Only Rajakas Community People are Eligible).
 Barbers. (Only Nayee Brahmins Community People are Eligible).
 
 
 Nodal Department
 Backward Class Welfare Department, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Online Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Introduction
 Jagananna Chedodu Scheme is the flagship scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started in the year 2020.
 The main objective behind launching Jagananna Chedodu Scheme is to provide financial assistance to small shop owners whose businesses got affected due to covid pandemic.
 Department of Backward Class Welfare of Andhra Pradesh Government is the nodal department of this scheme.
 Jagananna Chedodu Scheme is particularly for the welfare of below mentioned shop owners :-
 	Tailor.
 Washerman.
 Barbers.
 
 Tailor Shop Owners of all community are eligible to get financial assistance under Jagananna Chedodu Scheme.
 But for Washerman only Rajakas Community People of Andhra Pradesh are eligible for final assistance.
 Same like that for Barbers, only Nayee Brahmins Community people are elgiible to apply for financial assistance.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided to eligible benefiicaries under Jagananna Chedodu Scheme.
 This financial will be utilized by the beneficiaries to purchase the tools, equipment and other required essential thing for their businees.
 This financial assistance will be provided to beneficiary in 5 equal instalment of Rs. 10,000/- each in a span of 5 years.
 The age of shop owner should be between 21 years to 60 years.
 The business should be in the name of applicant.
 The Annual Income of applicant's family should not be more than in Rs. 1,20,000/- in Rural Area and Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.
 Beneficiaries having four wheeler in a house are not eligible to apply for Jagananna Chedodu but having Tractors, Autos and Taxis are exempted one.
 Family of Government Sanitation Worker is eligible to apply for Jagananna Chedodu Scheme.
 Aadhar Card is compulsorily needed to apply for Jagananna Chedodu Scheme.
 Eligible Tailors, Washerman and Barbers can apply Online by filling Online Application Form of Jagananna Chedodu Scheme at Navasakam Beneficiary Managament Portal.
 Eligible Beneficiaries can also apply for Jagananna Chedodu Scheme by visiting the office of Gram Ward Sachivalayam.
 Eligibility
 Applicant Must be a Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Age of Applicant should be between 21 Years to 60 Years.
 Applicant should have business in their own name.
 Applicant should be in any of the mentioned profession :-
 	Tailor. (All Community People are Eligible).
 Washerman. (Only Rajakas Community People are Eligible).
 Barbers. (Only Nayee Brahmins Community People are Eligible).
 
 The Annual Family Income of Applicant should be :-
 	Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.
 Rs. 1,20,000/- in Rural Area.
 
 Land Holdings of Applicant should be :-
 	3 Acres of Wet OR,
 10 Acres of Dry OR,
 10 Acres of both Wet and Dry.
 
 There should be no four wheeler in applicant family.
 There should be no Government Pensioner or Serving Employee in a applicant Family.
 No Member of a Family should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Electricity Consumption of Applicant Family should be less than 300 Units per month.
 Beneficiary should not own residential or commercial property in municipal area having built up area of more than 1,000 square feet.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will provided to eligible applicant under Jagananna Chedodu Scheme :-
 	Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided.
 This Financial Assistance will be paid in 5 years in 5 equal installment of Rs.

1,20,000/- in Rural Area.
 
 Land Holdings of Applicant should be :-
 	3 Acres of Wet OR,
 10 Acres of Dry OR,
 10 Acres of both Wet and Dry.
 
 There should be no four wheeler in applicant family.
 There should be no Government Pensioner or Serving Employee in a applicant Family.
 No Member of a Family should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Electricity Consumption of Applicant Family should be less than 300 Units per month.
 Beneficiary should not own residential or commercial property in municipal area having built up area of more than 1,000 square feet.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will provided to eligible applicant under Jagananna Chedodu Scheme :-
 	Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided.
 This Financial Assistance will be paid in 5 years in 5 equal installment of Rs. 10,000/- each.
 
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card Applicant.
 Caste Certificate.
 Income Certificate or Rice Card.
 Bank Account Details.
 Registration Number of Applicant Business.
 Any One Documents Related to Proof of Age :-
 	10th Marksheet.
 Voter Identity Card.
 Birth Certificate.
 Pension Card.
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible Beneficiary can apply for financial assistance under Jagananna Chedodu Scheme online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Beneficiary has to click on Login button appearing on the left corner of the screen.
 Select Citizen Login and Enter the Aadhar Number of Beneficiary.
 Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal will verify the Aadhar Number by OTP verification.
 After OTP verification, Select "Jagananna Chedodu Scheme" from Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the personal details, contact details, bank account details of the beneficiary and upload the required documents.

        " YSR Law Nestham Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Law Nestham Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019.
 Benefits
 Monthly Stipend of Rs. 5,000/- will be provided to Junior Advocates.
 Official Portal
 YSR Law Nestham Scheme Portal.
 Nodal Department
 Department of Law, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 Online Through YSR Law Nestham Scheme Portal.
 Introduction
 In the initial phase of practice after enrollment in State Bar Council, Advocates faces lots of struggle in terms of money and finding a client.
 Even sometime they can't able to bear the expenses incurred on themselves.
 Keeping these things in mind, Government of Andhra Pradesh started YSR Law Nestham Scheme for Junior Advocates of Andhra Pradesh.
 It was started in the year 2019.
 The main objective of behind launching YSR Law Nestham Scheme is to provide financial security to Junior Advocates of Andhra Pradesh so that they can settle their practice without thinking the income.
 Andhra Pradesh Government's Department of Law is the nodal department of this scheme.
 Under YSR Law Nestham Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide monthly stipend of Rs. 5,000/- to Junior Advocates.
 Junior Advocates under this scheme are defined as those Advocate who are not completed the 3 year of practice in any court of law after Enrollment in State Bar Council of Andhra Pradesh.
 Monthly Stipend of Rs. 5,000/- will only be provided to those Advocates who are not completed their 3 year of practice.
 Any Non-Practicing Advocate who are registered with State Bar Council but not active in law profession are not eligible under YSR Law Nestham Scheme.
 Certificate of Practice is mandatorily needed at the time of applying for monthly stipend.
 This monthly stipend will be provided to eligible Advocates only for a period of 3 years.
 Affidavit from a Senior Advocate with 15 years of Standing Practice is to be submitted by the Junior Advocate in every 6 months stating the proof of active law practicing.
 YSR Law Nestham Scheme is One Family One Benefit Scheme, Only One Person per Family is eligible to apply for monthly stipend.
 Eligible Junior Advocates can apply for monthly stipend of Rs. 5,000/- under YSR Law Nestham Scheme by filling the Online Application Form on YSR Law Nestham Scheme Portal.
 Eligibility
 Applicant must be a Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be a Law Graduate.
 Applicant Should be a Practicing Advocate in any Court in Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be Registered as an Advocate in Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council.
 The Age of Applicant Should not be more than 35 Years.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following monthly stipend will be provided to Junior Advocates under YSR Law Nestham Scheme :-
 	Monthly Stipend of Rs. 5,000/- per Month for 3 Years.
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 LL.B Degree.
 Caste Certificate.

5,000/- under YSR Law Nestham Scheme by filling the Online Application Form on YSR Law Nestham Scheme Portal.
 Eligibility
 Applicant must be a Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be a Law Graduate.
 Applicant Should be a Practicing Advocate in any Court in Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant Should be Registered as an Advocate in Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council.
 The Age of Applicant Should not be more than 35 Years.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following monthly stipend will be provided to Junior Advocates under YSR Law Nestham Scheme :-
 	Monthly Stipend of Rs. 5,000/- per Month for 3 Years.
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 LL.B Degree.
 Caste Certificate. (If belong to any Caste)
 Birth Certificate or 10th Marksheet for Age Proof.
 Bank Account Details.
 Affidavit of Practice from Senior Advocate.
 Bar Council of India Issued Certificate of Practice.
 How to Apply
 Every year the portal to Apply for YSR Law Nestham Scheme is opened for fresh registration thrice as follows :-
 
 	From 5th March to 20th June.
 From 5th September to 20th September.
 From 5th December to 20th December.
 
 Eligible Junior Advocates can apply for monthly stipend under YSR Law Nestham Scheme by filling Online Application Form on any of these 3 dates.
 Registration Process is very simple. Applicant can Register themselves for YSR Law Nestham by entering their Aadhar Number.
 Aadhar Number of Applicant will be verified by the portal through OTP.
 After Registration, Applicant can Login in the YSR Law Nestham Portal by again entering the Aadhar Card.
 After OTP verification, an Online Application Form of YSR Law Nestham Scheme will appear on the screen.
 Now Applicant has to fill the online application form according to the steps mentioned below :-
 	Personal Details
 Address Details.
 Advocate Enrollment Details.
 Class 10th Details. (Not Mandatory)
 Caste Details.
 Bank Account Details.
 Upload the Certificate of Practice.
 
 After that Click on Submit Button.
 Submitted Application of YSR Law Nestham Scheme will be verified by Village/ Ward Volunteers.
 After initial verification, Applications then forwarded to MPDO in Rural Area and Municipal Commissioner in Urban Area for final approval from District Magistrate/ Municipal Commissioner.
 After final approval the monthly stipend of Rs. 5,000/- under YSR Law Nestham Scheme will be transferred in the given bank account of Junior Advocate.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme
 Launched on
 01-06-2021.
 Benefits
 
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided to the owner of below mentioned passenger vehicles :-
 				Auto Rickshaw.
 Taxi.
 Maxi Cab.
 
 
 Nodal Department
 Department of Transport, Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Mode of Application
 
 Online Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Offline through YSR Vahana Mitra Offline Application Form.
 
 Introduction
 YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme is the financial assistance scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started on 01-06-2021.
 The main objective behind launching YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme is to provide financial assistance to the owners of passenger vehicles for yearly expenses incurred on vehicle repair, insurance and fitness certificate.
 Department of Transport of Andhra Pradesh Government is the nodal department of this scheme.
 YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme is particularly for the welfare of the below mentioned passenger vehicle owners :-
 	Auto Rickshaw.
 Taxi.
 Maxi Cab.
 
 Financial Assistance of Rs.

50,000/- will be provided to eligible passenger vehicle owners under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme.
 This financial will be utilized by the beneficiaries to repair their vehicle, or to pay for the expenses incurred on insurance or fitness certificate.
 This financial assistance will be provided to vehicle owners in 5 equal instalment of Rs. 10,000/- each in a span of 5 years.
 Applicant should own and drive the passenger vehicle to get financial assistance under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme.
 The Applicant must possess any of the below mentioned card to get financial assistance :-
 	White Ration Card.
 BPL Card.
 Annapurna Card.
 Antyodaya Card.
 
 Having a Valid Driving License is mandatory to apply.
 Family of Government Sanitation Worker is also eligible to apply for YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme.
 The owners of three/ four wheeler commercial light goods vehicle are not eligible to get financial assistance under this scheme.
 Aadhar Card is compulsorily needed to apply for YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme.
 Eligible Passenger Vehicle Owners can apply Online by filling Online Application Form of YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme at Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Eligible Beneficiaries can also apply for YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme through Offiline Application Form of YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme by submitting it to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.
 Eligibility
 Applicant must be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant should own and drive any of the following passenger vehicle :-
 	Auto Rickshaw.
 Taxi.
 Maxi Cab.
 
 Applicant should be a holder of any of the below mentioned card :-
 	White Ration Card.
 BPL Card.
 Annapurna Card.
 Antyodaya Card.
 
 Applicant should have Valid Driving License.
 The Land Holdings of Applicant should be :-
 	10 Acres of Dry OR,
 3 Acres of Wet OR,
 10 Acres of both Wet and Dry.
 
 There should be no Government Pensioner or Serving Employee in a Applicant's Family.
 No Member in a Applicant Family should be a Income Tax Payee.
 Electricity Consumption of Applicant Family should not be more than 300 Units per month.
 Applicant should not own any residential or commercial property in municipal area having built up area of more than 1,000 square feet.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will provided to Auto Rickshaw/ Taxi/ Maxi Cab Owners under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme :-
 	Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will be provided.
 This Financial Assistance will be paid in 5 years in 5 equal installment of Rs. 10,000/- each.
 
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Any One of the below mentioned card :-
 	White Ration Card.
 BPL Card.
 Annapurna Card.
 Antyodaya Card.
 
 Aadhar Card.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable)
 Driving License of Applicant.
 Bank Account Details.
 Below Mentioned Documents of Vehicle :-
 	Registration Certificate.
 Insurance.
 Pollution Certificate.
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible Owners of Passenger Vehicles can apply for financial assistance under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme online through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Beneficiary has to click on Login button to apply.
 Select Citizen Login and Enter the Aadhar Number of Yours.
 Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal will verify the Aadhar Number by sending OTP.
 After OTP verification, Beneficiary has to select "YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme" from Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the personal details, contact details, bank account details, vehicle details and upload the required documents.
 After that Submit the Application Form of YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme.
 Applications received under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme will be forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary for verification.
 Field verification will also be done by the Department of Transport of Andhra Pradesh Government..
 After initial verification the Welfare Education Assistant forward their recommendations to the Mandal Parishad Development Officer or Municipal Corporation for further approval.
 MPDO then transfer the applications to executive director of Department of Transport for further verification.
 Final approval for YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme Applications will be given by District Magistrate of the concerned District.
 Final list of eligible beneficiary under YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme will be available at all secretariats.
 Financial Assistance in 5 equal installment of Rs.

10,000/- each will be transferred in the bank account of beneficiaries every year.
 Eligible Owners of Passenger Vehicle can also apply for YSR Vahana Mitra Scheme by filling Offline Application Form and Submitting it to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.

        " Jagananna Thodu Scheme.": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Jagananna Thodu Scheme.
 Launched on
 2020.
 Benefits
 
 Interest Free Loan of Rs. 10,000/-.
 No Collateral Security is Required.
 
 Nodal Department
 Andhra Pradesh Gram Volunteers/ Ward Volunteers and Village Secretariats/ Ward Secretariats Department
 Mode of Application
 Online Through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Introduction
 Jagananna Thodu is scheme is the major social development scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was started in the year 2020.
 The main objective behind launching Jagananna Thodu Scheme is to provide capital loans to those persons who have their small businesses on roadside or in a public area or at footpath.
 Department of Gram Volunteers/ Ward Volunteers and Village Secretariats/ Ward Secretariats of Andhra Pradesh Government is the nodal department of the scheme.
 Under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Thodu Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide interest free capital loans of Rs. 10,000/- to Chiruvyaparulu People and Traditional Handicraft Artisans.
 Chiruvyaparulu are those persons who are engaged in below mentioned income generation activity :-
 	Vending on Footpath. Selling Vegetable on Pushcarts.
 Roadside Food Seller.
 Selling of a Tiffin.
 Road Side Small Shop Owners.
 
 Traditional Handicrafts Artisans are those people who are engaged in handicrafts work like :-
 	Lace Work.
 Kalamkari Work.
 Etikoppaka Toys.
 Kondapalli Toys.
 Leather Puppets.
 Potters.
 Bobbili Veena.
 Brass Craft Articles.
 
 Often people engaged in above mentioned works takes working capital loans from financial institutions or money lenders at higher rate and faces difficulty to return it.
 To prevent people from the trap of this loan menace, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide interest free capital loan of Rs. 10,000/- to small business owners.
 Interest Free Loans under Jagananna Thodu Scheme is only available for Mobile Hawkers, Push Cart or Street Vendors, Mobile Vendors, Stationary Vendors, and Peripatetic Vendors.
 The repayment period of loan under Jagananna Thodu Scheme is 1 year.
 Benefits of Jagananna Thodu Scheme will only be given to those beneficiaries who paid the EMI of their loan within the time period of 1 year.
 Interest Amount will be paid back to beneficiaries by Andhra Pradesh Government who paid their loan amount EMI on time.
 Separate Jagananna Thodu Scheme Identity Card will be issued to all the beneficiaries to smoothly carried out their business.
 There is no collateral security is required to avail the benefit of Jagananna Thodu Scheme.
 Till now more than 13 lakh beneficiaries get benefitted under Jagananna Thodu Scheme.
 Eligible Beneficiaries can apply for interest free loan of Rs.

10,000/- through filling the Online Application Form of Jagananna Thodu Scheme at Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Eligibility
 Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant should be a Person involved in Small Business such as :-
 	Artist Engaged in Traditional Handicrafts.
 Mobile Hawker.
 Push Card Vendor.
 Street Vendor.
 Mobile Vendors who carried out their vending activity on Wheel Card, Bicycle, Mobile Vehicles.
 Stationery Vendors who carried out their vending activity in pavement, public or private places.
 Peripatetic Vendors who carried their vending activity with a basket on shoulder and travel from one place to another.
 
 The Age of Applicant should be Above 18 Years.
 Annual Income of Applicant Should be :-
 	Rs. 1,20,000/- in Rural Area.
 Rs. 1,44,000/- in Urban Area.
 
 Total Land Holdings of Applicant should be :-
 	3 Acres of Wet OR,
 10 Acres of Dry OR,
 10 Acres of both Wet and Dry.
 
 Applicant should not having a shop not more than built up area of 5×5 Square Feet.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will provided to eligible beneficiary under Jagananna Thodu Scheme :-
 	Interest Free Loan of Rs. 10,000/-.
 No Collateral Security is Required.
 
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card or Voter Identity Card.
 Caste Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 Applicant Business Related Details.
 Any One Documents Related to Proof of Age :-
 	Voter Identity Card.
 10th Marksheet.
 Birth Certificate.
 Pension Card.
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible Persons can apply for interest free loan of Rs. 10,000/- under Jagananna Thodu Scheme by visiting Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Beneficiary has click on Login button and has to Select Citizen Login Tab.
 Enter the Aadhar Number to verify the Aadhar Number by OTP Verification.
 After verification, Select "Jagananna Thodu Scheme" in Citizen Scheme Application Tab.
 Fill the personal and contact details, business details, upload the documents and click on submit.
 Applications under Jagananna Thodu Scheme will forwarded to Welfare and Education Assistant or Ward Welfare and Development Secretary.
 Field verification will be done by the department officials and forward their recommendations to the Mandal Parishad Development Officer or Municipal Corporation.
 MPDO then transfer the applications to executive director of the department.
 Final list of eligible benefiiciary under Jagananna Thodu Scheme will be pasted at all village secretariats notice board and also available at Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
 Accepted Application under Jagananna Thodu Scheme will then forwarded to the banks for loan disbursement.
 After Bank approval, the loan amount will be directly transferred in the given bank account of beneficiary.
 Eligible Beneficiaries can also apply offline by visiting the Gram Ward Sachivalayam Office.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme.
 Launched on
 2019.
 Benefits
 
 Following Financial Assistance will be provided to beneficiary in case of death of an animal :-
 Rs. 30,000/- per Cow/ Buffalo. (For Improved and Indigenous Breed)
 Rs. 15,000/- per Cow/ Buffalo. (For Non Descript Breed)
 Rs. 6,000/- per Sheep/ Goat. (Death of 3 Sheep/ Goat at a time)
 
 Nodal Department
 Animal Husbandry Department, Andhra Pradesh.
 Mode of Application
 No Need to Apply Anywhere.
 Introduction
 YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme is flagship scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 It was launched in the year 2019.
 The main objective behind launching this scheme is to provide financial security to the animal owners of Andhra Pradesh in case of loss of their livestock.
 Department of Animal Husbandry of Government of Andhra Pradesh is the nodal department of this scheme.
 This scheme is also called YSR Livestock Loss Compensation Scheme.
 Under YSR Livestock Loss Compensation Scheme, Government of Andhra Pradesh will provide financial assistance to animal owners in case of untimely demise of their livestock.
 The following financial assistance will be given in case of death of below mentioned animal livestock :-
 	Livestock Category
 Amount of Assistance
 				(Per Animal)
 Cow/ Buffalo
 				(Indigenous Breed)
 Rs. 30,000/-
 Cow/ Buffalo
 				(Non Descript Breed)
 Rs. 15,000/-
 Sheep/ Goat
 Rs. 6,000/-
 
 Only following mentioned age animal are eligible under YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme :-
 	Livestock Category
 Age of Animal
 Cow
 2 Years to 10 Years.
 Buffalo
 3 Years to 12 Years.
 Sheep/ Goat
 6 Months.
 
 In case of Sheep/ Goat, Financial assistance will only be provided when there is a death of 3 and above Sheep/ Goat at a time.
 Only She Buffaloes are eligible to c
 Loss of 5 Animals per Family will be compensated by the Government of Andhra Pradesh in a single year.
 Loss of 20 Sheep/ Goats per Family will be compensated by the Government of Andhra Pradesh in a single year.
 Rs. 1,20,000/- per Family will be compensated by the Andhra Pradesh Government in a single year in case of death of Sheep/ Goat.
 In case of death of animal livestock, beneficiary can call on 155251 to report the incident to concerned officials.
 Beneficiary can also visit the Rythu Bharosa Kendra's to claim the compensation amount under YSR Livestock Loss Compensation Scheme.
 Eligibility
 Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant should have below mentioned Animals :-
 	Cows.
 Buffaloes.
 Sheep.
 Goats.
 
 The Minimum Age of Applicant Animals should be :-
 	Cow :- 2 Years to 10 Years.
 Buffalo :- 3 Years to 12 Years.
 Sheep :- 6 Months.
 Goat :- 6 Months.
 
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will provided under YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme in case of death of a animal livestock of beneficiary :-
 	Rs. 30,000/- per Animal will be provided in case of death of Improved and Indigenous Breed Cow/ She Buffalo.
 Rs. 30,000/- per Animal will be provided in case of death of Non Descript Breed Cow/ She Buffalo.
 Rs.

30,000/- per Animal will be provided in case of death of Improved and Indigenous Breed Cow/ She Buffalo.
 Rs. 30,000/- per Animal will be provided in case of death of Non Descript Breed Cow/ She Buffalo.
 Rs. 6,000/- per Animal will be provided in case of death of Sheep/ Goat.
 
 Documents Required
 Residence Proof/ Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card or Voter Identity Card.
 Caste Certificate.
 Income Certificate.
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Applicant has no need to apply anywhere for YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme.
 Every households who have animal livestock of below mentioned animals are automatically eligible under this scheme :-
 	Cows.
 Buffaloes.
 Sheep.
 Goats.
 
 In case of death of any animal, beneficiaries are eligible to claim the compensation for loss of livestock under YSR Livestock Loss Compensation Scheme.
 To claim the compensation, beneficiary has to call on 155251 and report the death of an animal to concerned officials.
 Veterinary Doctors and the officials of Department of Husbandry will visit the place and inspect the carcass of Animal.
 Post Mortem is mandatory in case of loss of Cows or She Buffalo.
 After the receiving the report of Veterinary Doctor, the compensation amount under YSR Livestock Loss Compensation Scheme or YSR Pasu Nasta Parihara Padhakam Scheme will be transferred in the bank account of beneficiary.

        " Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme.": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme.
 Launched On
 2019.
 Benefits
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 7,00,000/- in case of death of farmer due to suicide.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Farmers.
 Tenant Farmers.
 Person whose live depend on Agricultural Activity.
 
 Nodal Department
 Agriculture and Cooperation Department, Andhra Pradesh.
 Subscribe Scheme
 Subscribe Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme to get regular updates.
 Mode of Applying
 No Need to Apply Anywhere.
 Introduction
 Lots of Population of Andhra Pradesh involves in Agricultural Activity to earn livelihood.
 They face lots of difficulties like crop loss, failures of borewells, high cost of cultivation, low cost selling of agricultural products.
 Sometimes due to this difficulties farmers takes very drastic step and take their life.
 After the demise their is no financial security available for the family of deceased farmer.
 So, Government of Andhra Pradesh started Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme to provide financial security to the family of deceased farmers.
 It was started in the year 2019.
 The main objective behind launching Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme is to provide financial assistance to the families in case of suicide of farmer.
 Financial Assistance of Rs.

7,00,000/- will be provided to the families of deceased farmer.
 This Scheme is also called "Andhra Pradesh Farmer Suicide Compensation Scheme".
 The cause of death of a farmer should be suicide.
 The cause of farmers suicide should be :-
 	Failure of Borewells.
 High Cost of Cultivation.
 Non Remunerative Prices.
 Oral Tenancy.
 Ineligibility to Avail Bank Loans.
 Private Lending with High Interest Rate.
 Adverse Seasonal Condition.
 Heavy Expenditure on Children Education.
 Ill Health.
 Marriage Expenses.
 Crop Loss.
 
 Deceased Person should be belong to any of the following category :-
 	Farmer.
 Tenant Farmer.
 Person whose live depends on Agricultural Activity.
 
 In case of demise of farmer/ tenant farmer, the first information will go to the Village Revenue Officer.
 There is no need to apply separately for Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme.
 Every Farmer/ Tenant Farmer are automatically eligible under Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme.
 Benefits
 The following financial assistance will be provided to next of kin in case of Farmer Demise due to Suicide :-
 	Rs. 7,00,000/-
 
 Eligibility Conditions
 Permanent Residents of Andhra Pradesh.
 Deceased should be any of the following person :-
 	Farmer.
 Tenant Farmer.
 Person whose live depends on Agricultural Activity.
 
 The Death of Deceased should be due to Suicide.
 Documents Required
 Aadhar Card of Deceased.
 Ration Card.
 Death Panchanama.
 Post Mortem Report.
 Death Certificate.
 Copy of FIR.
 Nominee Details.
 Land Record Details.
 Bank Account Details.
 How to Apply
 Every Farmer, Tenant Farmer and Persons whose lives are depend on Agricultural Activity are automatically covered under Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme.
 If Farmer/ Tenant Farmer commits suicide then the family of the deceased have to inform the Village Revenue Officer about the suicide.
 Village Revenue Officer will visit the house of deceased farmer/ tenant farmer on the same day of suicide.
 Identification and Scrutinization of Farmer/ Tenant Farmer Death will be done by Mandal Level and Divisional Level Committees.
 Mandal Level Committee comprises the following members :-
 	Tehsildar.
 Agriculture Officer.
 Sub Inspector of Police.
 
 Divisional Level Committee comprises the following members :-
 	RDO/ Sub Collector.
 Assistance Director of Agriculture.
 Deputy Superintendent of Police.
 
 After documentation, the financial assistance of Rs. 7,00,000/- under Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme will be transferred in the bank account of family of deceased farmer/ tenant farmer.
 Important Links
 Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme Portal.
 Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme Guidelines.
 Contact Details
 Andhra Pradesh Farmers Suicide Ex-Gratia Scheme Helpline Number :- 1902.

 Social Welfare Department.

 Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Every year lakhs of aspirant from Andhra Pradesh gave the most prestigious competitive examination of Civil Services conducted every year by Union Public Service Commission.

": "
 Overview of Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme.
 Launched Year
 2023.
 Benefits
 
 Rs. 1,00,000/- will be provided for clearing UPSC Pre.
 Rs. 50,000/- will be provided for clearing UPSC Mains.
 
 Beneficiaries
 Civil Services Applicants of Andhra Pradesh.
 Nodal Department
 Social Welfare Department.
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here for Regular Scheme Updates.
 Mode of Apply
 Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Every year lakhs of aspirant from Andhra Pradesh gave the most prestigious competitive examination of Civil Services conducted every year by Union Public Service Commission. (UPSC)
 Some choose self study mode and some choose taking a guidance from coaching centers.
 Preparing for UPSC Civil Services Examination is now a very expensive affair.
 Somehow if student manage to clear the Preliminary Examination of Civil Services, then lots of money is needed to prepare for mains examination and then for interview thereafter.
 Keeping these thing in mind, Government of Andhra Pradesh decided to start new incentive scheme for civil services students.
 The name of scheme is "Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme".
 It is going to be started in the year 2023.
 The main objective behind launching Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme is to encourage students to work hard and become civil servants by providing them a financial assistance.
 This scheme is also called "Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Programme" or "Andhra Pradesh Civil Services Financial Assistance Scheme".
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,00,000/- will be provided to all those applicants who cleared Preliminary Examination of UPSC Civil Services.
 Apart from this Financial Assistance of Rs. 50,000/- will also provided to those applicants who cleared the Mains Examination of UPSC Civil Services.
 Selected Applicant can utilised this financial assistance provided under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme to prepare further.
 Only those applicants are eligible to get monetary assistance under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme who cleared Preliminary or Mains Examination of Civil Services which is conducted by Union Public Service Commission. (UPSC)
 If the annual family income of Applicant Family is more than Rs. 8,00,000/- then he/ she is not eligible for financial assistance.
 Eligible Candidate who cleared Preliminary or Mains Examination of Civil Services which is conducted by Union Public Service Commission can apply for financial assistance by filling Online Application Form.
 Online Application Form of Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme is available on Andhra Pradesh Government's JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following financial assistance will be provided to all eligible beneficiaries Andhra Pradesh Government's Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme who cleared any one of the following exam :-
 	Examination
 Amount of
 				Assistance
 UPSC Pre
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 UPSC Mains
 Rs. 50,000/-
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Government of Andhra Pradesh sets the following eligibility conditions in order to provide the benefits of financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme :-
 	
 Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Applicant should be belong to Socially, Educationally, Economically Backward Section.
 Applicant should have cleared any of the below mentioned exam :-
 					UPSC Pre Examination.
 UPSC Mains Examination.
 
 The Annual Income of Applicant's Family should not be more than Rs. 8,00,000/-.
 Land Holding of Applicant's Family should be 10 Acres of Wet or 25 Acres of Dry or 25 Acres of Wet and Dry Both.
 Applicant's Family should not own any Residential/ Commercial Property having area more than 1500 Sqft.
 There should be no Four Wheeler in a Family. (Tractor, Auto and Taxi are Exempted)
 
 
 Documents Required
 The below mentioned documents is needed at the time of applying for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government :-
 	Self Attested Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Income Certificate/ Self Declaration.
 Aadhar Card.
 UPSC Pre Admit Card. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Pre Result. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Admit Card. (For Mains Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Result.

(Tractor, Auto and Taxi are Exempted)
 
 
 Documents Required
 The below mentioned documents is needed at the time of applying for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme of Andhra Pradesh Government :-
 	Self Attested Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Income Certificate/ Self Declaration.
 Aadhar Card.
 UPSC Pre Admit Card. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Pre Result. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Admit Card. (For Mains Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Result. (For Mains Assistance)
 Mobile Number.
 Bank Account Details.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable)
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible UPSC Pre or Mains passed Applicant can apply for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme through Online Application Form.
 Online Application Form of Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme is available on JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Visit the JnanBhumi Portal and Choose Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme.
 Click on Registration and filled the below mentioned details :-
 	Personal Details.
 Permanent Residential Address.
 Fill the Eligibility Criteria.
 Caste Details.
 Contact Details.
 Examination Details.
 Upload the Document.
 
 Preview the Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Application Form thoroughly.
 Then Click on Submit Button to Submit it.
 JnanaBhumi Portal then generate the Applicant ID for Candidate.
 Beneficiary can also check the Application Status of Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme on JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Officers from the welfare department will then scrutinized the received Application Form.
 List of Selected Beneficiary for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme will then released by the department.
 The amount of financial assistance then credited in the bank account of beneficiary.
 Important Links
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Online Application Form.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Registration.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Application Status.
 Andhra Pradesh JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Guidelines.
 Contact Details
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Helpline Number :- 1902.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Scheme Helpdesk Email :- jnanabhumi.jvdschemes@gmail.com.

        " ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం.": "
 పథకం ఓవర్వ్యూ
 
 పథకం పేరు
 ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం.
 ప్రారంభించిన సంవత్సరం
 2023
 ప్రయోజనాలు
 
 యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమ్స్ క్లియర్ చేసిన వారికి రూ.

1,00,000/- అందించబడును.
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్ క్లియర్ చేసిన వారికి రూ. 50,000/- అందించబడును.
 
 ప్రయోజనం పొందేవారు
 ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ దరఖాస్తులు.
 నోడల్ విభాగం
 సాంఘిక సంక్షేమ శాఖ.
 సబ్స్క్రిప్షన్
 పథకం గురించి అప్డేటేస్ కోసం ఇక్కడ సబ్స్క్రయిబ్ చేయండి.
 అప్లికేషన్ మోడ్
 జగనన్న పౌర సేవల ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం ఆన్లైన్ దరఖాస్తు ఫారం.
 పరిచయం
 ప్రతి సంవత్సరం యూనియన్ పబ్లిక్ సర్వీస్ కమిషన్ ద్వారా నిర్వహించబడే ప్రతిష్టత్మమైన సివిల్ సర్వీస్ పరీక్షను ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ నుంచి లక్షలాది మంది అందించారు.
 కొంత మంది సొంతంగ చదివే విధానం ఎంచుకున్నారు మరియు మరి కొంత మంది కోచింగ్ సెంటర్లను ఎంచుకున్నారు.

కొంత మంది సొంతంగ చదివే విధానం ఎంచుకున్నారు మరియు మరి కొంత మంది కోచింగ్ సెంటర్లను ఎంచుకున్నారు.
 యూపీఎస్సీ వివిల్ సర్వీస్ పరీక్షకు ఇప్పుడు తయారు అవ్వడం అంటే చాలా ఖరిదైన వ్యవహారం.
 విద్యార్థి సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రిలిమినరీ పరీక్షలో క్లియర్ అయితే, మెయిన్స్ పరీక్షకు మరియు ఇంటర్వ్యూకి సిద్దం కావడానికి చాలా డబ్బు అవసరం.
 ఈ విషయం దృష్టిలో పెట్టుకొని ఆంధ్రా ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభుత్వం కొత్త ప్రోత్సాహక పథకాన్ని సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ విద్యార్థుల కోసం ప్రారంభించాలని నిర్ణయించుకుంది.
 పథకం యొక్క పేరు ఆంధ్రా ప్రదేశ్ జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం.
 ఇది 2023 సంవత్సరంలో ప్రారంభం కానుంది.

పథకం యొక్క పేరు ఆంధ్రా ప్రదేశ్ జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం.
 ఇది 2023 సంవత్సరంలో ప్రారంభం కానుంది.
 జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం ప్రారంభించడం వెనుక ప్రధాన లక్ష్యం విద్యార్థులను కష్టపడి పని చేసేల ప్రోత్సహించడం మరియు వారికి ఆర్ధిక సహాయం అందించడం ద్వారా సివిల్ సర్వెంట్లుగా మారడం.
 ఈ పథకాన్ని జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం లేదా ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ఆర్ధిక సహాయ పథకం అంటారు.
 ఎవరు అయితే యూపీఎస్సీ సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రిలిమినరీ పరీక్షను క్లియర్ చేస్తారో వారికి ఆర్ధిక సహాయంగా రూ.

ఎవరు అయితే యూపీఎస్సీ సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రిలిమినరీ పరీక్షను క్లియర్ చేస్తారో వారికి ఆర్ధిక సహాయంగా రూ. 1,00,000/- అందిస్తారు.
 అలాగే ఎవరు అయితే యూపీఎస్సీ సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ మెయిన్స్ పరీక్షను క్లియర్ చేస్తారో వారికి ఆర్ధిక సహాయంగా రూ. 50,000/- అందిస్తారు.
 ఎంపిక అయిన వారు జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం కింద అందించిన ఆర్ధిక సహాయన్ని మరింత ముందుకు వెళ్లడం కోసం ఉపయోగించుకోవచ్చు.
 ఎవరు అయితే యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమినరీ లేదా మెయిన్స్ పరీక్షను క్లియర్ చేస్తారో వారు మాత్రమే మొనేటరీ సహయంకి అర్హులు.
 దరఖాస్తుల కుటుంబం యొక్క సంత్సర ఆదాయం రూ. 8,00,000/- కంటే ఎక్కువగా ఉంటే వారు ఆర్థిక సహాయనికి అర్హులు కాదు.

8,00,000/- కంటే ఎక్కువగా ఉంటే వారు ఆర్థిక సహాయనికి అర్హులు కాదు.\n యూనియన్ పబ్లిక్ సర్వీస్ కమిషన్ ద్వారా పెట్టే సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రిలిమినరీ లేదా మెయిన్స్ పరీక్ష క్లియర్ చేస్తారు వారు ఆర్థిక సహాయం కోసం ఆన్లైన్ దరఖాస్తు ఫారం ద్వారా దరఖాస్తు చేసుకోవచ్చు.\n జగన్నన సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం ఆన్లైన్ దరఖాస్తు ఫారం ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభుత్వ జ్ఞానభూమి పోర్టల్ లో  ఉంది.

జగన్నన సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం ఆన్లైన్ దరఖాస్తు ఫారం ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభుత్వ జ్ఞానభూమి పోర్టల్ లో  ఉంది.
 ప్రయోజనాలు
 ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభుత్వం జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం కింద ఈ కింద పేర్కొన్న  పరీక్షల్లో ఏదైనా ఒక పరీక్ష క్లియర్ చేస్తే వారికి కింద ఉన్న ఆర్ధిక సహాయం పొందవచ్చు :-
 	పరీక్ష
 ఆర్ధిక సహాయం
 యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమ్స్
 రూ.1,00,000/-
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్
 రూ.50,000/-
 
 అర్హత
 ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభుత్వం  జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం కింద అందించబడే ఆర్ధిక సహాయం పొందడానికి  కొన్ని  షరతులను పెట్టింది :-
 	
 దరఖాస్తులు ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ నివాసులు అయి ఉండాలి.

దరఖాస్తులు ఆర్దికంగా, సామాజికంగా, విద్యాపరంగా వెనుకడిన వారై ఉండాలి.
 దరఖాస్తులు కింద ఉన్న దానిలో ఏదైనా ఒక పరీక్ష క్లియర్ చేయాలి.
 యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమ్స్.
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్.
 కుటుంబ సంవత్సర ఆదాయం రూ. 8,00,000/- కంటే ఎక్కువగా ఉండకూడదు.
 దరఖాస్తుల కుటుంబంలో భూమి 10 ఎకరాల తడి లేదా 25 ఎకరాల పొడి భూమి లేదా 25 ఎకరాల తడి మరియు పొడి భూమి రెండు ఉండాలి.
 దరఖాస్తుల కుటుంబానికి 1500 చదరపు అడుగుల కంటే ఎక్కువ నివాస అస్తి ఉండకూడదు.
 దరఖాస్తుల కుటుంబంలో ఎవరికి 4 చక్రాల వాహనం ఉండకూడదు(ట్రాక్టర్, ఆటో,

దరఖాస్తుల కుటుంబంలో ఎవరికి 4 చక్రాల వాహనం ఉండకూడదు(ట్రాక్టర్, ఆటో, మరియు టాక్సీలకు మినహాయింపు ఉంది)
 
 
 అవసరమైన పత్రాలు
 కింద పేర్కొన్న పాత్రలు జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం కింద ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ ప్రభూత్వం ఇచ్చే ఆర్ధిక సహాయం కోసం దరఖస్తు చేసే అప్పుడు అవసరం :-
 	దరఖాస్తుల ఫొటో.
 స్కాన్నెడ్ సంతకం.
 ఆంధ్ర ప్రదేశ్ నివాసం.
 ఆదాయం సర్టిఫికేట్/ సెల్ఫ్ డిక్లరేషన్.
 ఆధార్ కార్డు.
 యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమినరీ అడ్మిట్ కార్డ్. (సహాయం కోసం)
 యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమినరీ ఫలితం. (సహయం కోసం)
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్ అడ్మిట్ కార్డ్. (మెయిన్స్ సహాయం కోసం)

(సహయం కోసం)
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్ అడ్మిట్ కార్డ్. (మెయిన్స్ సహాయం కోసం)
 యూపీఎస్సీ మెయిన్స్ ఫలితం. (మెయిన్స్ సహాయం కోసం)

 ఎలా దరఖాస్తు చేయాలి
 అర్హత ఉన్న యూపీఎస్సీ ప్రిలిమినరీ లేదా మెయిన్స్ క్లియర్ అయిన వారు జగనన్న సివిల్ సర్వీసెస్ ప్రోత్సాహక పథకం కింద ఆర్థిక సహాయం కోసం దరఖాస్తు చేసుకోవచ్చు ఆన్లైన్ దరఖాస్తు ఫారం ద్వారా.

 కులం వివరాలు.
 పరీక్ష వివరాలు.

 దరఖాస్తు ఫారంను సమర్పించడానికి ఇప్పుడు సబ్మిట్ బటన్ పైన నొక్కండి .

        " Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam.": "
 Overview of Scheme
 
 Scheme Name
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam.
 Launched Year
 2023.
 Benefits
 
 Rs. 1,00,000/- for clearing UPSC Pre.
 Rs. 50,000/- for clearing UPSC Mains.
 
 Beneficiaries
 Civil Services Candidates of Andhra Pradesh.
 Nodal Department
 Social Welfare Department.
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here for Regular Scheme Updates.
 Mode of Apply
 Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Lakhs of Candidates from Andhra Pradesh gave the toughest competitive examination of Civil Services every year which is conducted Union Public Service Commission. (UPSC)
 Many Candidate choose self study and many choose joining coaching centers for guidance.
 Preparing for Civil Services Examination now a days is a very expensive affair.
 If somehow candidate manage to clear the Preliminary Examination of Civil Services, then huge money is required to prepare for mains examination and interview.
 Government of Andhra Pradesh now decided to start new incentive scheme for those students who are preparing for civil services.
 Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam is launched by Andhra Pradesh Government in the year 2023.
 The main objective behind starting Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam is to encourage students to work hard and become civil servants without thinking about the expenses incurred on preparation.
 This scheme is also called "Jagananna Civil Services Incentive Programme" or "Andhra Pradesh Civil Services Financial Assistance Scheme".
 Rs. 1,00,000/- will be provided to all those candidates who cleared Preliminary Examination of Civil Services.
 Rs. 50,000/- will also provided to those candidates who cleared the Mains Examination of Civil Services.
 Selected Candidate for Financial Assistance can utilised this amount to prepare further.
 Financial Assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam will only provided to those candidates who cleared Preliminary or Mains Examination of Civil Services which is conducted by Union Public Service Commission. (UPSC)
 Those Candidates are not eligible for Financial Assistance whose Annual Family Income is more than Rs. 8,00,000/- per year.
 Eligible Candidates who cleared Preliminary or Mains Examination of UPSC Civil Services can apply for financial assistance by applying through Online Application Form.
 Online Application Form of Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam is available on Government of Andhra Pradesh JnanaBhumi Portal.
 Benefits
 The below mentioned financial assistance under Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam will be provided to those candidates who successfully cleared the Preliminary or Mains Examination of Union Public Service Commission :-
 	Examination Tier
 Amount
 UPSC Preliminary
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 UPSC Mains
 Rs. 50,000/-
 
 Eligibility
 Following Eligibility Criteria is needed to fulfilled to avail the benefit of financial assistance provided under Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam :-
 	
 Candidate should be a Permanent Resident of Andhra Pradesh.
 Candidate should be belong to any of the Backward Section :-
 					Socially Backward.
 Educationally Backward.
 Economically Backward.
 
 Candidate should have cleared any of the following exam :-
 					UPSC Preliminary Examination.
 UPSC Mains Examination.
 
 Candidate Annual Income should be below Rs. 8,00,000/- per Year.
 Candidate Family Land Holding should be :-
 					10 Acres of Wet OR,
 25 Acres of Dry OR,
 25 Acres of Wet and Dry Both.
 
 Candidate Family should not own any Commercial/ Residential Property having area more than 1500 Sqft.
 There should be No Four Wheeler in a Candidate Family.
 Taxi, Tractor, Auto are Exempted.
 
 
 Documents Required
 The following documents is essentially required at the time of applying for Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam :-
 	Domicile of Andhra Pradesh.
 Aadhar Card.
 Self Attested Passport Size Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 Caste Certificate. (If Applicable)
 Income Self Declaration.
 UPSC Pre Admit Card. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Pre Result. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Admit Card. (For Mains Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Result.

(If Applicable)
 Income Self Declaration.
 UPSC Pre Admit Card. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Pre Result. (For Pre Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Admit Card. (For Mains Assistance)
 UPSC Mains Result. (For Mains Assistance)
 Mobile Number.
 Email.
 Bank Account Details.
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible Candidates who cleared UPSC Pre or Mains Examination can apply for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam through Online Application Form.
 Online Application Form of Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam is available on JnanaBhumi Portal of Andhra Pradesh Government.
 Open the JnanBhumi Portal and Choose Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam.
 Click on Registration and filled the below mentioned details :-
 	
 Personal Details :-
 					Name of Candidate.
 Father's Name.
 Mother's Name.
 Date of Birth.
 Aadhar Number.
 Upload Aadhar Card Copy.
 
 Permanent Residential Address :-
 					Door Number.
 Street.
 Locality.
 District.
 Mandal.
 Secretariat.
 Village.
 Pincode.
 Upload Domicile Certificate.
 
 Fill the Eligibility Criteria :-
 					Annual Income.
 Upload Annual Family Income Self Declaration.
 Dry Land Holding of Family.
 Wet Land Holding of Family.
 Family Member is a Government Employee. (Yes/ No)
 Family Owns Four Wheeler. (YEs/ No)
 Family Owns Property in Urban Area. (Yes/ No)
 Family Member is a Employee. (Yes/ No)
 
 Caste Details :-
 					Religion.
 Caste.
 Sub Caste.
 
 Contact Details :-
 					Mobile Number.
 Email.
 
 Examination Details :-
 					Hall Ticket Number.
 Upload Pre Hall Ticket.
 Upload Hall Ticket of Mains.
 
 Upload the Document :-
 					Self Attested Passport Size Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 
 
 
 Preview the Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Application Form before submitting it.
 Click on Submit Button to Submit it thereafter.
 Applicant ID for Candidate will generated by JnanBhumi Portal then.
 Candidate can also check the Application Status of Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam on JnanaBhumi Portal by entering Applicant ID.
 Concerned Officials from the welfare department will then verified the received Application Form.
 List of Selected Candidate for financial assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam will then released by the department.
 Financial Assistance under Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam will then credited in the bank account of candidate.
 Important Links
