 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Registration.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Application Status.
 Andhra Pradesh JnanaBhumi Website.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Guidelines.
 Contact Details
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Helpline Number :- 1902.
 Andhra Pradesh Jagananna Civil Services Prothsahakam Helpdesk Email :- jnanabhumi.jvdschemes@gmail.com.

        " Atal Pension Yojana (APY).": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of Scheme
 Atal Pension Yojana (APY).
 Launched Date
 09-05-2015.
 Scheme Type
 Monthly Pension Scheme.
 Nodal Ministry
 Department of Financial Services.
 Official Website
 Jan-Dhan Se Jan Suraksha Portal.
 Pension Range
 Rs. 1,000/ to Rs. 5,000/
 Maximum Contribution Period
 42 Years (When a person subscribe the scheme at the age of 18 years.)
 Minimum Contribution Period
 20 Years (When a person subscribe the scheme at the age of 40 years.)
 Mode Of Apply
 Offline/ Online Mode Available Through The Banks.
 Introduction
 Atal Pension Yojana is a Monthly Pension Scheme of Department Of Financial Services under the Ministry Of Finance.
 It came into effect from 1st Of June 2015.
 Atal Pension Yojana is a voluntary and periodic contribution based pension scheme.
 Minimum Guaranteed Monthly Pension of Rs. 1,000, or Rs. 2,000, or Rs. 3,000, or Rs. 4,000, or Rs. 5,000 per month will be provided by Government of India under Atal Pension Yojana.
 Monthly Pension Amount received by subscriber is subject to contribution plan taken by him/ her.
 Pension under Atal Pension Yojana will starts when a person attain the age of 60 years.
 Pension Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) administered the Atal Pension Yojana.
 Central Government will also contributed the same amount as contributed by the beneficiary.
 Subscriber of Atal Pension Yojana choose to contribute premium amount on Monthly, Quarterly and Half Yearly basis.
 Pension under Atal Pension Yojana will be provided to subscriber till his/ her death.
 Subscriber can also withdraw the whole contributed amount of Atal Pension Yojana anytime.
 Eligible Beneficiary can appy for Atal Pension Yojana by visiting any nearest Bank Branch.
 Benefits
 Following benefits are available for the Subscribers of Atal Pension Yojana :-
 	
 Per Month Pension of Rs. 1,000/- to Rs. 5,000/-
 Central Government also contributed the same amount as contrubuted by the Subscriber.
 Pension will be Provided to Spouse in case of death of Pension Subscriber.
 If Pension Subscriber dies before attaining the age of 60 years, Spouse can choose any one option :-
 					Withdraw the Entire Corpus Amount.
 Continue Contribution and Avail the Pension after Spouse turns 60 Years.
 Spouse of Original Subscriber will then receive pension till her/ his death.
 
 In case of death of both the Subscriber and his/ her spouse, the nominee mentioned by the subscriber gets the accumulated amount contributed by the subscriber.
 
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Beneficiary should be a Indian Resident.
 The Age of Beneficiary should be between 18 Years to 40 Years.
 Beneficiary should have Jandhan Bank Account or Saving Bank Account.
 Bank Account of Beneficiary should be linked with Aadhar Number and Mobile Number.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 Atal Pension Yojana is a social security scheme for all the citizens of India especially working in unorganized sector.
 It focused on working poor to encourage them to save for their old age.
 It's aim to encourage the workers of unorganized sector to voluntarily save for their retirement.
 On consent from the policy holder, the amount of contribution will be paid through autodebit mode from policy holder's account in a single installment.
 It is mandatory to make contribution in Atal Pension Yojana continuously from the age of joining to till the age of 60 years of the subscriber.
 A person who crosses the age of 40 years cannot register himself under Atal Pension Yojana.
 It is essential to link person's Aadhar Card and Mobile Number For Updates with his/her Bank Account.
 Enrollment under Atal Pension Yojana can avail through by filling a form in the Bank Branch at any time in the year.
 Some Banks also gave facility to their customers to apply online for Atal Pension Yojana.
 Through National Pension System Trust Portal, any person can Register himself/ herself to avail the benefit of Atal Pension Yojana.
 Late Contribution Amount Charges Charged By Bank
 If any person under the Atal Pension Yojana delayed his/ her Monthly/ Quarterly/ HalfYearly contribution payments then Banks collects additional amount/ charges for delayed payments.

 Exit Guidelines Of Atal Pension Yojana
 Exit from Atal Pension Yojana before 60 years is not permitted.
 However, it is permitted only in exceptional circumstances for e.g. in the event of the death of the subscriber or in case of any terminal disease or specified illness.
 After attaining the age of 60 years exit from Atal Pension Yojana is permitted with 100 % annuitisation of pension wealth.
 Pension under Atal Pension Yojana starts when Beneficiary attain the Age of 60 Years.
 In case of exit due to the death of the subscriber, pension would be available to the spouse of the subscriber.
 In case of death of both the subscriber and the spouse, the pension corpus/ amount of Atal Pension Yojana would be returned to the nominee.

{
        " Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)
 Launched Date
 1st of June 2015.
 Scheme Type
 Accidental Insurance Scheme.
 Nodal Ministry
 Department of Financial Services.
 Official Website
 Jan-Dhan se Jan Suraksha Portal.
 Accidental Insurance
 Rs. 1,00,000/- to Rs. 2,00,000/-.
 Premium To Be Paid
 Rs. 20/- Every Year.
 Insurance Time Period
 
 12 Months (From 1st of June to 31st of May of Every Year.)
 It is a one year Accidental Insurance Scheme subject to renew every year.
 
 Eligibility
 Every Indian Citizen Between the Age Group Of 18 to 70 Years.
 Mode Of Apply
 Offline/ Online Mode Available Through Banks.
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana is a Accidental Insurance Scheme run by Indian Government.
 Department of Financial Services under the Ministry Of Finance is the nodal department of this scheme.
 It was launched on 1st Of June 2015.
 The main objective behind starting Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana is to provide personal accidental insurance cover to unisured people.
 This scheme is also know by other name i.e. :- "Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Scheme" or "Prime Minister Social Security Scheme" or "Prime Minister Accidental Insurance Scheme".
 It is a one year personal accidental insurance cover for a person.
 Financial Assistance will be provided to Insured Person on his/her death caused due to accident or he/she suffered partial/ permanent disability of Eyes/ Hand/ Feet.
 Rs. 2,00,000/- will be provided under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana in case of Death of a Policy Holder.
 Whereas, Financial Assistance of Rs. 2,00,000/- will be provided in case of Permanent Disability and Rs. 1,00,000/- will be provided in case of Partial Disability caused due to accident.
 Premium of Rs. 20/- per year will have to paid by the beneficiary in order to avail the personal accidental cover under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.
 This scheme is offered by Public Sector General Insurance Companies (PSGICs) and other General Insurance Companies having collaboration with Banks.
 It is up to Concerned Banks to engage any Insurance Company to implement Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana for their customers.
 Eligible Beneficiary can enrol themselves in Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana by visiting the bank.
 Officials present at the bank will registered the beneficiary person in Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.
 It depends on Bank whether they choose Online Application Process or Offline Application Process to register beneficiary in Pradhan Mantri Surksha Bima Yojana.
 Benefits
 Personal Accidental Insurance Cover from Rs. 1,00,000 to Rs. 2,00,000/-.
 The Amount of Premium is very minimal i.e just Rs. 20/- per year.
 Covers Death Caused due to Accident or Partial/ Permanent Disability of a Person due to Accident.
 Premium is auto-debited from Account Holder's Bank Account on Consent.
 Financial Assistance provided under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana are :-
 	Situation of Benefit
 Amount Of
 				Insurance
 Death of Policy Holder
 Rs. 2,00,000/-
 
 Any Complete Disability :-
 					Total and Irrecoverable Loss Of Both Eyes.
 Loss Of Use Of Both Hands Or Both Feet.
 Loss Of Sight Of One Eye.
 Loss Of Use Of Hand Or Foot.
 
 
 Rs. 2,00,000/-
 
 Partial Disability :-
 					Total and Irrecoverable Loss Of Sight Of One Eye.
 Loss of Use Of One Hand Or One Foot.
 
 
 Rs.

2,00,000/-
 
 Any Complete Disability :-
 					Total and Irrecoverable Loss Of Both Eyes.
 Loss Of Use Of Both Hands Or Both Feet.
 Loss Of Sight Of One Eye.
 Loss Of Use Of Hand Or Foot.
 
 
 Rs. 2,00,000/-
 
 Partial Disability :-
 					Total and Irrecoverable Loss Of Sight Of One Eye.
 Loss of Use Of One Hand Or One Foot.
 
 
 Rs. 1,00,000/-
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Every Indian Citizen in the Age Group of 18 Years to 70 Years are Eligible for Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.
 Beneficiary should have a Jandhan Bank Account or Saving Bank Account in any Bank.
 Bank Account should be linked with the Person's Aadhar Number.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 It is a social security scheme for all Indians but especially focuses on uninsured poor and under privileged persons.
 Life Insurance Cover is only for 1 year starting from 1st of June to 31st of May every year.
 The annual renewal date of the scheme is 1st of June in every upcoming year.
 On consent from the policy holder, the amount of premium i.e. Rs. 20/- will be deducted through auto-debit mode from policy holder's account in a single instalment.
 Any person who exited the scheme at any point of time can join again the scheme in near future.
 A person who crosses the age of 70 years cannot register himself under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.
 It is mandatory to link person's Aadhar Card with his/her Bank Account.
 Beneficiary can register themselves in Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana through by filling application form in the Bank branch at any time in the year.
 Some Banks also gave facility to their customers to apply online for Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.
 In case of death of a policy holder, the nominee can receive the amount of Rs. 2 Lac.
 If any person has multiple bank accounts then in that case he/she can avail the benefit of the scheme from only single bank account of himself/herself.
 Conditions In Which No Claim Will Be Payable
 Beneficiary can not able claim for accidental insurance amount under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana if he/ she falls within the ambit of any of the below mentioned conditions :-
 	When beneficiary attained the age of 70 Years.
 Insufficient balance in the Bank Account for Premium Deduction.
 Closure of Bank Account by Beneficiary.
 When any person avail the benefit of same scheme through multiple bank accounts.

        " Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY)": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY)
 Launched Date
 9th of May 2015.
 Scheme Type
 Life Insurance Scheme
 Nodal Ministry
 Department of Financial Services.
 Official Website
 JanDhan se JanSuraksha Website.
 Eligibility
 Indian Citizen Between the Age Group Of 18 to 50 Years.
 Mode Of Apply
 Only Offline Mode Available Through The Banks.
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana is a Life Insurance Scheme of Department Of Financial Services under Ministry Of Finance.
 It is a social security scheme and was launched by Prime Minister Sh. Narendra Modi On 9th Of May 2015 in Kolkata.
 The main objective behind starting Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana is to provide social and financial security cover to people of India.
 This scheme is also called "Prime Minister Life Insurance Scheme" or "Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Scheme".
 It is a yearly personal life insurance scheme for the people who are uninsured.
 Financial Assistance of Rs. 2,00,000/- will be provided to nominee under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana in case of untimely demise of a insured person.
 Insurance Amount under this scheme is payable irrespective of cause of death of a person.
 This scheme is offered by Life Insurance Corporation of India and other Life Insurance Companies having collaboration with Banks and Post Office.
 It is up to Banks/ Post Offices to engage any Life Insurance Company to implement the scheme for their customers.
 Beneficiary has to pay a very nominal premium amount of Rs. 436/- per year for Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana.
 Person can enroll themselves under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana at any point of time in a financial year.
 Premium Amount will be paid through Auto Debit Mode.
 Beneficiary can Visit their Bank or Post Office and get themselves covered under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana.
 Benefits
 The following benefits will be provided to a person who is insured under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojaa :-
 	Personal Insurance Cover of Rs. 2,00,000/-
 Very Nominal Premium of Rs. 436/- per Year.
 Covers Death caused due to any reason.
 Nominee of Policy Holder will get Rs. 2 Lakh in case of Death of Policy Holder.
 
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Every Indian Citizen is Eligible.
 The Age of Person should be between 18 Years to 50 Years.
 Beneficiary should have Jandhan Bank Account or Saving Bank Account in any Bank or in a Post Office.
 Bank/ Post Office Account should be linked with the Person's Aadhar Number.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 It is a social security scheme especially focuses on uninsured poor and underprivileged persons.
 Life Insurance is only for 1 year starting from 1st June to 31st May in every year.
 The annual renewal date of the scheme is 1st of June in every upcoming year.
 On consent from the policy holder, the amount of premium i.e. Rs. 436/- will be paid though autodebit mode from policy holder account in a single instalment.
 Any person who exited the scheme at any point of time can join again the scheme in near future.
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana is exempted from GST.
 No need to submit health report or certificate to join Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana.
 A person who crosses the age of 50 years cannot register himself under this scheme.
 However, a person who registered himself/ herself for this scheme under auto debit facility will have auto renewal up to the age of 55 years.
 It is mandatory to link person's Aadhar Card with his/her Bank/ Post Office account.
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana can avail through by filling a form in the Bank Branch/ Post Office at any time in the year or the other mode is through netbanking facility.
 In case of death of a policy holder, the nominee can receive the amount of Rs.

2 Lac.
 If any person has multiple bank accounts then in that case he/ she can avail the benefit of the scheme from only single bank account of himself/ herself.
 Conditions In Which No Claim Will Be Payable
 When beneficiary attain the age of 55 Years.
 Insufficient Balance in the Bank/ Post Office Account.
 Closure of Bank/ Post Office Account.
 When any person avail the benefit of same scheme through multiple bank accounts.

 Eligibility
 Every Indian Citizen Between The Age Group Of 18 to 50 Years.

 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana is a Life Insurance Scheme of Department Of Financial Services under the Ministry Of Finance.
 It was launched in Kolkata by Prime Minister Sh. Narendra Modi On 9th Of May 2015.
 It is a one year insurance cover for a person, if his/her death caused by any possible reason.
 This scheme is offered by LIC and other Life Insurance Companies having collaboration with Banks and Post Office.
 It is up to Banks/Post Offices to engage any Life Insurance Company to implement the scheme for their customers.
 Aadhar is the primary KYC for the Bank/Post Office Account.
 Eligibility Criteria
 Every Indian Citizen in the age group of 18 to 50 years is eligible.
 A Person should have a Jandhan Bank Account or Saving Bank Account in any Bank or in a Post Office.
 Bank/Post Office Account should be linked with the person's Aadhar number.
 Benefits
 Insurance Cover of Rs. 2,00,000/-
 The amount of premium is very minimal, just Rs. 330/- per year.
 Covers death caused by any reason of a policy holder.
 Premium is Auto-debited from account holder's bank account on consent.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 It is a social security scheme for all Indians but especially focuses on uninsured poor and under-privileged persons.
 Life Insurance is only for 1 year starting from 1 June to 31st May in every year.
 The annual renewal date of the scheme is 1st of June in every upcoming year.
 On consent from the policy holder, the amount of premium i.e. Rs. 330/- will be paid though auto-debit mode from policy holder account in a single installment.
 Any person who exited the scheme at any point of time can join again the scheme in near future.
 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana is exempted from GST.
 No need to submit health report or certificate to join this scheme.
 A person who crosses the age of 50 years cannot register himself under this scheme.
 However, a person who registered himself/herself for this scheme under auto-debit facility will have auto-renewal up to the age of 55 years.
 It is mandatory to link person's Aadhar Card with his/her Bank/Post Office account.
 Scheme can avail through by filling a form in the Bank branch/Post Office at any time in the year or the other mode is through net-banking facility.
 In case of death of a policy holder, the nominee can receive the amount of Rs. 2 Lac.
 If any person has multiple bank accounts then in that case he/she can avail the benefit of the scheme from only single bank account of himself/herself.
 Conditions In Which No Claim Will Be Payable
 When beneficiary attain the age of 55 Years.
 Insufficient balance in the Bank/Post office account.
 Closure of Bank/Post account.
 When any person avail the benefit of same scheme through multiple bank accounts.
 Enrolling for the first time on or after 1st June 2021, insurance cover shall not be available if death happens within the 30 days of enrollment But, if death occurs due to accident within 30 days of enrollment then the nominee is entitle to claim the insurance amount of policy holder.

{
        " Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
 Launch Year
 2016
 Benefits
 
 Free Gas Connection
 Subsidy of Rs 300 upto 12 Refills
 
 Beneficiary
 Adult Women of Below Poverty Line
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 
 Through Online Application Form
 Through Offline Application Form
 
 Introduction
 The Scheme was first launched by our Hon'ble Prime Minister Of India Sh. Narendra Modi in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh on 1st of May 2016.
 "Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana" is a flagship scheme under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MOPNG).
 The main objective behind launching this scheme is to provide clean cooking fuel to the rural and deprived households which were using traditional cooking fuels such as Coal, Cow-Dung Cakes, Firewood, Crop Residue etc.
 Usage of this type of traditional cooking fuels had very bad impacts on the health of our rural women as well as on the environment.
 So keeping all this in mind, Government of India under the ambit of Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MOPNG) launched "Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana" with a tag line of "Swachh Indhan, Behtar Jeevan".
 Initially, the "Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana" was launched to cater 5 crore BPL households for which the govt allocated Rs 8000 Cr.
 But later, the scheme was revised to 8 Cr households and for this Govt allocates Rs 48000 Cr.
 Seven more categories i.e. Schedule Caste (SC)/Schedule Tribe (ST), Beneficiary of Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY), Beneficiary of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Gramin), Most Backward Class (MBC), Forest Dwellers, Tea and Ex-Tea Garden Tribes, People Residing in River Island (Beneficiary will submit supporting document) are added.
 In the Union budget for Fiscal Year 2021-2022, government announces for an additional 1 Crore LPG connection under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 From here the journey of Ujjwala 2.0 starts when our Hon'ble Prime Minister Of India Sh. Narendra Modi launched the second version of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) called Ujjwala 2.0 by handing over LPG connection at Mahoba Uttar Pradesh on 10th of August 2021.
 During the launched event Prime Minister also interact with the beneficiaries of the Ujjwala and also address the Nation.
 Under this, the govt aim to cover the remaining poor households with a target of 1 Cr connection.
 Under Ujjwala 2.0, the migrants households may also apply for a gas connection, which they can get by submitting a declaration form.
 As of 15 Feb 2024, the Govt has issued 102,228,333 gas connection under PMUY.
 Whereas, under Ujjwala 2.0 a total of 22,371,674 connections were released.
 Free of Cost Gas Connection and Subsidy of Rs. 300/- is provided to all eligible beneficiaries under Pradhanmantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 Eligible Women Beneficiaries can apply online for new gas connection under Pradhanmantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Cash Assistance of Rs. 1,600/- for a connection of 14.2kg cylinder.
 Cash Assistance of Rs. 1,150/- for a 5 kg Cylinder.
 Subsidy of Rs.

300/- is provided to all eligible beneficiaries under Pradhanmantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 Eligible Women Beneficiaries can apply online for new gas connection under Pradhanmantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Cash Assistance of Rs. 1,600/- for a connection of 14.2kg cylinder.
 Cash Assistance of Rs. 1,150/- for a 5 kg Cylinder.
 Subsidy of Rs. 300/- on Every PMUY Gas Cylinder Refill.
 This cash assistance per connection is used to issue Gas Connection whose details are;
 	Cylinder Security: Rs 1250 (for 14.2 KG) and Rs 800 (for 5 Kg) cylinder.
 Pressure Regulator Security: Rs 150
 LPG Hose: Rs 100
 Domestic Gas Consumer Card: Rs 25
 Installation Charges: Rs 75
 
 In Ujjwala 2.0 along with a deposit free LPG connection, Ujjwala 2.0 will provide first refill and hotplate free of cost to the beneficiaries.
 Migrants will not be required to submit ration card or address proof.
 A self- declaration for both "family declaration" and as a "proof of address" will sufficient.
 Eligibility Criteria
 To be eligible for the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY), the applicants must fulfill the following conditions:
 The minimum age of the women applicants is 18 years.
 Only Adult woman who are from any of the following categories may apply:
 	SC/ST Households
 Most backward Classes
 Pradhan Mantri Away Yojana (AAY)
 Tribal People
 Residents of Islands/River Island
 Enlisted under Socio Economic Caste Census Households. (AHL TIN)
 Tea and Ex-Tea Garden tribes
 Other Poor Families (for this they have to submit a 14 point declaration)
 
 The above mentioned category should not be in a possession of any of the following items, otherwise their application shall be disqualify for the scheme.
 	2/3/4 wheeler or fishing motorized boat.
 Mechanised 3/4 wheeler agricultural equipment.
 Over 50,000 credit limit of Kisan Credit Card.
 Any member of the households is government employee.
 Households with non-agriculture enterprises registered with government.
 Any members of the households earn more than 10,000 in a month.
 Paying Income or Professional tax.
 Households with 3 or more room with pucca walls and roof.
 Having a refrigerator.
 Owns a landline phone.
 Irrigation lands of more than 2.5 acres with one irrigation equipment.
 Irrigated lands of 5 acre or more for two or more crop season.
 7.5 acre or more land with at least one irrigation equipment.

 Latest Passport Size photograph
 How to Apply

 Online Application Procedure
 You can submit the, Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana Application Online by following the steps given here:
 The online application form for Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana is available at PMUV Portal.

 You must register before submitting the application form, where following details are required:
 	Applicants Name
 Mobile Number
 Email ID (If any)
 
 Post registration, login with the details generated in the same portal.
 Fill the application details carefully, and upload the documents if required.
 Preview the details filled in the PMUY application before final submission.

 Online Application Procedure
 You can submit the, Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana Application Online by following the steps given here:

 Offline Application Procedure
 Applicants fulfil the eligibility conditions may also submit their PMUY Application through offline form.
 You can collect the 'Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana Application form' from any LPG Distributor agency.
 In this PMUY application form you have to fill each details carefully.
 Affix all the required documents to confirm the KYC of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana.
 Submit the dully filled application form and documents to the agency.
 Gas agency will verify your submitted application form.
 After successful verification the gas connection under the PMUY will be issued.

 निःशुल्क गैस कनेक्शन।

 लाभार्थी
 महिलायें।
 आधिकारिक वेबसाइट
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना आधिकारिक वेबसाइट।
 नोडल मंत्रालय
 पेट्रोलियम एवं प्राकृतिक गैस मंत्रालय।
 सब्सक्रिप्शन
 योजना की निरंतर जानकारी के लिए यहाँ सब्सक्राइब करे।
 आवेदन का तरीका
 
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र द्वारा।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना ऑफलाइन आवेदन पत्र द्वारा।
 
 योजना के बारे मे
 प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी जी ने दिनांक 1 मई 2016 को बलिया, उत्तर प्रदेश में प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना की शुरुआत की थी।
 पेट्रोलियम एवं प्राकृतिक गैस मंत्रालय द्वारा इस योजना का संचालन किया जा रहा है।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना शुरू करने का मुख्य उद्देश्य एलपीजी कुकिंग फ्यूल को ग्रामीण इलाकों में पहुँचाना है जिससे कोयला, उपले, लकड़ी,

उपले, लकड़ी, फसल अवशेष के इस्तेमाल को रोका जा सके।
 खाना बनाने के लिए परंपरागत ईंधन का प्रयोग ग्रामीण इलाकों में आज भी बहुत किया जाता है जिससे महिलाओं की सेहत और पर्यावरण पर बुरा असर पड़ रहा है।
 इन्ही सब बातों को ध्यान में रखते हुवे भारत सरकार ने "स्वच्छ ईंधन, बेहतर जीवन" टैगलाइन के साथ प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना की शुरुआत की।
 योजना के शुरूआती दौर में प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत गरीबी रेखा से नीचे रहने वाले परिवारों की 5 करोड़ महिलाओं को एलपीजी कनेक्शन देने का लक्ष्य सरकार ने रखा था।
 महिलाओं को एलपीजी कनेक्शन प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में निशुल्क प्रदान किया जायेगा।
 इसके अलावा प्रत्येक गैस सिलिंडर के रिफिल कराने पर लाभार्थी महिला को 300/- रूपये की सब्सिडी भी प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत प्रदान की जाएगी।
 	फिर वर्ष 2018 में सरकार ने इस योजना के कार्यकाल को बढ़ा दिया।
 वर्ष 2018 में ही सरकार ने लाभार्थियों के 7 नए वर्गों को प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में जोड़ दिया जो है :-
 	अनुसूचित जनजाति/ अनुसूचित जनजाति।
 प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना के लाभार्थी।
 अंत्योदय अन्न योजना के लाभार्थी।

के 7 नए वर्गों को प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में जोड़ दिया जो है :-
 	अनुसूचित जनजाति/ अनुसूचित जनजाति।
 प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना के लाभार्थी।
 अंत्योदय अन्न योजना के लाभार्थी।
 वनवासी।
 अत्यंत पिछड़ा वर्ग।
 नदी द्वीप पर रहने वाले परिवार।
 टी या एक्स टी गार्डन ट्राइब।
 
 सरकार ने वर्ष 2018 में प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के कार्यकाल को बढ़ाते हुवे 8 करोड़ महिलाओं तक लाभ पहुँचाने का लक्ष्य रखा।
 अगस्त 2019 में सरकार द्वारा प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के लक्ष्य को पूरा कर लिया।
 उसके पश्चात वर्ष 2021-2022 के बजट के दौरान भारत सरकार ने प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत 1 करोड़ ओर एलपीजी कनेक्शन देने की घोषणा की।
 यहीं से दिनांक 10 अगस्त 2021, समय 12:30 बजे वीडियो कॉन्फ़्रेंसिंग के माध्यम से प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी जी ने उज्ज्वला योजना 2.0 की शुरुआत की।
 31 मई 2023 के आंकड़ों के अनुसार प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना 2.

से दिनांक 10 अगस्त 2021, समय 12:30 बजे वीडियो कॉन्फ़्रेंसिंग के माध्यम से प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी जी ने उज्ज्वला योजना 2.0 की शुरुआत की।
 31 मई 2023 के आंकड़ों के अनुसार प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना 2.0 में 1 करोड़ 50 लाख एलपीजी कनेक्शन प्रदान किये जा चुके थे।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत निःशुल्क गैस कनेक्शन और गैस सिलिंडर की रिफिल पर सब्सिडी प्राप्त करने के लिए लाभार्थी महिला ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र और ऑफलाइन आवेदन पत्र दोनों माध्यम से आवेदन कर सकती है।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र उज्ज्वला योजना की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट पर उपलब्ध है।
 वहीँ प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का ऑफलाइन आवेदन पत्र किसी भी गैस कंपनी के कार्यालय में जा कर प्राप्त किया जा सकता है।
 योजना के अंतर्गत मिलने वाले लाभ
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में गैस कनेक्शन लेने वाली लाभार्थी महिलाओं को सरकार द्वारा निम्नलिखित लाभ प्रदान किये जायेंगे :-
 	
 14.2 किलो के गैस सिलिंडर का कनेक्शन लेने पर 1,600/- रूपये का अनुदान।
 5 किलो के गैस सिलिंडर का कनेक्शन लेने पर 1,

2 किलो के गैस सिलिंडर का कनेक्शन लेने पर 1,600/- रूपये का अनुदान।
 5 किलो के गैस सिलिंडर का कनेक्शन लेने पर 1,150/- रूपये का अनुदान।
 उज्ज्वला गैस योजना कनेक्शन के प्रत्येक गैस सिलिंडर की रिफिल पर 300/- रूपये की सब्सिडी।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में मिलने वाले अनुदान निम्नलिखित खर्च के लिए है :-
 					सिलिंडर के सिक्योरिटी डिपाजिट के लिए :- 1,250/- रूपये 14.2 किलो सिलिंडर के लिए और 800/- रूपये 5 किलो के सिलिंडर के लिए।
 150/- रूपये प्रेशर रेगुलेटर के लिए।
 100/- रूपये एलपीजी होज़ के लिए।
 25/- रूपये उपभोक्ता कार्ड के लिए।
 75/- रूपये इंस्पेक्शन, इंस्टालेशन के लिए।
 
 लाभार्थी महिलाओ को प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में सिलिंडर की पहली रिफिल निःशुल्क दी जाएगी।
 प्रवासियों को कनेक्शन हेतु राशन कार्ड या निवास का प्रमाण जमा करने की आवश्यकता नहीं है।
 
 
 पात्रता
 आवेदक महिला होनी चाहिए।
 महिला की आयु 18 वर्ष से अधिक होनी चाहिए।
 घर में पहले से इंडेन, भारत गैस या एचपी गैस का कनेक्शन नहीं होना चाहिए।
 निम्नलिखित किसी भी एक वर्ग से सम्बन्ध रखने वाली महिला प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में आवेदन कर सकती है :-
 	अनुसूचित जाति/

भारत गैस या एचपी गैस का कनेक्शन नहीं होना चाहिए।
 निम्नलिखित किसी भी एक वर्ग से सम्बन्ध रखने वाली महिला प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में आवेदन कर सकती है :-
 	अनुसूचित जाति/ अनुसूचित जनजाति।
 प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना - ग्रामीण की लाभार्थी महिला।
 अत्यंत पिछड़ा वर्ग।
 अंत्योदय अन्न योजना की लाभार्थी।
 टी और पूर्व टी गार्डन ट्राइब।
 वनवासी।
 द्वीप या नदी द्वीप में रहने वाले परिवार।
 सामाजिक आर्थिक जनगणना में शामिल परिवार।
 अगर महिला ऊपर में से किसी भी वर्ग से सम्बन्ध नहीं रखती है तो भी 14 पॉइंट डिक्लेरेशन भर कर योजना का लाभ लिया जा सकता है।
 
 लाभ लेने के लिए आवश्यक दस्तावेज
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत गैस कनेक्शन के लिए आवेदन करते समय निम्नलिखित दस्तावेज़ होने अनिवार्य है :-
 	आधार कार्ड।
 KYC फॉर्म।
 राशन कार्ड।
 मोबाइल नम्बर।
 निवास का प्रमाण।
 बैंक खाते का विवरण।
 
 आवेदन की प्रक्रिया
 महिला लाभार्थी प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में प्रति माह गैस सिलिंडर पर सब्सिडी पाने के लिए ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र के माध्यम से आवेदन कर सकती है।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र

आवेदन की प्रक्रिया
 महिला लाभार्थी प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना में प्रति माह गैस सिलिंडर पर सब्सिडी पाने के लिए ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र के माध्यम से आवेदन कर सकती है।
 प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र उज्ज्वला योजना की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट पर उपलब्ध है।
 लाभार्थी महिला को वेबसाइट पर जाना होगा और आवेदन करे पर क्लिक करना होगा।
 फिर वेबसाइट द्वारा 3 गैस कंपनी के नाम दिखाए जायेंगे, इंडेन गैस, भारत गैस, और एचपी गैस।
 लाभार्थी महिला को उस गैस कंपनी का नाम चुनना होगा जिसका गैस कनेक्शन वो प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना के तहत लेना चाहती है।
 उसके बाद लाभार्थी महिला को प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र भरना होगा।
 आवेदन पत्र के साथ समस्त मांगे गए दस्तावेज़ों को अपलोड करना होगा।
 उसके बाद सबमिट बटन पर क्लिक करते ही लाभार्थी महिला का प्रधानमंत्री उज्ज्वला योजना का आवेदन पत्र जमा हो जायेगा।
 सम्बंधित गैस कंपनी द्वारा लाभार्थी महिला के घर आ कर भौतिक सत्यापन किया जायेगा।
 सत्यापन के पश्चात लाभार्थी महिला के नाम अन्य लाभों के साथ गैस कनेक्शन प्रदान कर दिया जायेगा।

        " Who can eligible": "Name Of the Scheme
 Begum Hazrat Mahal Scholarship Scheme.
 Ministry
 Ministry Of Minority Affairs
 Who can eligible
 Only Girl Students of class 9th to 12th of Six notified Minority Community
 Mode Of Applying 
 Only Online mode of application are accepted through National Scholarship Portal
 Amount Of Scholarship
 Rs.5000/ each for Class IX & X and Rs. 6000/ each for Class XI and XII
 Distribution 
 Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains and Parsis are the notified minority communities under Section 2 (c) of the National Commission for Minorities Act, 1992. The distribution of scholarship among the States/Union Territories will be made on the basis of population of the above notified minorities in the States/ Union Territories according to Census of 2011.
 Selection Procedure
 The selection of eligible students is based on the percentage of marks obtained by the candidates in qualifying exam and according to thier parent's/ guardian's annual income. Merit List is prepared on the basis of the marks obtained by the student in qualifying exam. State-wise-community-wise quota is fixed on the basis of minority population of the state in accordance to 2011 Census.
 Introduction:-
 "Begum Hazrat Mahal National Scholarship" For Meritorious Girl Students belonging to the minority community was first launched by the then Honourable Prime Minister of India (Late) Sh. Atal Bihari Vajpayee at National Conference of Educational and Economic Development of Minorities at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi on 03.05.2003. It was earlier known as "Maulana Azad National Scholarship" Scheme under Maulana Azad Education Foundation. It is a very popular scheme and its sanctioning quota is increasing year by year. Till date 8,84,864 girl students have been assisted with Rs.669.36 crore by the foundation spread all over the country.
 The main objective of the government to launch this scheme is to assist, promote and recognize the girls students belonging to the six notified National Minorities Community i.e. Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains and Parsis, who are not able to continue their education due to lack of financial support.
 The scheme will be announced by the concerned Union Territory Administration/State well in time, by giving advertisements in the leading language newspapers and local dailies/vernacular and by using any other suitable publicity media which is easily accessible by all.
 As per population figures of the minorities in the concentrated area according to 2011 census, a fixed number of scholarship quota will be allocated out of total scholarships to each State/UTs. If in case sufficient number of eligible application are not available from any State/ UTs/Community, then its balance quota will be allocated to the same community of other State/UTs from where eligible applications have been received.
 Scope of the Scheme
 Scholarship will only be given for expenditure on payment of fees of School/College, Syllabus books purchase, purchase of stationery/equipment required for the course and payment of Boarding/Lodging charges if applicable.
 Eligibility Criteria:
 
 Only Girls students belonging to six notified Minority Communities i.e. Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains and Parsis are eligible.
 
 
 Minorities Girl Students who are studying in Class 9th to Class 12th, and have secured at-least 50% marks or equivalent grade in aggregate in previous class/qualifying exam shall be eligible for Scholarship.
 
 
 Students Parent/Guardian Annual Income does not get exceeded Rs.2.00 Lakh from all sources.
 
 
 An Income certificate of parent/guardian, issued from a Competent Authority in the State/UTs Governments is required.
 
 
 A self-Certified community Certificate is required from a student who has attained 18 years of age. For others the Community Certificate certified by parent/guardian of the student is required.
 
 
 If a student violates the terms and condition of the scholarship or violates the school discipline, then the scholarship may be suspended or cancelled.

For others the Community Certificate certified by parent/guardian of the student is required.
 
 
 If a student violates the terms and condition of the scholarship or violates the school discipline, then the scholarship may be suspended or cancelled. If the State Government/Union Territory Administration duly satisfied of the reasons of violation of these regulation governing the scheme then the administration have right to directly cancel the award.
 
 
 If a student is found to have obtained a scholarship by false statement, her scholarship will be cancelled forthwith and the amount of the scholarship paid will be recovered by the concerned State/UT Govt.
 
 
 Under no circumstances student obtaining benefits under this scheme shall not be allowed to avail benefits of any other scheme for this purpose.
 
 
 A student shall be eligible for only one scholarship out of all the available Scholarships of Central Government meant for SC/ST/OBC/minority.
 
 
 Scholarship will not be given to more than two students from a family of the same class.
 
 
 No scholarship shall be given for studies abroad for any course.
 
 
 There are no fees/charges for either online application form or for any other service in this regard.
 
 
 Students who have entered Aadhaar in their online application correctly and Aadhaar seeded with any of their bank account, in such cases the amount of scholarship will be credited to Aadhaar seeded bank account only (though student has mentioned any other non-seeded bank account in online application).
 
 Instructions Related To Bank Account Details (to be filled by the students in online application form are as under):-
 From the drop down list students must carefully select their bank/branch name.
 Thereafter the complete bank account number must be entered correctly. Students are advised to get their account number verified by their concerned Bank Branch including Bank account number and IFS Code.
 If bank account details entered by students are found incorrect or not validated by the student's bank, the scholarship will be cancelled/amount will not be transferred even though the application is approved for scholarship).
 Bank Account holders must check their 'Know your Customer' (KYC) status from bank and if required the KYC must be done for successful transaction of scholarship amount.
 The Bank Account of student must be operational/active till the scholarship is disbursed.
 The Bank Account of student must be preferably in any scheduled Bank with core banking facility and proper IFS Code.
 The Bank Account must be in the name of either the student or a joint account of student with either mother or father or a legal guardian only.
 Renewal Of Scholarship:-
 There is no application for renewal of scholarship shall be entertained under any circumstances. Since the applications are open for all classes, i.e.

Since the applications are open for all classes, i.e. from 9th to 12th, the beneficiaries will have to apply afresh for each class.
 Mode Of Transfer Of Amount Of Scholarship:-
 Through Direct Benefit Transfer(DBT) mode the Amount of scholarship will be credited to the Beneficiary Bank Account.
 Students Already Getting Scholarship Are Not Eligible:-
 Any student getting scholarship under any scholarship scheme being implemented by the Centre/Sate Government, such students shall not be eligible to get scholarship under this scheme.
 Circumstances Under Which Scholarship Got Cancelled:-
 If due to any reason and at any point of time there is any gap of academic session in studies of the student then the Scholarship shall be deemed discontinued, or the awarded scholarship may be suspended or cancelled.
 Those applicant who failed to submit their application in the stipulated time limit, from them no claim for fresh/renewal of scholarship will be entertained.
 If it is founded that any student obtained scholarship by giving false statement/certificates, scholarship will be cancelled and the whole amount of the scholarship paid shall be recovered form the student, at the discretion of the concerned State Government/UTs Administration.
 Important Links

 Begum Hazrat Mahal Scholarship Scheme Frequently Asked Questions
 Contact Details

 	011 23583788.
 011 23583789.

 	scholarship-maef@nic.in.

        " Method I - By linking Aadhar Number to the bank account number and to the LPG consumer number.": " 
 PAHAL scheme was started by government of India on 1st June 2013. It is also known as DBTL(Direct benefit Transfer of LPG) scheme. The scheme was introduced for consumer to compulsorily link aadhar number for availing LPG subsidy directly in their bank accounts.
 How can you get LPG subsidy?
 Under PAHAL scheme, the LPG consumer can receive subsidy in his/her bank account by 2 methods: -
 Method I - By linking Aadhar Number to the bank account number and to the LPG consumer number.
 Method II - If you don't have an aadhar number, then you can directly receive subsidy in your bank account without using aadhar number.
 	Either you can Provide bank account information (bank account holder name /account number /IFSC code) to the LPG distributor for capture in LPG database. OR
 You can LPG consumer information (17 digit LPG consumer ID) to bank.
 
 Price of LPG for you under PAHAL(DBTL): -
 In th districts of PAHAL(DBTL), once you join the scheme, domestic LPG cylinders will cost you at market determined price which does not include subsidy from the starting date of the scheme.

OR
 You can LPG consumer information (17 digit LPG consumer ID) to bank.
 
 Price of LPG for you under PAHAL(DBTL): -
 In th districts of PAHAL(DBTL), once you join the scheme, domestic LPG cylinders will cost you at market determined price which does not include subsidy from the starting date of the scheme. A one-time Advance will be provided to every CTC consumer joining PAHAL (DBTL).
 You will be receiving SMS at every stage in the scheme, to keep you informed about your status .
 Steps to link Aadhar with LPG and Bank: -
 Form 1 : You can link your Aadhar Number to your bank account by filling Form1 and depositing it either at bank branch or in drop box placed at LPG distributorship.
 Form 2 : You can link your Aadhar Number with your LPG consumer number by Submitting Form 2 to the LPG distributor (or drop in the designated drop box).
 Form 3 : You can provide LPG consumer information (17 digit LPG consumer ID) in Form 3 to your bank.
 Form 4 : If you do not have an aadhar card you can provide bank account information (bank account holder name /account number /IFSC code) in Form 4 to the LPG distributor.
 Form5 : If you want to opt-out subsidy means if you can afford to pay the market price for LPG, submit Form 5 at the LPG distributorship along with valid proof of Identity.
 Contact details:
 HPCL Website : www.myhpgas.in.
 IOCL Website : www.indane.co.in
 Common Call Centre Number:  18002333555

        " Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY).": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY).
 Launched on
 23 September 2018
 Objective
 To Provide Free of Cost Quality Health Services to Poor People.
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
 Official Website
 https://www.pmjay.gov.in/
 Scheme Budget
 Rs. 8,088 Crore.
 Introduction
 Ayushman Bharat Yojana, is an important health service scheme of Government of India.
 It is also known by the name of Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY).
 It was launched by the Prime Minister of India on 23rd September 2018 in Ranchi, Jharkhand.
 Ayushman Bharat Yojana has two components :-
 	Health and Wellness Centres (HWCs).
 Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY).
 
 Under the Health and Wellness Centres component, the Government of India announced the creation of 1,50,000 Health and Wellness Centres (HWCs) by updating existing sub centres and primary health centres.
 These centres are meant to provide comprehensive primary health care (CPHC) facilities to the people of country.
 They cover both maternal and child health services and non-communicable diseases, including essential medicines and diagnostic services free of charge.
 The Second component under the Ayushman Bharat Yojana is the Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana or PM-JAY.
 It is the world's largest health insurance scheme which aims to provide a health cover of Rs. 5 Lakh per family per year.
 More than 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable families (about 50 crore beneficiaries)will get the benefit of this scheme.
 The families included are based on the deprivation and occupational criteria of Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC 2011) from rural and urban areas.
 Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY) was earlier known as National Health Protection Scheme (NHPS).
 Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY) is fully funded by the Government and the cost of implementation is shared between the Central and State Governments.
 Benefits of the scheme
 Under Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana provides cashless cover of Rs.

5 Lakh per family per year.
 More than 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable families (about 50 crore beneficiaries)will get the benefit of this scheme.
 The families included are based on the deprivation and occupational criteria of Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC 2011) from rural and urban areas.
 Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY) was earlier known as National Health Protection Scheme (NHPS).
 Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY) is fully funded by the Government and the cost of implementation is shared between the Central and State Governments.
 Benefits of the scheme
 Under Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana provides cashless cover of Rs. 5,00,000/- per year to each eligible family.
 The cover under the scheme includes all expenses incurred on the following components of treatment :-
 	Medical Examination.
 Treatment and Consultation.
 Pre-hospitalization.
 Medicine and Medical Consumables.
 Non-intensive and intensive care services.
 Diagnostic and laboratory investigations.
 Medical Implantation services.
 Accommodation Benefits.
 Food Services.
 Complication arising during treatment.
 Post-hospitalization follow-up care up to 15 days.
 
 The benefit of Rs. 5,00,000/- can be used by one or all of the family.
 There is no limit on the size of the family or the age of the family members.
 Pre-existing diseases are also covered under this scheme.
 Any eligible person suffering from any medical condition before being covered by Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana will now be able to get treatment for all type of medical conditions from the day beneficiary get enrolled.
 Eligible Beneficiaries
 Rural Beneficiaries
 
 There are 6 type of eligibility criteria for rural areas :-
 				D1- Only one room with kuchcha walls and kuchcha roof.
 D2-No adult member between ages 16 to 59.
 D3- Household with no adult male member between ages 16 to 59.
 D4-Disabled member and no able-bodied adult member.
 D5- SC/ST households.
 D7- Landless households deriving a major part of their income from manual casual labour.
 
 This automatically includes the Destitute/living on alms, manual scavenger households, primitive tribal group, Legally released bonded labour.
 
 Urban Beneficiaries
 
 For Urban areas, the following 11 occupational categories of workers are eligible for the scheme :-
 				Ragpicker.
 Begger.
 Domestic Worker.
 Street Vendor/Cobbler/Hawker/other service provider working on the street.
 Construction worker/Plumber/Mason/Labour/Painter/Welder/Security Guard/Coolie and other head-load worker.
 Sweeper/Sanitation worker/Mali.
 Home-based worker/Artisan/Handicrafts Worker/Tailor.
 Transport worker/Driver/Conductor/Helpers to drivers and conductors/Cart Puller/Rickshaw Puller.
 Shop Worker/Assistant/Peon in small establishment/Helper/Delivery Assistant/Attendant/Waiter.
 Electrician/Mechanic/Assembler/Repair Worker.
 Washer-Man/Chowkidar.
 
 
 Features of the Scheme
 The government of India has committed to ensure that its population has universal access to good quality health care services without facing financial hardship.
 In Ayushman Bharat Yojana, also known as Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana, cashless and paperless treatment will be provided at public and private selected hospitals.
 The primary objective of this scheme is to provide the benefit cover of Rs. 5 Lakh per family per year to the poor people of the country.
 It also aims at reducing financial burden on poor and vulnerable groups arising out of catastrophic hospital episodes.
 Objective of this scheme to provide benefit to around 10 crores families or 50 crore Indian people.
 Medical facilities will be available in both public and private hospitals.
 There is no restriction on family size, age or gender.
 This scheme covers 3 days of pre-hospitalisation and 15 days of post hospitalization expenses incurred on treatment.
 For any grievance, a 24*7 helpline number (14555) is available for people.
 Under this scheme, the beneficiary can take benefit anywhere in the country.
 Status of the Scheme
 Status as on 21st of March 2022
 Hospital Admissions
 3,11,27,750

 For any grievance, a 24*7 helpline number (14555) is available for people.
 Under this scheme, the beneficiary can take benefit anywhere in the country.
 Status of the Scheme
 Status as on 21st of March 2022
 Hospital Admissions
 3,11,27,750
 Ayushman Card Issued
 17,86,97,235
 How to Avail Benefit
 To take benefit of this scheme, it is necessary for the beneficiary to have an Ayushman card.
 Beneficiary can apply in any nearest CSC center to get Ayushman Card.
 In every government and private empaneled hospitals, separate counter facility has been provided for the patients coming under Ayushman Yojana.
 It is mandatory to register first at the same counter during general treatment of beneficiary.
 But in case of emergency, first patient can be admitted and later the registration can be done.
 After the registration is done, the government will bear all the cost of the treatment.
 It is necessary to show Ayushman card while taking benefit under this scheme in any hospital.
 Employees' State Insurance Corporation Joins Ayushman Bharat Yojana.
 Employees' State Insurance (ESIC) has entered into a partnership with National Health Authority (NHA).
 This convergence between Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (ABPM-JAY) and Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) will enable Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) beneficiaries to access services at Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana empaneled Hospitals and vice versa.
 In the initial phase, it was launched as a pilot project in Ahmednagar, Maharashtra and Bidar, Karnataka, Where Employees'' State Insurance beneficiaries got access to medical care services of Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY) empaneled Hospitals.
 On successful completion of this pilot project, the Employees'' State Insurance Scheme has been extended to 113 designated districts in 4 states by merging with Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana.
 Those States are :-
 	Chhattisgarh.
 Karnataka.
 Madhya Pradesh.
 Maharashtra.
 
 The major benefits to the Employees'' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) beneficiaries are :-
 	Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) beneficiaries will get access to healthcare provided under Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY).
 Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) beneficiaries will also able to avail the services in Employees'' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) empanelled Hospitals.
 Beneficiaries of Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) can use their ESIC card to access free treatment at Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) empanelled Hospitals.
 Similarly, beneficiaries of Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) can use their AB PM-JAY card to access free treatment at Employees' State Insurance Corporation empanelled hospitals.

        " Scope of the scheme :": "Introduction:
 The Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) scheme was launched by the Government of India in August, 2004 for setting up residential schools at upper primary level for girls belonging predominantly to the SC, ST, OBC and minorities in difficult areas.
 KGBV is being implemented in educationally backward blocks (EBBs) of the country where the female rural literacy is below the national average and gender gap in literacy is above the national average. The scheme provides for a minimum reservation of 75% of the seats for girls belonging to SC, ST, OBC or minority communities and priority for the remaining 25%, is accorded to girls from families below poverty line.
 The objective of KGBV is to ensure access and quality education to the girls of disadvantaged groups of society by setting up residential schools at upper primary level.
 Scope of the scheme :
 The scope of the scheme is the set up of schools in areas with :
 	Concentration of tribal population,
 With low female literacy and/or a large number of girls out of school;
 Concentration of SC, OBC and minority populations,
 With low female literacy and/or a large number of girls out of school;
 Areas with a large number of small, scattered habitations that do not qualify for a school;
 
 Eligibility Criteria :
 Girls belonging to disadvantaged groups such as
 	SC,
 ST,
 OBC,
 Minority and
 Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
 
 Girl students in the age group of 14 to 18 years.
 Girls living in area with low female literacy
 Girls in difficult circumstances who are unable to complete primary education can be enrolled under exceptional cases
 Coverage of KGBV Scheme :
 The scheme is being implemented in 27 States/UTs namely:

 508 in Scheduled Tribes (SC) SFD districts,
 of which 329 and 508 are operational respectively.
 
 544 KGBVs were sanctioned and operational in Muslim Concentration districts.
 912 out of 913 KGBVs sanctioned were operational in 88 districts identified for the Integrated Action Plan for Selected Tribal and Backward Districts up to 30.6.2014.
 Components of the KGBV Scheme :
 Setting up of residential schools where there are a minimum of 50 girls predominantly from the SC, ST and minority communities are available to study in the school at the elementary level.

 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) - Housing for All.
 Launched on
 25th June 2015.
 Objective
 To provide pucca houses, electricity connection, LPG Connection and Driniking Water Connection.
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.
 Offcial Website
 Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban).
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana was launched by Government of India on 25th June 2015.
 To provide housing for all urban poor with a target of 20 million affordable houses by 31st of March 2022.
 Now this scheme is extended to March 2024.
 This scheme provides central assistance to the implementing agencies through state/union territories and
 	Central Nodal Agencies to provide housing for eligible families.
 It is the programme that is initiated to avail the housing facility to the urban poor.
 The main objective of this plan is to provide financial assistance to some of the weakest sections of society to build a house for their personal living.
 Vision: - To replace all temporary (kutcha) houses from Indian villages.
 The following persons will be eligible under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY):-
 	Applicant under the age group of 70.
 Do not availed any government subsidy benefit under PMAY scheme.
 Who have not any property under his name and along with any family member.
 
 Home renovation and self construction loan will be availed only to applicants who come under the category of EWS and LIG.
 Eligible Persons Can Avail the benefits of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) by applying in the following manner:-
 	Through Online PMAY Portal. 
 
 Eligibility
 Applicant under the age group of 70.
 Do not availed any government subsidy benefit under PMAY scheme.
 Who have not any property under his name and along with any family member.
 PMAY is applicable to borrowers belonging to the :-
 	Beneficiary
 Annual Income
 Economically Weaker Section (EWS)
 Up to Rs.3 lakh
 Lower Income Group (LIG)
 Rs.3 lakh to Rs.6 lakh
 Middle Income Group I (MIG I)
 Rs.6 lakh to Rs.12 lakh
 Middle Income Group I (MIG II)
 Rs.12 lakh to Rs.18 lakh
 
 Benefits of the schemes:-
 The Following Facilities are provided under the scheme includes :-
 	facility of houses have a toilet,
 electricity connection,
 LPG connection,
 drinking water and
 Jan dhan banking facilities, etc.
 
 Apart From the above mentioned facilities the following benefits are provided :-
 	Beneficiary
 Annual Income
 Economically Weaker Section (EWS)
 
 An interest subsidy of 6.5% is provided to the beneficiary.
 Maximum loan tenure is 20 years.
 
 Lower Income Group (LIG)
 Middle Income Group I (MIG I)
 
 An interest subsidy of 4% is provided to the beneficiary.
 Maximum loan tenure is 20 years.
 
 Middle Income Group I (MIG II)
 
 An interest of 3% is provided to the beneficiary.
 Maximum loan tenure is 20 years.
 
 
 Steps to apply for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana(Urban):-
 To get financial assistance under the Scheme the candidate has to first go to PMAY Portal. 
 First of all, the applicant has to Register himself/herself on the J&K Mission PMAY Portal.
 After registration, the applicant will have to login to the portal with the given login ID and password.
 Select citizen assessment drop down and click on benefits under 3 components.
 Submit your aadhar details for authentication
 Fill the basic details and upload the required documents as required.
 After filling all the information, the application form has to be submitted.
 After the application is submitted, the application form will be verified by the concerned officer.
 After the approval of the application form, the applicant will be informed.
 For slum dwellers:
 Same procedure is followed to apply for the scheme. In the initial stage just go to the website pmaymis.gov.in.
 Select citizen assessment drop down and click at slum dwellers.

First of all, the applicant has to Register himself/herself on the J&K Mission PMAY Portal.
 After registration, the applicant will have to login to the portal with the given login ID and password.
 Select citizen assessment drop down and click on benefits under 3 components.
 Submit your aadhar details for authentication
 Fill the basic details and upload the required documents as required.
 After filling all the information, the application form has to be submitted.
 After the application is submitted, the application form will be verified by the concerned officer.
 After the approval of the application form, the applicant will be informed.
 For slum dwellers:
 Same procedure is followed to apply for the scheme. In the initial stage just go to the website pmaymis.gov.in.
 Select citizen assessment drop down and click at slum dwellers. Remaining steps are same as the above.

 FAQs
 What is Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) ?
 	Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana was launched by Government of India to provide housing for all urban poor with a target of 20 million affordable houses by 31st of March 2022. The main objective of this plan is to provide financial assistance to some of the weakest sections of society to build a house for their personal living.
 What is In-Situ Slum Redevelopment?
 	In-Situ Slum redevelopment is a central Assistance of Rs.1,00,000 per house is allotted for all houses built for eligible slum dwellers using land as Resource with participation of private developers.
 What is Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)?
 	Interest Subsidy up to Rs 2,67,000 per house is allotted for Beneficiaries of
 	Economically Weaker Section (EWS)
 Low Income Group (LIG),
 Middle Income Group (MIG)-I
 Middle Income Group (MIG)-II seeking housing loans from Banks, Housing Finance Companies and other such institutions for acquiring/constructing houses.
 
 	The interest subsidies of 6.5%, 4% and 3% on loan amount up to Rs. 6 lakh, Rs. 9 lakh and Rs. 12 lakh are allotted for a house with carpet area of up to 60, 160 and 200 Sq.Meter for EWS/LIG, MIG I and MIG II respectively. The benefit for EWS/LIG beneficiaries under CLSS works out to as high as Rs. 6 lakh over a loan period of 20 years.
 What is Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP)?
 	Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP) aims at providing central assistance of Rs 1,50,000 per EWS house where at least 35% of the houses in the projects are for EWS category and a single project has at least 250 houses.
 What is Beneficiary led individual house construction enhancements (BLC)?
 	Under this component, Central Assistance of Rs.1.5 lakh is available to individual eligible families belonging to EWS categories to either construct new houses or enhance existing houses on their own to cover the beneficiaries who are not able to take advantage of any other component of the Mission.
 	If the beneficiary has a pucca house with carpet area of up to 21 sq. mt. area or a semi-pucca house, lacking in one of the facilities- i.e. room, kitchen, toilet, bath or a combination of these, it may be taken up for enhancement subject to ULB/State ensuring structural safety of the house and adherence to following conditions:
 	• The total carpet area after enhancement must not be less than 21 sq. mt and must not be more than 30 sq.

mt. area or a semi-pucca house, lacking in one of the facilities- i.e. room, kitchen, toilet, bath or a combination of these, it may be taken up for enhancement subject to ULB/State ensuring structural safety of the house and adherence to following conditions:
 	• The total carpet area after enhancement must not be less than 21 sq. mt and must not be more than 30 sq. mt.
 	• Enhancement shall mean addition of minimum carpet area of 9.0 square meters in to the existing house with pucca construction of at least one habitable room or room with kitchen and/or bathroom and/or toilet conforming to NBC norms.
 Which nodal agencies are operating or responsible for disbursal of the subsidy under Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)?
 	NHB, HUDCO and SBI
 What is criteria for EWS LIG MIG categories for the purpose of the Scheme?
 	The EWS/LIG/MIG categories are defined as follows:
 	• EWS households income upto Rs. 3.00 lakhs per annum.
 	• LIG households income between Rs. 3.00 lakhs to Rs. 6.00 lakhs per annum.
 	• MIG-I households income between Rs. 6.00 lakhs to Rs. 12.00 lakhs per annum.
 	• MIG-II households income between Rs. 12.00 lakhs to Rs. 18.00 lakhs per annum. States/UTs have flexibility to redefine the annual income criteria as per local needs with the approval of Ministry.

        " 70 वर्ष से कम आयु के आवेदक।": "सभी शहरी गरीबों के लिए आवास प्रदान करने के लिए भारत सरकार द्वारा प्रधान मंत्री आवास योजना २५ जून २०१५ को शुरू की गई थी। इस योजना के अंतर्गत २ करोड़ किफायती घरों के लक्ष्य के साथ पात्र परिवारों को आवास प्रदान करना है।
 लक्ष्य: - यह योजना राज्य / केंद्र शासित प्रदेशों और केंद्रीय

आवास योजना २५ जून २०१५ को शुरू की गई थी। इस योजना के अंतर्गत २ करोड़ किफायती घरों के लक्ष्य के साथ पात्र परिवारों को आवास प्रदान करना है।
 लक्ष्य: - यह योजना राज्य / केंद्र शासित प्रदेशों और केंद्रीय नोडल एजेंसियों के माध्यम से कार्यान्वयन एजेंसियों को केंद्रीय सहायता प्रदान करती है ताकि पात्र परिवारों को आवास प्रदान किया जा सके। इस योजना का मुख्य उद्देश्य समाज के कुछ सबसे कमजोर वर्गों को उनके व्यक्तिगत जीवन यापन के लिए घर बनाने के लिए वित्तीय सहायता प्रदान करना है।
 दष्टि: - भारतीय गांवों से सभी अस्थायी (कच्चे) घरों को बदलना ।
 कौन आवेदन कर सकता है?
 70 वर्ष से कम आयु के आवेदक।
 आवेदक जो आर्थिक रूप से कमजोर वर्ग के अंतर्गत आता है यानी जिसकी आय 3 लाख प्रति वर्ष से कम है।
 वे आवेदक जो (LIG) निम्न आय वर्ग के अंतर्गत आते हैं यानी जिनकी आय सीमा 6 लाख प्रति वर्ष है।
 आवेदक जो (MIG I) मध्य आय समूह के अंतर्गत आते हैं यानी जिनकी आय प्रति वर्ष 6 से 12 लाख के बीच है।
 आवेदक जो (MIG II) के अंतर्गत आता है यानी जिसकी आय प्रति वर्ष 12 से 18 लाख के बीच है।
 आवेदक जिन्होंने PMAY योजना के तहत किसी भी सरकारी सब्सिडी का लाभ नहीं लिया

यानी जिनकी आय प्रति वर्ष 6 से 12 लाख के बीच है।
 आवेदक जो (MIG II) के अंतर्गत आता है यानी जिसकी आय प्रति वर्ष 12 से 18 लाख के बीच है।
 आवेदक जिन्होंने PMAY योजना के तहत किसी भी सरकारी सब्सिडी का लाभ नहीं लिया है।
 आवेदक जिनके पास उनके नाम के साथ और परिवार के किसी सदस्य के पास कोई संपत्ति नहीं है।
 ईडब्ल्यूएस और एलआईजी की श्रेणी में आने वाले आवेदकों को ही होम रिनोवेशन और सेल्फ कंस्ट्रक्शन लोन लिया जाएगा।
 विकलांग व्यक्तियों, एसटी / एससी / ओबीसी, अल्पसंख्यकों और ट्रांसजेंडर व्यक्तियों को प्राथमिकता दी जाती है
 योजना के लाभ: -
 इस योजना में मिलने वाली सुविधाएं : -
 	घरों में शौचालय
 बिजली कनेक्शन,
 एलपीजी कनेक्शन,
 पीने का पानी और
 जनधन बैंकिंग सुविधाएं, आदि।
 
 ईडब्ल्यूएस और एलआईजी के लिए: - इस योजना के तहत, लाभार्थी को 6.

एलपीजी कनेक्शन,
 पीने का पानी और
 जनधन बैंकिंग सुविधाएं, आदि।
 
 ईडब्ल्यूएस और एलआईजी के लिए: - इस योजना के तहत, लाभार्थी को 6.5% की ब्याज सब्सिडी प्रदान की जाती है। अधिकतम ऋण अवधि 20 वर्ष है।
 MIG (I) के लिए: - लाभार्थी को 4% की ब्याज सब्सिडी प्रदान की जाती है।
 अधिकतम ऋण अवधि 20 वर्ष है।
 MIG (II) के लिए: - लाभार्थी को 3% का ब्याज प्रदान किया जाता है।
 अधिकतम ऋण अवधि 20 वर्ष है।

        " Skilling and Placement under DDU-GKY": "Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana(DDU-GKY) is a Central government scheme for rural youth launched on 25 September 2014. It is a part of National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM), introduced with the dual objectives of adding diversity to the income of rural poor families and cater to the career aspirations of rural youth.
 Vision : - To transform rural poor youth into an economically independent and globally relevant workforce.
 Mission : - To reduce poverty by enabling poor for households to access gainful and sustainable employment that provides regular wages.
 The aim of DDU-GKY is to skill rural youth who are poor and provide them with jobs having regular monthly wages or above the minimum wages.

It is a part of National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM), introduced with the dual objectives of adding diversity to the income of rural poor families and cater to the career aspirations of rural youth.
 Vision : - To transform rural poor youth into an economically independent and globally relevant workforce.
 Mission : - To reduce poverty by enabling poor for households to access gainful and sustainable employment that provides regular wages.
 The aim of DDU-GKY is to skill rural youth who are poor and provide them with jobs having regular monthly wages or above the minimum wages. The scheme mainly focuses on the youth in the age group of 15-35 years.
 Skilling and Placement under DDU-GKY
 Awareness building within the community on the opportunities
 Identifying rural youth who are poor
 Mobilizing rural youth who are interested
 Counseling of youth and parents
 Selecting on the basis of aptitude
 Imparting knowledge, industry linked skills and attitude that enhance employability
 Providing jobs that can be verified through methods that can stand up to independent scrutiny, and which pays above minimum wages
 Supporting the person so employed for sustainability after placement
 Eligibility Criteria :
 Rural youth in the age group between 15 and 35 years.
 Person belonging to SC/ST category.
 Women
 Persons with disability
 Persons belonging to Particularly vulnerable tribal group (PVTG)
 Person who completed even a little bit schooling
 Unemployed or work as labour in fields
 Person who earn a daily wage doing odd jobs
 Person who belongs to a family where at least one person has worked for 15 days in the MGNREGA scheme in the last year
 Person belongs to a family where one person belongs to a Self-Help Group (SHG)
 Person older than 35 years here is a relaxation for women, persons with disabilities, victims of human trafficking and other vulnerable groups.
 Transgender and other special groups (rehabilitated bonded labour, victims of trafficking, manual scavengers, trans-genders, HIV positive persons amongst others)
 From national level social inclusion is done through
 50 % funds earmarked for SCs and STs,
 3% for persons with disabilities
 15% for minority groups
 33% are to be women in each training program
 Documents required to apply for DDU-GKY
 Aadhar Card/Voter ID card/any government photo ID card.
 Birth Certificate,
 BPL Card
 MGNREGA worker card with a minimum of 15 days of completed work
 Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) card of household
 Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) or BPL PDS card of your household
 NRLM-Self Help Group identification or certificate for any member of your household
 SC/ST Certificate issued by competent authority, with any of the above
 For person with disability - Disability Certificate issued by a Registered Medical Practitioner, with any of the above
 Benefits of Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
 It offers completely free skill training ar the training centres.
 There are no fees/charge for
 	registration,
 examination,
 certification,
 placement.
 
 Aadhar card or similar bio-metric Identification Card.
 A bank account in the person's name
 It offers free food and accommodation in a residential training program
 Free uniform, books and learning material.
 Reimbursement of to & fro and meal cost, transferred directly to bank account.
 Free access to a computer at the computer lab with working internet, one computer per person.
 DDU-GKY Skill Training Certificate from NCVT or SSC upon successful completion of the training program.
 It provides job interviews and placement opportunities at no cost. And a job with a minimum salary of Rs. 6,000/- per month.
 Post Placement salary top-up every month for 2-6 months as per:
 	If person is placed in his/her State of Domicile, in a town smaller than District HQ, then for 2 months, directly transferred to his/her bank account
 If applicant is placed in his/her State of Domicile, in the District HQ or larger towns, then for 3 months, directly transferred to person's salary bank account
 If placed outside the State of Domicile, then for 6 months, directly transferred to bank account
 
 It provides free counselling and guidance 
 In case of Industrial Internships
 Rs. 4,500/- one time for travel to or from the placement to or from home, directly transferred to his/her bank account.
 Rs. 5,000/- per month Stipend for 12 months from start of job directly transferred to bank account.

6,000/- per month.
 Post Placement salary top-up every month for 2-6 months as per:
 	If person is placed in his/her State of Domicile, in a town smaller than District HQ, then for 2 months, directly transferred to his/her bank account
 If applicant is placed in his/her State of Domicile, in the District HQ or larger towns, then for 3 months, directly transferred to person's salary bank account
 If placed outside the State of Domicile, then for 6 months, directly transferred to bank account
 
 It provides free counselling and guidance 
 In case of Industrial Internships
 Rs. 4,500/- one time for travel to or from the placement to or from home, directly transferred to his/her bank account.
 Rs. 5,000/- per month Stipend for 12 months from start of job directly transferred to bank account. This will be paid only when employer submits proof that the person is working in the job.
 After 12 months of successful training, a job with a minimum salary of Rs. 10,000/- per month.
 How to apply for DDU-GKY?
 You can get enrolled with Gram Panchayat or Gram Rozgar Sewak, who in turn will recommend the nearby Training Centre or its mobilization staff to meet and offer counselling and guidance
 You can find a nearby training centre and contact them directly
 You can find a trade you want to learn, and the contact information of the training centre teaching the trade
 Click on "Apply Now" and register yourself on Kaushal Panjee portal under "Candidate Registration"
 	Whichever way you choose, the DDUGKY officials will reach out to you, visit you in your home, talk to you, your parents, friends and others. They will take you to the nearby training centre and be with you till such time that you enrol.
 Skill training is provided under DDU-GKY for the following industry sectors :
 
 Agriculture

    },
    {
        " The claim for relief under the Atal Beemit Kalyaan Yojana will be payable after the three months of his/her clear unemployment.": "The scheme named as "Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana" is a welfare measure for employees covered under Section 2(9), in the form of cash compensation up to 90 days, once in a lifetime,to be claimed after 3 months in one or more spells for being rendered unemployed; provided the employee should have completed 2 years of insurable employment and has contributed not less than 78 days in each of the 4 consecutive contribution periods immediately preceding to the claim of the relief. The relief shall not exceed 25% of the average earning per day.
 The ESICorporation in its 175th meeting on 18.09.2018 decided to provide Relief to the Insured Person (IP) who has been rendered unemployed subject to the exclusions in the form of cash compensation .
 Duration of allowance
 The maximum duration, for which an IP shall be eligible to draw the Relief under the Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana (ABVKY) will be 90 days once in life time after a minimum of two years of Insurable Employment and subject to the contributory conditions specified above.
 The claim for relief under the Atal Beemit Kalyaan Yojana will be payable after the three months of his/her clear unemployment.
 The relief will be paid for clear month of unemployment. No prospective claim will be allowed.
 In case the beneficiary gets gainful employment in between the three months of unemployment for which he was eligible for relief under ABVKY, the relief will be payable for clear month of unemployment between the date of unemployment and date of re-employment. The balance of 90 days of relief in this case may be claimed in the same manner as mentioned above based upon the initial contributory conditions by the beneficiary in case he again renders unemployed from Insurable employment within one year from initial unemployment.
 Eligibility
 Employees who are covered under Section 2(9) of the ESI Act 1948.
 The Insured Person (IP) should have been rendered unemployed during the period the relief is claimed.
 Applicant should have been in insurable employment for a minimum period of two years.
 He/She should have contributed not less than 78 days during each of the preceding four contribution periods.
 Aadhar and Bank Account of the Insured Person should be linked with insured person database
 The contribution in respect of him should have been paid or payable by the employer.
 The contingency of the unemployment should not have been as a result of any punishment for misconduct or superannuation or voluntary retirement.
 ABVKY Relief will not be applicable under following circumstances:
 If the employees declared illegal Strike resorted to by the competent authority.
 If contributory service is less than 2 years
 During lock out.
 On attaining the age of superannuation.
 On being re-employed elsewhere during the period he/she is in receipt of Relief under ABVKY.
 Dismissal/termination under disciplinary action.
 Voluntary abandonment of employment/ voluntary retirement/ premature retirement.
 Convicted (i.e. punished for false statement) under the provisions of Section 84 of the ESI Act read with Rule 62 of the ESI (Central) Rule
 On death of beneficiary
 How to apply for claim for relief
 1.The claimant can apply for relief claim anytime after being rendered unemployed, but not later than 1 year from the date of unemployment to the appropriate Branch Office in the form of affidavit in the prescribed Form (AB-1)
 2.The applicant have to submit his claim to his designated Branch office.
 3.On the ESIC Portal a link for generating claim for Atal Bimit Kalyan Yojana will be given.
 4.The Insured Person will have to enter his
 insurance number,
 Aadhar Number,
 Bank Account Number,
 the period of claim.
 Bank Account Details
 Mobile Number
 5.
 The system will check his eligibility: -
 if he is eligible it will generate claim Form AB-1 along with a forwarding letter from his last employer in Form AB-2 and instruction for the IP
 If he is not eligible, a regret message of his ineligibility will be sent.
 6.The eligible Insured person will take the printout of the claim submitted above and letter generated by the system to the employer and submit the duly signed claim in affidavit along with required forwarding by the employer to his designated ESIC Branch Office.

Each claim thus generated will have an auto generated unique ID number.
 7.On claim receipt the details as mentioned by the applicant IP will be checked in the system by the staff at the Branch Office under supervision of the Branch Manager. Then, the system will calculate the claimant's eligibility for relief under the scheme and its quantum for which the claimant is entitled based upon the details provided by the IP as well as the contribution and other details available in the system.
 8.The payment of the relief will be made to the IP's bank account.
 Payment Mode
 The Relief under ABVKY will be paid by Branch Office to IP directly in his bank account electronically only.
 In the event of death of IP, the amount of Relief under ABVKY shall be paid/ payable to his/her nominee/legal heir by the account payee cheque only.
 The claimant's bank account details in the ESIC Database is a pre-condition for claiming this relief,
 In case the bank account details of the claimant are not available in the ESIC Database or the IP has changed his bank account then the same may be authenticated by the Branch Manager on the basis of the canceled cheque leaf or the passbook of the bank account having name of the claimant on it, which the claimant will provide along with the claim for this relief.
 The claim shall be processed on AB-3.
