        " JanSamarth Portal - A Unique One Stop Digital Portal.

": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 JanSamarth Portal - A Unique One Stop Digital Portal.
 Launched On
 06-06-2022.
 Objective
 To provide a single platform for credit linked government schemes.
 Official Website
 JanSamarth Portal.
 Introduction
 JanSamarth Portal is a one of its kind digital portal launched by Government of India.
 It was launched on 06-06-2022.
 Through this portal a beneficiary can avail the benefit of the schemes at one place.
 At present in this portal a total of thirteen credit linked government schemes are available.
 Out of which :-
 	3 scheme is for Educational Loan.
 3 scheme is for Agri Infrastructure Loan
 6 scheme is for Business Activity Loan.
 And 1 scheme is for Livelihood Loan.
 
 Beneficiary can digitally check their eligibility before apply online under any of the eligible scheme.
 This portal is directly connect lender with borrowers.
 In this portal beneficiary have to answer few questions and he found all the suitable schemes for him/her.
 Thereafter fill all the basic details, upload all the required documents.
 More than 125 lenders will be availabe to provide a loan to beneficiary.
 After selecting the lender bank, the beneficiary get digital approval of his/her loan.
 Loans Available on Portal
 At present there are 4 types of loan category available on this portal.
 These Categories are :-
 	Education Loan.
 Agri Infrastructure Loan.
 Business Activity Loan.
 Livelihood Loan.
 
 Further these categories are elaborated as below :-
 	Education Loan
 1.Central Sector Interest Subsidy (CSIS)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme is an education loan scheme of Ministry of Education.
 This scheme is only available for students belongs to economically weaker sections.
 Eligible students can take subsidise loan to pursue Technical or Professional education within India .
 
 Eligibility :-
 					All the students whose annual family income does not exceed to Rs. 4.5 lakhs per annum.
 Students who want to pursue Technical or Professional Courses within India.
 
 Benefit of the Scheme :-
 					No collateral security required.
 No third party guarantee.
 Subsidy benefit available for course period+one year.
 The subsidy amount will be on maximum Rs. 10 lakh loan amount.
 
 List of approved institution :-
 					Centrally Funded Technical Institutions.
 Institutions of National Importance.
 NAAC Accredited Universities/Institutions.
 NBA Recognized Professional Courses.
 
 
 2. Padho Pradesh (Padho Pardesh)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Padho Pardesh is an interest subsidy on an education loan for those students who want to pursue their studies outside India.
 This interest subsidy is only available once to students.
 35 % seats of this scheme is reserved for girls students.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Students belongs to six notified minority community.
 Interest subsidy is only for those students who get enrolled in Masters, M. Phil or in Ph.D. courses.
 Students should have to take admission in approved courses.
 Loan should be availed from a schedule bank.
 Benefit can only be taken during 1st year of the course.
 Total annual income should not exceed to Rs. 6.00 lakh per annum.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Interest subsidy is available on loans sanctioned up to maximum of Rs. 20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 3. Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme is an interest subsidy scheme on educational loan for overseas studies.
 It's main objective is to promote higher education on Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBCs) students.
 The scheme is only for those students who want to pursue their higher education outside India.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Only Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBC) students are eligible.
 Students who pursue Masters, M. Phil or Ph.D.

20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 3. Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme is an interest subsidy scheme on educational loan for overseas studies.
 It's main objective is to promote higher education on Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBCs) students.
 The scheme is only for those students who want to pursue their higher education outside India.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Only Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBC) students are eligible.
 Students who pursue Masters, M. Phil or Ph.D. from abroad.
 Loan should be availed form Schedule Bank.
 OBC certificate should be in prescribed performa.
 Total annual income of Other Backward Students candidate should not exceed to Rs. 8 lakhs per annum.
 Total annual income of Economically Backward Students should not exceed to Rs. 5 lakh per annum.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					This scheme is run by Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.
 50% of the total allocation is reserved for female students.
 Interest subsidy is available on loans sanctioned up to maximum of Rs. 20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 Agri Infrastructure Loan
 1. Agri Clinics And Agri Business Centres Scheme (ACABC)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agri Clinics and Agri Business Centres Scheme (ACABC) is run by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare.
 It's objective is to support effort of public extension, support agriculture development and to create self employment opportunities for unemployed agriculture graduates/post graduates.
 Agri Clinics provide expert advice to farmers on different issues like :- soil health, crop practice, crop insurance, plant protection,clinical services for animals, price of various crops in the market.
 Agri Business Centres are the set up of unemployed trained agriculture professionals.
 44% project cost subsidy will be provided to women, SC/ST and all candidates from North Eastern and Hill States.
 36% project cost subsidy is for all others.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Candidates who have completed their training through National Institute of Agriculture Extension (MANAGE).
 Unemployed agriculture graduates graduated in subject like Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Forestry, Dairy, Veterinary, Poultry Farming and Sericulture.
 Post Graduates in agriculture and allied subjects.
 Diploma/ Degree in agriculture and allied subjects.
 Agriculture related courses at 12th class level.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Age limit is 18 to 60 years.
 No retired official is eligible under this scheme.
 Eligible ceiling cost for subsidy is Rs. 20 lakhs for individual project.
 Ceiling cost for group project is Rs. 100 lakh.
 For successful individual project the ceiling cost is Rs. 25 lakhs.
 Graduates from agriculture background will be given free of cost training.
 
 
 2.

20 lakhs for individual project.
 Ceiling cost for group project is Rs. 100 lakh.
 For successful individual project the ceiling cost is Rs. 25 lakhs.
 Graduates from agriculture background will be given free of cost training.
 
 
 2. Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI).
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agriculture Marketing Infrastructure is a central government backed scheme to promote agriculture marketing infrastructure projects for reducing the involvement of minimizing post-harness losses.
 It's main objective is to develop storage infrastructure, to promote latest technologies, etc.
 Marketing Infrastructure projects are cleaning, grading, sorting, packaging, and value addition activities like Mini Oil Expeller, Mini Dal Mill, and Development of Rural Haats.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Farmers
 Group of Farmers/Growers.
 Local Bodies.
 Panchayats
 partnership/Proprietary Firms
 Company
 NGOs etc.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					For storage infrastructure, the storage capacity should be 50 to 5000 Metric Tonne for promoters and 50 to 10000 Metric Tonne for State Agencies are eligible for claiming subsidy.
 Promoter's contribution should be minimum 20% to maximum 50% of the project cost.
 For North Eastern States, Sikkim UTs of Andaman & Nicobar and Lakshadweep Island and Hilly Areas, the subsidy amount is 33% of project cost.
 For Registered FPOs, Panchayats, Women, Schedule Caste (SC)/ Schedule Tribe (ST)Entrepreneurs, Self Help Groups, the subsidy amount is 33% of project cost.
 For all other beneficiaries, the subsidy amount is 25% of the project cost.
 
 
 3. Agriculture Infrastructure Fund.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agriculture Infrastructure Fund is a long term financial assistance for building infrastructure for post harvest stage.
 Through this farmers will able to sell their produce in the market with reduced post harvest losses.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Primary Agriculture Credit Societies (PACS).
 Marketing Cooperative Societies.
 Farmers.
 Self Help Group (SHG).
 Farmer Producers Organization (FPOs).
 Joint Liability Group etc.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Improved marketing infrastructure allows farmer to sell their produce directly.
 All loans have interest subvention of 3% per annum up to a limit of Rs. 2 crore.
 The subvention will be available only for 7 years.
 Moratorium period of the scheme is minimum six month and maximum 2 years.
 
 
 Business Activity Loan
 1. Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP).
 
 Introduction :-
 					Prime Minister Employment Generation Programme is administered by Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MoMSME).
 Scheme is implemented by Khadi and Village Industries Commission.
 It is a subsidy program for setting up new micro enterprises in non-farm sector.
 Subsidy on Bank Loan from 15% to 35% is given for projects up to Rs 50 Lakh in manufacturing and Rs. 20 Lakh in service sector.
 For Schedule Caste (SC)/ Schedule Tribes (ST)/ Women/ PH/ Minorities/ Ex Servicemen/ North Eastern Region, the subsidy is 35% in rural areas and 25% in urban areas.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Age should be above 18 years.
 There is no income ceiling.
 No educational qualification is required for project cost up to Rs 10 lakh in manufacturing and up to Rs. 5 lakh in service sector.
 Units already availing government subsidy are not eligible under this scheme.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					This scheme is implemented to create employment opportunities.
 Through this scheme the wage earning capacity are also increase.
 
 
 2.

20 Lakh in service sector.
 For Schedule Caste (SC)/ Schedule Tribes (ST)/ Women/ PH/ Minorities/ Ex Servicemen/ North Eastern Region, the subsidy is 35% in rural areas and 25% in urban areas.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Age should be above 18 years.
 There is no income ceiling.
 No educational qualification is required for project cost up to Rs 10 lakh in manufacturing and up to Rs. 5 lakh in service sector.
 Units already availing government subsidy are not eligible under this scheme.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					This scheme is implemented to create employment opportunities.
 Through this scheme the wage earning capacity are also increase.
 
 
 2. Weaver Mudra Scheme (WMS)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Weaver MUDRA Scheme provides financial assistance to handloom weavers through weaver's credit card or term loan.
 Financial assistance is provided for working capital and purchase of tools and equipment.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Handlooms Weavers involved in weaving activity.
 Weaver Entrepreneur.
 Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Group.
 Primary Handloom Weavers.
 Apex Handloom Weavers.
 Producer Companies.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Money Support up to Rs. 42,000/- per weaver.
 Interest Subsidy up to 3% on bank loan.
 Reimbursement of 1 time guarantee fees.
 Maximum loan amount is Rs. 2 lakhs.
 No collateral required.
 Repayment period is 3 years.
 
 
 3. Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana is a scheme to provide loans to non-cooperate, non farming small and micro enterprises.
 There are three categories under this scheme.
 First category is Shishu in which loan amount of up to Rs 50,000/- will be provided.
 Second category is Kishore in which loan from Rs. 50,001 to Rs. 5 Lakh will be provided.
 And the last category is Tarun in which loan from Rs. 5,00,001 to Rs. 10 lakhs will be provided.
 Mudra loans will be provided for Trading, Manufacturing and for services sector.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Individuals.
 Proprietary Concern.
 Partnership Firm.
 Private Limited Company.
 Public Company.
 Any other Entities.
 Applicant should not be a defaulter of any bank.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					No collateral required.
 There is no subsidy for the loan given under Prime Minister Mudra Yojana.
 
 
 4. Pradhan Mantri Street Vendor Aatmanirbhar Nidhi Scheme (PM SVANidhi)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Prime Minister Street Vendor AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi)is a micro credit facility launched to provide affordable loans to street vendors.
 No collateral required up to the working capital loans of Rs. 10,000/- for 1 year tenure.
 Interest subsidy on time repayment is 7%.
 Rs. 100/- cash back on digital transactions.
 If first loan repaid timely, then the loan eligibility will be increases to Rs. 20,000/- and further to Rs. 50,000/-.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Street Vendor who is in possession of Certificate of Vending.
 Vendors identifies in the survey by Urban Local Body.
 
 
 5. Self Employment Scheme for Rehabilitation of Manual Scavengers (SRMS)
 
 Introduction :-
 					This scheme is implemented to rehabilitate the manual scavenger and their dependents in other occupation.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Manual Scavengers identified by State Governments.
 Sanitation Workers and their dependents are only eligible for assistance for self employed projects.
 
 Benefits :-
 					One time cash assistance of Rs.

100/- cash back on digital transactions.
 If first loan repaid timely, then the loan eligibility will be increases to Rs. 20,000/- and further to Rs. 50,000/-.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Street Vendor who is in possession of Certificate of Vending.
 Vendors identifies in the survey by Urban Local Body.
 
 
 5. Self Employment Scheme for Rehabilitation of Manual Scavengers (SRMS)
 
 Introduction :-
 					This scheme is implemented to rehabilitate the manual scavenger and their dependents in other occupation.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Manual Scavengers identified by State Governments.
 Sanitation Workers and their dependents are only eligible for assistance for self employed projects.
 
 Benefits :-
 					One time cash assistance of Rs. 40,000/- to one scavenger per family.
 Skill development training for up to 2 years with stipend of Rs.3,000/- per month.
 Subsidized Loans for self employment projects.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Maximum Loan repayment period is 5 years for project up to Rs. 5 lakh.
 Maximum Loan repayment period is 7 years for project more than Rs. 5 lakhs.
 
 
 6. Stand Up India Scheme (StandUpIndia)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Stand Up India Scheme is a scheme to facilitate bank loans to Schedule Caste (SC)/ Schedule Tribes (ST)and Women Entrepreneurs for setting Greenfield Projects.
 Green Field is a First-Time venture of the beneficiary.
 Working Capital loans between Rs 10 lakh to 1 Crore will be provided under this scheme.
 Tenure of loan is 7 years.
 Maximum moratorium period is 18 months.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					SC/ST and Women Entrepreneurs.
 Enterprises must be in manufacturing, services, agri-allied activities or in the trading sector.
 If there is a partnership firm then 51% of the shareholding should be holded by SC/ST or Women Entrepreneur.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					There is no collateral security require for the loans.
 Repayment period of loan is 7 years.
 
 
 Livelihood Loan
 1. Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM) is a poverty elimination schemes runs by Ministry of Rural Development.
 The main objective of this scheme is to covert 8 to 10 crore poor people into Self Help Groups (SHGs) in aphased manner.
 This also increase their income and improves the quality of life.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Self Help Groups should be active at least since the last 6 months.
 Self Help Group should do Regular Meetings, Regular Savings, Regular Inter-Loaning, Timely Repayment, and Up to date books of accounts.
 Qualified as per the grading norms fixed by NABARD.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					No collateral is required for loans up to Rs 10 lakhs to Self Help Groups.
 Self Help Group can apply for term loan or cash credit limit.
 
 
 
 Document required
 Each scheme has different documentation required.
 But the basic required document is :-
 	Aadhaar Number.
 Voter ID.
 PAN Card.
 Bank Statement.
 
 How to Apply
 First Beneficiary have to check his/her eligibility by taking simple steps.
 Out of 4 loan categories i.e.

Education Loan, Agri Infrastructure Loan, Business Activity Loan, and Livelihood Loan, beneficiary have to choose check eligibility by choosing his/her category.
 For checking eligibility, the required fields are :-
 	Category
 Required Fields for Checking the Eligibility.
 Educational Loans
 
 Select the location of study :- Within India or Outside India.
 Enter Gross Family Annual Income.
 Choose Social Category :- Whether General, OBC, SC/ST or Minority.
 Select the Course :- Graduate, Post Graduate, Doctorate, Other.
 Duration of the Course.
 Type of the Course :- Full Time, Part Time, Distance Learning or Other.
 Course Fees.
 Amount Invested By Beneficiary.
 Then after clicking on Calculate eligibility, portal shows each and every scheme for whom a person eligible for.
 
 Agri Infrastructure Loan
 
 Select the nature of the business :- Individual or Non-Individual.
 Choose Gender.
 Select Social Category :- Whether General, SC/ST, OBC, Minority.
 Click on Yes if Beneficiary is a resident of Northeastern Region/ States of Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Andaman and Nicobar Island, Lakshadweep Island, Hilly Areas or Tribal Areas.
 Choose the Purpose of the Loan
 Enter the Project Cost.
 Enter the Amount Invested by the Beneficiary.
 Then after clicking on Calculate eligibility, portal shows each and every scheme for whom a person eligible for.
 
 Business Activity Loan
 
 To check the eligibility for available schemes, beneficiary have to choose one of the 4 categories mentioned in the portal :-
 					1. Loan for Handloom Weaver.
 					2. Loan for Manual Scavenger.
 					3. Loan for Street Vendors
 					4. Other Business Loan
 After choosing one of the category, beneficiary have to fill required details about the business.
 Then after clicking on Calculate eligibility, portal shows each and every scheme for whom a person eligible for.
 
 Livelihood Loan
 
 Select from the given option whether beneficiary belongs to Self Help Group or an Individual.
 After choosing, fill all the required details and click on check eligibility.
 After clicking portal shows each and every scheme for whom a person eligible for.
 
 
 Thereafter beneficiary has to register himself/herself on the portal.
 Beneficiary can register himself/herself by their phone number and Email ID
 First enter the mobile number and the portal will verify it by sending OTP.
 After mobile number got verified, beneficiary has to enter their Email ID.
 An OTP is sent by the portal to beneficiaries Email ID for verification.
 After Email verification, beneficiary have to choose password for Log in.
 After choosing password, beneficiary will get entered into the portal and the list of all the schemes are visible.
 According to his/her eligibility, the beneficiary can select the scheme and avail the benefit.

 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 JanSamarth Portal - A Unique One Stop Digital Portal.
 Launched On
 06-06-2022
 Objective
 To provide a single platform for credit linked government schemes.
 Official Website
 JanSamarth Portal.
 Introduction
 JanSamarth Portal is a one of its kind digital portal launched by Government of India.
 It was launched on 06-06-2022.
 Through this portal a beneficiary can avail the benefit of the schemes at one place.
 At present in this portal a total of thirteen credit linked government schemes are available.
 Out of which :-
 	3 scheme is for Educational Loan.
 3 scheme is for Agri Infrastructure Loan
 6 scheme is for Business Activity Loan.
 And 1 scheme is for Livelihood Loan.
 
 Beneficiary can digitally check their eligibility before apply online under any of the eligible scheme.
 This portal is directly connect lender with borrowers.
 In this portal beneficiary have to answer few questions and he found all the suitable schemes for him/her.
 Thereafter fill all the basic details, upload all the required documents.
 More than 125 lenders will be availabe to provide a loan to beneficiary.
 After selecting the lender bank, the beneficiary get digital approval of his/her loan.
 Loans Available on Portal
 At present there are 4 types of loan category available on this portal.
 These Categories are :-
 	Education Loan.
 Agri Infrastructure Loan.
 Business Activity Loan.
 Livelihood Loan.
 
 Further these categories are elaborated as below :-
 	Education Loan
 1.Central Sector Interest Subsidy (CSIS)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme is an education loan scheme of Ministry of Education.
 This scheme is only available for students belongs to economically weaker sections.
 Eligible students can take subsidise loan to pursue Technical or Professional education within India .
 
 Eligibility :-
 					All the students whose annual family income does not exceed to Rs. 4.5 lakhs per annum.
 Students who want to pursue Technical or Professional Courses within India.
 
 Benefit of the Scheme :-
 					No collateral security required.
 No third party guarantee.
 Subsidy benefit available for course period+one year.
 The subsidy amount will be on maximum Rs. 10 lakh loan amount.
 
 List of approved institution :-
 					Centrally Funded Technical Institutions.
 Institutions of National Importance.
 NAAC Accredited Universities/Institutions.
 NBA Recognized Professional Courses.
 
 
 2. Padho Pradesh (Padho Pardesh)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Padho Pardesh is an interest subsidy on an education loan for those students who want to pursue their studies outside India.
 This interest subsidy is only available once to students.
 35 % seats of this scheme is reserved for girls students.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Students belongs to six notified minority community.
 Interest subsidy is only for those students who get enrolled in Masters, M. Phil or in Ph.D. courses.
 Students should have to take admission in approved courses.
 Loan should be availed from a schedule bank.
 Benefit can only be taken during 1st year of the course.
 Total annual income should not exceed to Rs. 6.00 lakh per annum.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Interest subsidy is available on loans sanctioned up to maximum of Rs. 20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 3. Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme is an interest subsidy scheme on educational loan for overseas studies.
 It's main objective is to promote higher education on Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBCs) students.
 The scheme is only for those students who want to pursue their higher education outside India.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Only Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBC) students are eligible.
 Students who pursue Masters, M. Phil or Ph.D.

20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 3. Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Dr. Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme is an interest subsidy scheme on educational loan for overseas studies.
 It's main objective is to promote higher education on Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBCs) students.
 The scheme is only for those students who want to pursue their higher education outside India.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Only Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBC) students are eligible.
 Students who pursue Masters, M. Phil or Ph.D. from abroad.
 Loan should be availed form Schedule Bank.
 OBC certificate should be in prescribed performa.
 Total annual income of Other Backward Students candidate should not exceed to Rs. 8 lakhs per annum.
 Total annual income of Economically Backward Students should not exceed to Rs. 5 lakh per annum.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					This scheme is run by Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.
 50% of the total allocation is reserved for female students.
 Interest subsidy is available on loans sanctioned up to maximum of Rs. 20.00 lakhs.
 Subsidy benefit is available for course period+1 year.
 Income certificate is mandatory to submit every year.
 
 
 Agri Infrastructure Loan
 1. Agri Clinics And Agri Business Centres Scheme (ACABC)
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agri Clinics and Agri Business Centres Scheme (ACABC) is run by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare.
 It's objective is to support effort of public extension, support agriculture development and to create self employment opportunities for unemployed agriculture graduates/post graduates.
 Agri Clinics provide expert advice to farmers on different issues like :- soil health, crop practice, crop insurance, plant protection,clinical services for animals, price of various crops in the market.
 Agri Business Centres are the set up of unemployed trained agriculture professionals.
 44% project cost subsidy will be provided to women, SC/ST and all candidates from North Eastern and Hill States.
 36% project cost subsidy is for all others.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Candidates who have completed their training through National Institute of Agriculture Extension (MANAGE).
 Unemployed agriculture graduates graduated in subject like Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Forestry, Dairy, Veterinary, Poultry Farming and Sericulture.
 Post Graduates in agriculture and allied subjects.
 Diploma/ Degree in agriculture and allied subjects.
 Agriculture related courses at 12th class level.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Age limit is 18 to 60 years.
 No retired official is eligible under this scheme.
 Eligible ceiling cost for subsidy is Rs. 20 lakhs for individual project.
 Ceiling cost for group project is Rs. 100 lakh.
 For successful individual project the ceiling cost is Rs. 25 lakhs.
 Graduates from agriculture background will be given free of cost training.
 
 
 2.

20 lakhs for individual project.
 Ceiling cost for group project is Rs. 100 lakh.
 For successful individual project the ceiling cost is Rs. 25 lakhs.
 Graduates from agriculture background will be given free of cost training.
 
 
 2. Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI).
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agriculture Marketing Infrastructure is a central government backed scheme to promote agriculture marketing infrastructure projects for reducing the involvement of minimizing post-harness losses.
 It's main objective is to develop storage infrastructure, to promote latest technologies, etc.
 Marketing Infrastructure projects are cleaning, grading, sorting, packaging, and value addition activities like Mini Oil Expeller, Mini Dal Mill, and Development of Rural Haats.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Farmers
 Group of Farmers/Growers.
 Local Bodies.
 Panchayats
 partnership/Proprietary Firms
 Company
 NGOs etc.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					For storage infrastructure, the storage capacity should be 50 to 5000 Metric Tonne for promoters and 50 to 10000 Metric Tonne for State Agencies are eligible for claiming subsidy.
 Promoter's contribution should be minimum 20% to maximum 50% of the project cost.
 For North Eastern States, Sikkim UTs of Andaman & Nicobar and Lakshadweep Island and Hilly Areas, the subsidy amount is 33% of project cost.
 For Registered FPOs, Panchayats, Women, Schedule Caste (SC)/ Schedule Tribe (ST)Entrepreneurs, Self Help Groups, the subsidy amount is 33% of project cost.
 For all other beneficiaries, the subsidy amount is 25% of the project cost.
 
 
 3. Agriculture Infrastructure Fund.
 
 Introduction :-
 					Agriculture Infrastructure Fund is a long term financial assistance for building infrastructure for post harvest stage.
 Through this farmers will able to sell their produce in the market with reduced post harvest losses.
 
 Eligibility :-
 					Primary Agriculture Credit Societies (PACS).
 Marketing Cooperative Societies.
 Farmers.
 Self Help Group (SHG).
 Farmer Producers Organization (FPOs).
 Joint Liability Group etc.
 
 Additional Information :-
 					Improved marketing infrastructure allows farmer to sell their produce directly.
 All loans have interest subvention of 3% per annum up to a limit of Rs. 2 crore.
 The subvention will be available only for 7 years.
 Moratorium period of the scheme is minimum six month and maximum 2 years.

 Ex Gratia of Rs. 44 Lakhs for Death Attributable to Service.
 One Time Disability Compensation.
 Skill Certificate and Credit for Higher Education.
 
 Eligibility
 
 Applicant should be between the Age Group of 17.5 years to 21 years.
 But in 2022, the age limit is 23 years for just 1 year.
 
 Objective
 
 To give an opportunity to youth to serve in Indian Armed Forces.
 To make youth confident and better citizen.
 
 Nodal Agency
 Ministry of Defence.
 Introduction
 Agnipath scheme is a scheme in which selected candidates will get an opportunity to serve as Agniveer in the Indian Armed Forces.
 The period of service in the Indian Armed Forces under Agnipath Scheme is Four Years including training period.
 To become Agniveer, the candidate's age should be between 17.5 to 21 years.
 But the age limit for the first recruitment under Agnipath Scheme for the year 2022 is 23 years.
 This year 46,000 Agniveers will be recruited.
 The objective behind starting this scheme to give an opportunity to youth to serve in Indian Armed Forces.
 And imparting military discipline, motivation, skill and physical fitness.
 25% of the total recruited Agniveer will have the opportunity to apply for permanent enrolment after four year of service based on merit and need.
 The Agniveers will be enrolled through online centralise system with specialised rallies and campus interviews from recognised technical institutions like Industrial Training Institutes and National Skills Qualification Framework.
 Enrolment will be based on All India All Class basis.
 The educational qualification for Agniveers for enrolment in different categories will remain the same. (Example :- For entry in General Duty (GD) soldier, the educational qualification is Class 10th).
 After recruitment, Agniveer will undergo rigorous military training at the existing training centres.

 Features of the Scheme
 Agnipath scheme is a short term employment scheme for the youths of India.
 Under Agnipath scheme youths will be recruited in the 3 wings of Indian Armed Forces (Indian Army, Indian Navy, Indian Airforce) as Agniveers.
 The employment tenure will be four years including training period.
 After four years, 25% of Agniveers will be selected to be enrolled in the Armed Forces as a regular cadre.
 This scheme will enhance the abilities and qualities of the youths.
 In future women will also inducted in the Armed Forces under Agnipath Scheme.
 Under Agnipath scheme Agniveers gets good financial package in which their 1st year annual package is approximately Rs. 4.76 Lakh.
 The 4th year annual package of Agniveer is approximately Rs. 6.92 Lakh.
 Other than that Risk and Hardship allowance, Ration, Dress, Travel allowance are also applicable in this scheme.
 Agniveer will also have to contribute 30% percent of his salary in Seva Nidhi Fund.
 The equal amount is contributed by the Government of India.
 After 4 years, an amount o Rs. 11.71 Lakh will be given to Agniveer which is exempted from tax.
 A non-contributory insurance cove of Rs. 48 Lakhs will also provided under this scheme.
 If in case, Agniveer got martyred or dead in the line of duty, then additional Ex gratia of Rs. 44 Lakh will be given to his family.
 If in service Agniveer got disabled then according to the percent disability laid down by medical authorities, a one time Ex Gratia compensation will be provided.
 One time ex-gratia of Rs.

 If in service Agniveer got disabled then according to the percent disability laid down by medical authorities, a one time Ex Gratia compensation will be provided.

 विकलांगता मुआवजे के रूप में क्रमशः 100%/75%/50% विकलांगता के लिए 44/25/15 लाख रुपये की एकमुश्त अनुग्रह राशि प्रदान की जायगी।

 भारतीय नौसेना की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट।
 भारतीय वायु सेना की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट।
 अंग्रेजी पत्रक (दिशानिर्देश)।
 हिंदी पत्रक (दिशानिर्देश)।
 अग्निपथ पुस्तिका।
 अग्निपथ अक्सर पूछे जाने वाले प्रश्न।

        " Aligarh Muslim University Free Coaching Scheme for Civil Services.": "
 Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Aligarh Muslim University Free Coaching Scheme for Civil Services.
 Number of Seats
 100.
 Benefit
 Free Coaching Classes for Civil Services Examination.
 Eligible Students
 
 Women.
 Schedule Caste.
 Schedule Tribe.
 Minority.
 
 Objective
 
 To provide good quality coaching to economically weaker students.
 To prepare them for the Civil Services Examination.
 To improve the vocal skills of the students.
 To provide study material and library facilities.
 
 Application Fees
 Rs. 600/-
 Nodal Agency
 Aligarh Muslim University.
 Mode of Applying
 Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Aligarh Muslim University is a famous Central University located in Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh.
 Every year Aligarh Muslim University provides Free Coaching to students who belong to minorities communities such as Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsis (Zoroastarian), and Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe and Women Students.
 The main objective is to provide quality education to the economically weaker students and prepare them for the toughest exam of India i.e. Civil Services Examination.
 The Civil Services Examination is conducted every year by the Union Public Service Commission.
 Every year lakh of students prepare for this exam.
 For preparation, students pays lakhs of rupees as fees to the coaching institutes.
 But there are many students who want to take part in the civil services examination, but due to lack of money they are not able to prepare.
 To help those economically weaker students, free coaching for civil services is provided by Aligarh Muslim University.
 To enroll in this coaching program, students have to crack an entrance exam.
 The entrance exam is conducted on the basis of the model of Union Public Service Commission.
 This entrance exam is conducted by Aligarh Muslim University at all India Level.
 There are 7 centres across India where the entrance examination is to be conducted.
 There is no coaching fee for the programme.
 Once selected, coaching is provided to the students for Preliminary Examination and Mains Examination.
 Coaching Curriculum
 Students Selected in Free Civil Services Coaching Program of Aligarh Muslim University will get the below mentioned facilities :-
 	Free Coaching Classes for Pre and Mains.
 CSAT.
 Selected Optional Papers.
 Test Series.
 Answer Evaluation.
 Essay Writing Practice.
 Hostel Facility.
 Air Conditioned Library open for 17 hours (08:00 am to 01:00am).
 
 Schedule of Coaching Programme for the Year 2023-2024.
 Online Application Started
 25th July 2023.
 Last Date for Apply
 14th August 2023.
 Written Test Date
 10.09.2023. (10:00 AM to 01:00 PM)
 Written Test Timing
 
 General Studies (Objective Type) :- 10.00 a.m. to 11.00 a.m.
 Essays :- 11.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m.
 
 Eligibility
 Only those candidates who have already completed their Graduation.
 Women Student.
 Schedule Caste Students.
 Schedule Tribe Students.
 And Students Belongs to Six Notified Minority Community:-
 	Muslims.
 Buddhist.
 Sikh.
 Christian.
 Parsis (Zoroastrians).
 Jain.
 
 Document required
 Email ID
 Mobile Number.
 Scanned Photo.
 Scanned Signature.
 Credit Card, Net Banking or ATM-cum-Debit Card for Payment of Application Fees.
 Syllabus of the Entrance Exam
 Entrance Exam of AMU RCA Civil Services Coaching Program is divided into two Papers.
 Paper 1 consist of OMR based objective type questions.
 Paper 1 will have 100 questions and each question will be of 2 marks.
 Syllabus of Paper 1 is :-
 	General Awareness
 Logical Thinking
 Reasoning
 Comprehension
 
 Paper 2 consist of Essay Writing.
 The total marks for Paper 2 will be 200 marks.
 Candidates will have to write 2 essays.
 Both the essay consist of 100 marks each.
 The total time given for the exam is 3 hours.
 There is 1 hour for OMR based Objective type question paper i.e. Paper 1.
 And 2 hour is for the Essay Writing i.e.

Paper 1.
 And 2 hour is for the Essay Writing i.e. for the Paper 2.
 Successful candidates will then go through the interview which is of 100 marks.
 How to Apply
 The only way to apply is online through the official website of Aligarh Muslim University.
 The candidate has to first registered himself/herself first.
 Fill the required details in the registraton form :-
 	Full Name of the Candidate.
 Date of Birth.
 Gender.
 Father's Name.
 Mother's Name.
 Email ID.
 Create your password.
 Confirm password.
 Applicant's mobile number.
 Fill the Captcha.
 After clicking on Sign Up, Candidate got registered.
 
 Then, with your Email ID and Password Log in to the portal.
 Fill all the asked details.
 Make the payment and your application will be submitted.
 After that wait for the admit card.
 Features of the Scheme
 There will be an entrance test to secure admission to this programme.
 Admission will be on the basis of merit only.
 There will be two paper in the entrance test.
 The written test will be in English, Hindi and Urdu Language.
 The duration of the test will be of 3 hours.
 There will be negative marking for objective type questions i.e. for the Paper 1.
 1/3 marks will be deducted for a wrong answer.
 Paper 1 is of objective type and consist of general awareness, logical thinking, reasoning, and comprehension.
 Paper 2 will consist of essay writing.
 The total marks of the exam including both the papers is 400.
 In case of a tie, higher marks in interview will be taken as the basis of selection.
 If still there is tie then the younger student will get the seat.
 Only those candidates who have already completed their graduation and eligible to apply in Civil Services 2023 need to apply for Residential Coaching Academy, Aligarh Muslim University.
 Residential Coaching Academy will also conduct mock interviews for those who qualify for the personality test in Civil Services 2023.
 The test series (for preliminary examination) will be conducted from time to time.
 The test Series (for mains examination) will be conducted from time to time.
 24*7 air conditioned library facility will be provided to the students.
 Hostel accommodation is will be provided to limited number of admitted students.
 Registration Chargers of Rs. 500/- (to be paid at the time of admission) and refundable caution/security money of Rs. 1000/- for AMU student and Rs. 2500/- for Non-AMU student will be paid by the students.
 The application has to be submitted online with a fee of Rs. 600/- or + applicable basic charges.
 The date of entrance test is tentative and may changed due to unforeseen circumstances.
 Charges Paid by the Students
 Charges Paid by Students in lieu of Coaching for Civil Services Examination in AMU RCA are :-

 				(To be paid at the time of applying.)
 Rs. 600/-.

 Overview
 
 Name of Scheme
 
 PM YASASVI Scheme.
 
 Launched On
 1998-99.
 Launched by
 Central Government.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Other Backward class (OBCs) students.
 Economically Backward class (EBCs) students.
 De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes (DNT/S_NT) Students.
 
 Applicant
 Student studying in class IX and XI in Government school only.
 Nodal agency
 Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Central Government. 
 Implementing Agency
 State Government/ Union Territories.
 Introduction
 PM Young Achievers Scholarship Award Scheme for Vibrant India (YASASVI) will provide continuous education to bright students of underprivileged section of society.
 Scheme focus on socio-economic development of Other Backward Class (OBC), Economically Backward Class (EBC), De-Notified, Nomadic & Semi-Nomadic Tribes (DNT/SNT) community through Scholarship to students under YASASVI scheme.
 This combined scheme covers Scholarship fees and Hostel fees. There are five sub-schemes under the scheme.

Implementing Agency
 State Government/ Union Territories.
 Introduction
 PM Young Achievers Scholarship Award Scheme for Vibrant India (YASASVI) will provide continuous education to bright students of underprivileged section of society.
 Scheme focus on socio-economic development of Other Backward Class (OBC), Economically Backward Class (EBC), De-Notified, Nomadic & Semi-Nomadic Tribes (DNT/SNT) community through Scholarship to students under YASASVI scheme.
 This combined scheme covers Scholarship fees and Hostel fees. There are five sub-schemes under the scheme. Some main schemes are
 	Pre-Matric Scholarship for OBC,EBC and DNT Students.
 Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC,EBC and DNT Students.
 Top Class School Education for OBC,EBC and DNT Students.
 Top Class College Education for OBC,EBC and DNT Students.
 
 Students in class IX and class XI, full time in government schools can apply.
 Currently students need to apply through YASASVI entrance test (YET) conducted by National Testing Agency (NTA).
 Students availing this scheme are not eligible for any other government educational scholarship scheme.
 Students will be registered on National Scholarship Portal/ State Scholarship Portal and their database will be maintained by concerned School/Institution.
 Attendance ( minimum 75%) and performance will be monitored by institutions through Portal and Aadhaar Based Attendance System.
 State Government shall pay the scholarship amount directly to beneficiary's linked account.
 30% fund for girls and 5% for students with disability is allotted.
 Objective
 Objective of the scheme is to support and empower weaker sections of society through education thereby helping them to live productive, safe and dignified life. It facilitates the completion of education of most vulnerable sections of society.

It facilitates the completion of education of most vulnerable sections of society. It can help bring the drop-outs back to school for secondary/ higher education.
 Eligibility condition
 The student should belong to OBC,EBC or DNT category.
 She/he should be studying in class IX or Class XI.
 His/her Parent/ Guardian's income should not exceed Rs.2.50 lakh per year.
 She/he should have Aadhaar Card.
 She/he should be a student in a government school.
 Documents required to take benefits
 Aadhaar Card
 Annual Family Income Certificate.
 Domicile of State.
 Caste Certificate 
 Passport Size Photograph.
 Bank Account Details.
 Mobile Number.
 Email ID.
 Mark Sheet of Qualifying Exam.
 Information about YASASVI Entrance exam schedule 2021-22
 The scheme is implemented through YASASVI Entrance test (YET) conducted by National Testing Agency (NTA) across India.
 Applicant Should be in class IX Or Class XI.
 Students can apply for test through online mode only at  National Testing Agency Portal.
 Scanned Photograph, Signature, Category Certificate, Income Certificate, PwD Certificate (If Disable) should be uploaded in specified file size.
 The test will be a Computer Based Test (CBT) of 100 Questions of 4 marks each.
 Entrance Test Comprises questions from :-
 	Mathematics (30 Questions).
 Science (20 Questions).
 Social Science (25 Questions).
 General Awareness/Knowledge (25 Questions).
 
 No negative marking is there in test paper.
 Syllabus of class 8th for admission in class 9th shall come in examination.
 Syllabus of class 10th for admission in class 11th shall come in examination.
 Admit Card would be issued to the candidate through the National Testing Agency (NTA) Portal after verification.
 Candidate can download the admit card from website and should read the instructions on it carefully.
 How to apply for Scholarship Registration
 Only qualified students are eligible for registration, following are steps for registration on National Scholarship Portal :-
 	Open th National Scholarship Portal and click on New Registration.
 Provide Date of birth as in Aadhaar Card.
 Enter Domicile State.
 Student need to choose right option in Scholarship Category (Pre-matric/Post-Matric/Top Class Scheme/Merit cum Means) option.
 Enter your name as in Aadhaar/10th certificate.
 Enter mobile number to receive SMS.
 Enter Email ID.
 Enter Bank Account Details (Account number and IFSC code)
 Enter your Aadhaar number in Identification Details.
 Then click on submit.
 The Login credential will be sent by the portal to applicant's Mobile Number and Email ID.
 Again Login on National Scholarship Portal with the given credential.
 Upload the needed documents and check your details before submission.
 After verification the scholarship amount will be credited to the applicant account.
 
 Important Links
 National Scholarship Portal.
 National Scholarship Portal Registration.
 National Scholarship Portal Login.
 National Testing Agency Portal.
 PM YASAVI Scheme Guidelines.
 Contact Details
 National Scholarship Portal Helpline Number :- 0120 6619540.
 National Scholarship Portal Helpdesk Email :- helpdesk@nsp.gov.in.
 National Testing Agency Helpline Numbers :-
 	011 69227700.
 011 40759000
 
 National Testing Agency Helpdesk Email :- genadmin@nta.ac.in.
 National Testing Agency,
 	Department of Higher Education,
 	C-20 1A/8 ,Sector 62,
 	IITK Outreach Centre,
 	Noida - 201309

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 National Agriculture Market (e-NAM)
 Launched on
 14 July 2022.
 Beneficiaries
 
 Farmers.
 Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC).
 Farmer Producer Organisations (FPO).
 Traders.
 Buyers and Sellers.
 
 Benefits
 
 e-Auction of Agriculture Commodities.
 e-Trading of Agriculture Commodities.
 Quality Testing (Assaying).
 Warehouse Facility.
 Online Payment Facility.
 
 Website
 www.enam.gov.in.
 Nodal Agency
 Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare.
 Implementing Agency
 Small Farmers Agri-Business Consortium (SFAC).
 Mode of Application
 Online Registration through Mobile App or e-NAM Portal.
 Introduction
 e-Nam portal is an online agriculture business portal launched by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare.
 It is implemented by Small Farmers' Agri-Business Consortium (SFAC).
 It is designed keeping in mind the benefits of farmers who generally are paid way less for their produce.
 It helps to promote stable prices and availability of quality produce to consumer.
 It brings the producer and buyers of agriculture commodities to one online platform, making it easier for both to have right price of commodities without interference of mediators.
 It strengthens the Prime Minister's vision towards 'Ease of Doing Business' and provides 'One Nation One Agriculture Market' concept.
 It is a pan-India Electronic Trading Portal for Agriculture commodities which links Farmers, Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC), Farmer Producer Organisation (FPO), Traders, Agents and Logistics together for better Agro-Business.
 It will make a national network of Mandi's where a buyer from anywhere in India can purchase agriculture commodities from anyplace in India directly.
 It provides real time information on trade and price to promote better marketing opportunities.
 Farmer and traders both gets an extended market to choose from, according to their interest .
 It will help farmers to get the right price of their produce and even better pricing by assaying the quality of their produce.
 Assaying facility helps to set the quality status of agricultural commodities. It helps farmer to gain good profit and traders to get good quality products.
 Currently 193 Agricultural commodities are traded under e-NAM, standard quality specifications for commodity are defined they need to be determined and certified through testing.
 Assaying is free of cost, Quality Assaying Lab is requisite for Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC), that accesses and certify the quality of produce.
 Without assaying farmer may get a lower price hence assaying is recommended but it's not compulsory.
 E-NAM provides free training to stakeholders i.e. farmers, FPOs, traders, commission agents and mandi officials etc.
 Integration of e-NAM with e-portals like Kisan rath, Kisan suvidha, Umang and Agmarknet has been done.
 Benefits to Farmers
 Farmers can auction their product, can see live bid rate and get best price for their produce.

Assaying facility helps to set the quality status of agricultural commodities. It helps farmer to gain good profit and traders to get good quality products.
 Currently 193 Agricultural commodities are traded under e-NAM, standard quality specifications for commodity are defined they need to be determined and certified through testing.
 Assaying is free of cost, Quality Assaying Lab is requisite for Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC), that accesses and certify the quality of produce.
 Without assaying farmer may get a lower price hence assaying is recommended but it's not compulsory.
 E-NAM provides free training to stakeholders i.e. farmers, FPOs, traders, commission agents and mandi officials etc.
 Integration of e-NAM with e-portals like Kisan rath, Kisan suvidha, Umang and Agmarknet has been done.
 Benefits to Farmers
 Farmers can auction their product, can see live bid rate and get best price for their produce. It is especially designed to improve financial condition of farmers.
 They can choose any Mandi within 100 km range to sell their produce.
 If they don't want to sell their produce at low price they can store it in warehouse and can sell it later. Farmer can take electronic Warehouse Receipt and can sell their produce through it on e-NAM.
 Cheap and nearest Truck or Tractor can be available to them through Logistic module.
 Free assaying of their produce at APMC assaying labs to determine the quality standard of commodity.

farmers, FPOs, traders, commission agents and mandi officials etc.
 Integration of e-NAM with e-portals like Kisan rath, Kisan suvidha, Umang and Agmarknet has been done.
 Benefits to Farmers
 Farmers can auction their product, can see live bid rate and get best price for their produce. It is especially designed to improve financial condition of farmers.
 They can choose any Mandi within 100 km range to sell their produce.
 If they don't want to sell their produce at low price they can store it in warehouse and can sell it later. Farmer can take electronic Warehouse Receipt and can sell their produce through it on e-NAM.
 Cheap and nearest Truck or Tractor can be available to them through Logistic module.
 Free assaying of their produce at APMC assaying labs to determine the quality standard of commodity. It helps get better price on sale.
 Farmer can sell their produce in more than one market.
 Online payment gateway is available for transfer of bid value directly to bank account of farmer.
 Facility of pre-registration of lot is available to facilitate quick gate entry during peak season.
 Online transactions of payment is received from bank in 24 to 48 hours.
 Function related to Gate entry, Quality assaying, Lot management, Weighing, Agreement and sale bill generation, online payment and Gate exit is available only on desktop and laptop.
 Benefits to APMC, FPO and Traders
 Reduced transaction cost by buyers.
 Transparent online trade with enhanced accessibility to market.
 Availability of information about commodity prices.
 Details of price commodity sold along with quantity and quality.
 Quality certificate.
 Online payment facility.
 Single license for trading across all markets in a state.
 Easier norms for obtaining trading licenses.
 Improved supply chain, Warehouse based sales.
 How to register on e-NAM?
 Farmers
 Open the link https://www.enam.gov.in/web and click on registration link or open http://enam.gov.in/NAMV2/home/other_register.html directly.
 Select Registration Type as "Farmer" and select desired APMC
 Enter your Personal details, Bank Details and Upload the needed documents (passbook image, Identity proof and photo).
 Make sure correct email ID is mentioned as future correspondence from eNAM will be sent on same Email ID.
 Once successfully registered you will receive a temporary Login ID and Password on email.
 Login to the Dashboard by clicking icon on www.enam.gov.in/web through the system.
 User will find a Flashing Message on the Dashboard as: "Click here to register with APMC".
 Click on the Flashing Link which will redirect you to Registration Page for filling/updating details.
 It will be sent for Approval to your selected APMC after KYC is completed.
 After Successful Login to your Dashboard you will be able to see all APMC address details.
 After Successful Submission user will receive an e-mail confirming the submission of application to concerned APMC with status of the Application as Submitted/In progress—approved—rejected.
 Once approved by APMC, you will receive eNAM Farmer Permanent Login ID and Password for complete access on e-NAM platform on the registered e-mail id.
 Or you can contact to your respective Mandi/APMC for the same.
 Similarly FPOs, Mandi Board and Logistics can register via website or mobile app by providing their Personal and Bank details with documents to upload.

        " Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana. (PMKMY)": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana. (PMKMY)
 Launched on
 9th August 2019.
 Launched by
 Government of India.
 Scheme Type
 Pension Scheme for Farmers
 Beneficiaries
 Small and Marginal Farmers.
 Benefits
 
 Pension of Rs. 3000/- per month after 60 years of age.
 Old Age Protection and Social Security.
 
 Official Website
 https://pmkmy.gov.in.
 Nodal Agency
 Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare.
 Implementing Agency
 Department of Agriculture, Cooperative and Farmers' Welfare.
 Mode of Application
 
 Online through Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana Portal.
 Offline through nearest CSC (Common Service Centre)
 
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PMKMY) is a Central government scheme under Department of Agriculture.
 The main objective behind starting Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana is to provide social security to small and marginals farmers of India.
 Under Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana, Government of India will provide a monthly pension to all eligible farmers who attains the age of 60 years.
 Monthly Fixed Pension to farmers of Rs. 3000/- per month will be provided on completion of 60 years of age.
 Small and Marginal farmer who have cultivable land upto 2 hectare as per land records can register themselves under Prime Minister Old Age Farmer Pension Scheme.
 Farmers whose Age is between 18 years to 40 years can enrol themselves under this pension scheme of Central Government.
 Both Husband and Wife can also apply separately in Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana.
 In case of farmer's death after completing 60 years of age, Spouse will get Rs. 1500/- per month as pension only if she is not separately enrolled under scheme.
 Central government and Farmer shall contribute equally to the Pension Scheme according to the age of farmer at the time of enrolment.

 Farmer can use his PM-Kisan benefit for contributing for PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana).
 This can be done by submitting a duly signed enrolment-cum-auto-debit-mandate form at CSC (Common Service Centre).
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age and does not have a spouse then contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher, will be paid to nominee.
 The farmer shall choose nominee at the time of enrolment and also can change it later by contacting the Common Service Centre.
 After death of both farmer and his/her spouse, total accumulated contributions shall be credited back to the pension fund.
 Farmers who are willing to join can apply by approaching the nearest CSC(Common Service Centre) centre or through online portal https://pmkmy.gov.in.
 Change in bank detail and other details can be done by approaching CSC (Common Service Centre) along with PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) number, Aadhaar card. VLE at CSC will validate the credentials of the farmer.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The following benefits will be provided to all registered farmers under Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana :-
 Small and Marginal Farmers will get Rs. 3000/- Monthly Pension after 60 years of Age.
 Both Husband and Wife can enrol separately.
 Rs. 1500/- monthly pension will be given to spouse in case of death of Beneficiary. (If not enrolled under scheme)
 Central Government Contributes equal amount in the pension fund as contributed by Farmer.
 Farmer can exit from Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Scheme anytime.
 If farmer exits scheme within a period of less than 10 years then only his contribution along with saving bank rate of interest rate will be payable.
 If farmer exits scheme after a period of 10 years then only his contribution along  with saving bank interest rate or interest earned by pension fund be payable, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer becomes permanently disable before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate thereon, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age and does not have a spouse then contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher, will be paid to nominee.
 Eligibility Criteria
 Applicant should be a Farmer
 Farmer should be a Small or Marginal Farmer.
 The Age of Farmer should be between 18 Years to 40 Years.
 Farmer should have Cultivable Land up to 2 Hectares on Land Records.
 Farmer should not belong under Exclusion Criteria.
 Exclusions under Scheme/ Farmer who cannot apply for scheme
 Small and marginal farmers covered under any other statuary social security schemes.
 Farmers who are enrolled in Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan Yojana and Pradhan Mantri Vyapari Maandhan Yojana.
 Person of higher economic status cannot apply like :-
 	Institutional landlords.
 Former/Present holders of constitutional post.

with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher, will be paid to nominee.
 Eligibility Criteria
 Applicant should be a Farmer
 Farmer should be a Small or Marginal Farmer.
 The Age of Farmer should be between 18 Years to 40 Years.
 Farmer should have Cultivable Land up to 2 Hectares on Land Records.
 Farmer should not belong under Exclusion Criteria.
 Exclusions under Scheme/ Farmer who cannot apply for scheme
 Small and marginal farmers covered under any other statuary social security schemes.
 Farmers who are enrolled in Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan Yojana and Pradhan Mantri Vyapari Maandhan Yojana.
 Person of higher economic status cannot apply like :-
 	Institutional landlords.
 Former/Present holders of constitutional post.
 Serving/Retired officers and Employees of institutions under Government or Local Bodies.
 Persons who paid income tax in the last assessment year.
 
 Documents Required
 The following documents is needed at the time of registering in Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana :-
 	Aadhar Card
 Mobile Number
 Bank Account Details.
 
 How to apply for Scheme
 Eligible Farmers can registered themselves under Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana through below mentioned ways :-
 	Through Common Service Centre.
 Through PMKMY Website.
 
 Applying through CSC (Common Service centre)
 Farmers wishing to join the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana shall approach nearest Common Service Centre (CSC) for enrolment.
 Farmer should carry Aadhar card and Bank passbook for registration.
 Village level Entrepreneur (VLE) at CSC will ensure and validate following farmer related information before registration and will complete the online registration process :-
 	Aadhaar card
 Farmer's name
 Farmer's saving bank account number
 IFSC/MICR code
 Bank passbook or cheque book or copy of bank statement as evidence of bank account.
 Mobile Number
 Date of Birth
 Spouse and nominee particulars
 Residential Address
 
 Mobile number given will be verified by OTP verification process.
 Online Registration will be done by providing Personal, Bank account details and completion of an auto-debit mandate form of bank by farmer.
 Farmer will authenticate the data in online generated enrolment form by putting his/her signature.
 VLE (Village Level Entrepreneur) will upload scanned copy of signed enrolment-cum-debit mandate form.
 System will calculate contribution according to age of farmer.
 Now applicant can choose his contribution mode (monthly, quarterly, half yearly or annually).
 Initial contribution amount in cash will be made to the VLE (Village Level Entrepreneur).
 Online payment of contribution will be done and a receipt will be provided to farmer.
 Now the registration process is complete and the system will generate a PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) Pension Card with unique Pension Account Number and Pension card will be printed.
 Applying through Online Portal (Self Registration)
 Open the PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) portal https://pmkmy.gov.in and click on 'Click here to apply now' link.
 Choose Self Enrollment for registration.
 Enter mobile number and an OTP will be generated.
 Enter your Name and E-mail Id and OTP and click on proceed.
 Now click on Enrollment Tab and choose Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana.
 Enter your Aadhaar Number and accept terms and conditions.
 Enter the following details in Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana Application Form :-
 	Name.Date of Birth.
 Gender.
 Mobile Number.
 Email Id.
 State.
 District.
 Village.
 Pincode.
 Farmer Category.
 
 Select the premium to be Auto-Deducted from PM-KISAN bank account.
 Click on Submit button.
 Now enter Bank Account Details and click on verify.
 Now enter Bank Name, Branch and Account Number.
 Enter Nominee Details: Nominee Name, Relation with Nominee, Date of Birth of Nominee and Guardian of Nominee (if minor) and if married enter spouse name.
 Choose your contribution frequency amongst monthly, quarterly, half yearly or annually.
 Amount to be paid will be displayed according to choice opted.
 Click on submit and proceed.
 Click on print mandate form and put your signature on the mandate form.
 Scan this form and upload it by clicking on choose file option and click submit.
 Now your registration is complete and a Congratulation message can be seen on screen.

 Griveance Redressal
 Farmer in case of any difficulty can contact the Grievance Redressal Cell which is set up at state and district level.
 State Level Officers of Pradhanmantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana are State Nodal Officers, State Level Bankers' Committee and Regional Manager, LIC.
 District levels have District Level bankers Committee and LIC representatives.
 All disputes raised by farmer on sponsored bank will be resolved within 30 days.
 Any matter related to execution, grievance redressal, dispute resolution etc. shall be referred to the Joint Secretary (Farmers Welfare), Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' welfare, Krishi Bhavan, New Delhi-110001 for redressal.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
  
 Name of the Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana. (PMKMY)
 Launched on
  9th  August 2019.
 Launched by
 Government of India.
 Scheme Type
 Pension Scheme.
 Beneficiaries
 Small and Marginal farmers between 18 to 40 years of age owing up to 2 hectare of cultivable land.
 Benefits
 
 Fixed pension of Rs. 3000/- per month after 60 yrs of age.
 Old age protection and Social security. 
 
 Website
 https://pmkmy.gov.in 
 Nodal Agency
 Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare.
 Implementing Agency
 Department of Agriculture, Cooperative and Farmers’ Welfare. 
 Mode of Application
 
 Online through Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana Portal.
 Offline through nearest CSC (Common Service Centre)
 
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri  Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PMKMY) is a Central government scheme under Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers’welfare; Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare in partnership with LIC (Life Insurance Corporation of India).
 Scheme shall benefit Small and Marginal farmers of country by providing them social security.
 Scheme helps to provide fixed pension to farmers of Rs.

3000/- per month after 60 yrs of age.
 Old age protection and Social security. 
 
 Website
 https://pmkmy.gov.in 
 Nodal Agency
 Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare.
 Implementing Agency
 Department of Agriculture, Cooperative and Farmers’ Welfare. 
 Mode of Application
 
 Online through Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana Portal.
 Offline through nearest CSC (Common Service Centre)
 
 Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri  Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PMKMY) is a Central government scheme under Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers’welfare; Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare in partnership with LIC (Life Insurance Corporation of India).
 Scheme shall benefit Small and Marginal farmers of country by providing them social security.
 Scheme helps to provide fixed pension to farmers of Rs. 3000/- per month on completion of 60 years of age.
 Small and Marginal farmer who have cultivable land upto 2 hectare as per land records can apply.
 Farmers between 18 to 40 years of age can enrol for the scheme.
 Under this scheme both Husband and Wife can apply separately, thereby helping them to live respectfully in old age.
 In case of  farmer’s  death after completing 60 years of age, Spouse shall get Rs. 1500/- per month as pension only if she is not separately enrolled under scheme.
 Central government and Farmer shall contribute equally to the Pension Scheme according to the age of farmer at the time of enrolment. The chart below shows the Government and Farmer’s contribution to pension fund.

 Farmer can use his PM-Kisan benefit for contributing for PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri  Kisan Maandhan Yojana).

This can be done by submitting a duly signed enrolment-cum-auto-debit-mandate form at CSC (Common Service Centre).
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age and does not have a spouse then contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher, will be paid to nominee.
 The farmer shall choose nominee at the time of enrolment and also can change it later by contacting the Common Service Centre.
 After death of both farmer and his/her spouse, total accumulated contributions shall be credited back to the pension fund.
 Farmers who are willing to join can apply by approaching the nearest CSC(Common Service Centre)  centre or through online portal https://pmkmy.gov.in .
 Change in bank detail and other details can be done by approaching CSC (Common Service Centre) along with PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) number, Aadhaar card. VLE at CSC will validate the credentials of the farmer.
 Exclusions under schemes/ Persons who cannot apply for scheme
 Small and marginal farmers covered under any other statuary social security schemes.
 Farmers who are enrolled in Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan Yojana and Pradhan Mantri Vyapari Maandhan Yojana.
 Person of higher economic status cannot apply like:
 	Institutional landlords.
 Former/Present holders of constitutional post.
 Serving/Retired officers and Employees of institutions under Government or Local Bodies.
 Persons who paid income tax in the last assessment year.
 
 Eligibility to apply for  Scheme.
 Farmer should be a small or marginal farmer.
 Farmer’s age should be between 18 years to 40 years.
 Farmer should owe cultivable land up to 2 hectares on land records.
 Farmer should not belong under exclusion criteria.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Small and marginal farmers will get Rs. 3000/-monthly pension after 60 years of age.
 Both Husband and Wife can enrol separately for the scheme and can avail benefits.
 In case of beneficiary’s death Rs. 1500/- monthly pension will be given to spouse (if not enrolled under scheme)
 Scheme provides social security to farmers in old age.
 Central government contributes equal amount in the pension fund, as contributed by farmer.
 Farmer can exit from the scheme anytime.
 If farmer exits scheme within a period of less than 10 years, then only his contribution along with saving bank rate of interest rate will be payable.
 If farmer exits scheme after a period of 10 years, then only his contribution along  with saving bank interest rate or interest earned by pension fund be payable, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer becomes permanently disable before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate thereon, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age his spouse can continue with scheme by payment of regular contribution or can exit the scheme by receiving the share of contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher.
 If the farmer dies before 60 years of age and does not have a spouse then contribution deposited by farmer, with interest earned by the pension fund or saving bank interest rate, whichever is higher, will be paid to nominee.
 Essential documents needed for Scheme
 Aadhar card
 Mobile Number
 Bank Account
 Bank account pass book for IFSC code and for other details
 How to apply for Scheme
 Applying through CSC (Common Service centre)
 Farmers wishing to join the scheme shall approach nearest Common Service Centre (CSC) for enrolment.
 Farmer should carry Aadhaar card and Bank passbook for registration.
 Village level Entrepreneur (VLE) at CSC will ensure and validate following farmer related information before registration and will complete the online registration process.
 Aadhaar card
 Farmer’s name
 Farmer’s saving bank account number
 IFSC/MICR code
 Bank passbook or cheque book or copy of bank statement as evidence of bank account.
 Mobile Number
 Date of Birth
 Spouse and nominee particulars
 Residential  Address
 Mobile number given will be verified by OTP verification process.
 Online Registration will be done by providing Personal, Bank account details and completion of an auto-debit mandate form of bank by farmer.
 Farmer will authenticate the data in online generated enrolment form by putting his/her signature.

Farmer should carry Aadhaar card and Bank passbook for registration.
 Village level Entrepreneur (VLE) at CSC will ensure and validate following farmer related information before registration and will complete the online registration process.
 Aadhaar card
 Farmer’s name
 Farmer’s saving bank account number
 IFSC/MICR code
 Bank passbook or cheque book or copy of bank statement as evidence of bank account.
 Mobile Number
 Date of Birth
 Spouse and nominee particulars
 Residential  Address
 Mobile number given will be verified by OTP verification process.
 Online Registration will be done by providing Personal, Bank account details and completion of an auto-debit mandate form of bank by farmer.
 Farmer will authenticate the data in online generated enrolment form by putting his/her signature.
 VLE (Village Level Entrepreneur) will upload scanned copy of signed enrolment-cum-debit mandate form.
 System will calculate contribution according to age of farmer.
 Now applicant can choose his contribution mode (monthly, quarterly, half yearly or annually).
 Initial contribution amount in cash will be made to the VLE (Village Level Entrepreneur).
 Online payment of contribution will be done and a receipt will be provided to farmer.
 Now the registration process is complete and the system will generate a PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) Pension Card with unique Pension Account Number and Pension card will be printed.
 Applying through Online Portal (Self Registration)
 Open the PM-KMY (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana) portal https://pmkmy.gov.in  and click on ‘Click here to apply now’ link.
 Choose Self Enrollment for registration.
 Enter mobile number an OTP will be generated.
 Enter your Name and E-mail Id and OTP and click proceed.
 Now click on Enrollment Tab and choose Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana.
 Enter your Aadhaar Number and accept terms and conditions.
 Enter your following Details: Name, Date of Birth, Gender, Mobile Number, Email Id, State, District, Village, Pincode and Farmer Category.
 Select the premium to be Auto-Deducted from PM-KISAN bank account.
 Click on Submit button.
 Now enter Bank Details: Provide IFSC code and click on verify.
 Now enter Bank Name, Branch and Account Number.
 Enter Nominee Details: Nominee Name, Relation with Nominee, Date of Birth of Nominee and Guardian of Nominee (if minor) and if married enter spouse name.
 Choose your contribution frequency amongst monthly, quarterly, half yearly or annually.
 Amount to be paid will be displayed according to choice opted.
 Click on submit and proceed.
 Click on print mandate form and put your signature on the mandate form.
 Scan this form and upload it by clicking on choose file option and click submit.
 Now your registration is complete and a Congratulation message can be seen on screen.
 A pension card has been generated by the system; you can download and take printout of it.
 Griveance Redressal
 Farmer in case of any difficulty can contact the Grievance Redressal Cell which is set up at state and district level.
 State level officers are State Nodal Officers, State Level Bankers’ Committee and Regional Manager, LIC.
 District levels have District Level bankers Committee and LIC representatives.
 All disputes raised on sponsored bank will be resolved within 30 days.
 Any matter related to execution, grievance redressal, dispute resolution etc.

 Griveance Redressal

 State level officers are State Nodal Officers, State Level Bankers’ Committee and Regional Manager, LIC.
 District levels have District Level bankers Committee and LIC representatives.
 All disputes raised on sponsored bank will be resolved within 30 days.
 Any matter related to execution, grievance redressal, dispute resolution etc. shall be referred to the Joint Secretary (Farmers Welfare), Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers’ Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ welfare, Krishi Bhavan, New Delhi-110001 for redressal.
