 भारत सरकार द्वारा पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना की अधिकारिक वेबसाइट लॉन्च की गयी।
 वेबसाइट पर उपलब्ध पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना के ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र के माध्यम से ही आवेदन किया जायेगा।
 लाभार्थी को सबसे पहले अपना पंजीकरण करना होगा।
 निम्नलिखित जानकारी पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना के पंजीकरण फॉर्म में भरी जाएगी :-
 	राज्य का नाम।
 जिले का नाम।
 बिजली वितरण कंपनी का नाम।
 बिजली कनेक्शन की संख्या।
 ईमेल आईडी।
 मोबाइल नम्बर।
 
 पंजीकरण हो जाने के पश्चात लाभार्थी को अपने मोबाइल नम्बर की सहायता से पुनः लॉगिन करना होगा।
 लॉगिन करने के बाद पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना को चुनना होगा।
 उसके बाद पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना के ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र में

लाभार्थी को अपने मोबाइल नम्बर की सहायता से पुनः लॉगिन करना होगा।
 लॉगिन करने के बाद पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना को चुनना होगा।
 उसके बाद पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना के ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र में मांगी गयी जानकरी को भरना होगा।
 मांगे गए सम्बंधित दस्तावेज़ों को अपलोड करना होगा।
 आवेदन पत्र की गहनता से जांच करने के बाद सबमिट बटन पर क्लिक करते ही पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना का ऑनलाइन आवेदन पत्र जमा हो जायेगा।
 लाभार्थी के मूल राज्य में बिजली वितरित कंपनी द्वारा पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना के आवेदन पत्रों की जांच कर पात्र लाभार्थियों को फियेजिबिलिटी प्रमाण पत्र (Feasibility Certificate) प्रदान किया जायेगा।
 फियेजिबिलिटी प्रमाण पत्र (Feasibility Certificate) मिल जाने के बाद लाभार्थी अपनी बिजली वितरण कंपनी से मान्यता प्राप्त किसी भी वेंडर से अपने घर की छत्त पर इलेक्ट्रिक सोलर प्लांट स्थापित करा सकते है।
 पीएम सूर्य घर: मुफ्त बिजली योजना में सोलर प्लांट स्थापित हो जाने के बाद लाभार्थी को प्लांट का विवरण वेबसाइट पर अपलोड कर नेट मीटर के लिए आवेदन करना होगा।
 सोलर प्लांट में नेट मीटर स्थापित हो जाने के बाद बिजली वितरण कंपनी द्वारा निरिक्षण किया जायेगा।
 निरिक्षण

हो जाने के बाद लाभार्थी को प्लांट का विवरण वेबसाइट पर अपलोड कर नेट मीटर के लिए आवेदन करना होगा।
 सोलर प्लांट में नेट मीटर स्थापित हो जाने के बाद बिजली वितरण कंपनी द्वारा निरिक्षण किया जायेगा।

 लाभार्थी द्वारा कमीशनिंग प्रमाण पत्र (Commissioning Certificate) जारी हो जाने के बाद वेबसाइट पर बैंक खाते का विवरण या रद्द किया हुआ बैंक चैक अपलोड करना होगा।

        " Pradhan Mantri Kusum Yojana": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Kusum Yojana
 Launch Year
 2019
 Benefits
 To ensure energy security for Indian farmers.
 Beneficiary
 Indian Farmers
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 PM KUSUM Application can be submitted online.
 Introduction
 There are many farmers in our nation who have unused or barren land which are not reproductive.
 Seeking this problem, the Indian Government has come up with an idea of installation of solar power plants in such lands.
 And on 2019, the central government has announced PM KUSUM scheme.
 Primarily, this scheme is worked on two verticals, first you can install a solar power plant and sell the generated electricity to the DISCOMs or you can lease the land and earn rent from.
 	Secondly, you can install a solar pump for your irrigation purpose and rest of the electricity can be used for households or you can sell it to the DISCOMs.
 
 Under this scheme, farmers who have barren, marshy or lands in off grid area may install a solar power plants.
 Such solar power plants can be installed by the farmers itself or they can lease their lands to the developers.
 Farmer's can sell the electricity generated from solar power plant to DISCOMs and earn 60,000 to 1 lakhs rupees per year for the next 25 years.
 Meanwhile, farmers can also install a set up of solar agriculture pump up to 7.5 hp to meet their irrigation needs especially in off grid areas.
 Central and state government will provide a subsidy of 30% each of the total cost.
 Whereas, the rest 40% of the total cost can be avail as a loan from the bank for a duration of 30 years.
 This solar pump can replace your conventional diesel generator and the amount the amount that would have been used for diesel can be used for loan repayment.
 By this, you can easily repay your loan in the next 5-6 years.
 Farmers can easily apply for the PM KUSUM Yojana online from the Ministry of New and renewable energy.
 By March 2026, the government aim to add 34,800 MW and for this they are likely to provide 34,

000 to 1 lakhs rupees per year for the next 25 years.
 Meanwhile, farmers can also install a set up of solar agriculture pump up to 7.5 hp to meet their irrigation needs especially in off grid areas.
 Central and state government will provide a subsidy of 30% each of the total cost.
 Whereas, the rest 40% of the total cost can be avail as a loan from the bank for a duration of 30 years.
 This solar pump can replace your conventional diesel generator and the amount the amount that would have been used for diesel can be used for loan repayment.
 By this, you can easily repay your loan in the next 5-6 years.
 Farmers can easily apply for the PM KUSUM Yojana online from the Ministry of New and renewable energy.
 By March 2026, the government aim to add 34,800 MW and for this they are likely to provide 34,422 Cr financial support.
 Benefits of Scheme
 With the help of the PM-KUSUM Scheme, the government aims to promote the use of renewable energy sources, especially solar power. 
 For this, the government will provide the subsidy and incentives for the installation of solar pumps and other technologies based on it. By doing this, we can mitigate climate change and contribute towards a sustainable environment.
 Additionally, it also empowers farmers to generate their own electricity for agricultural and household purposes.
 It enables farmers to irrigate their fields even if they are in the off grid region.
 PM KUSUM scheme is divided into three components and open for all farmers as per the guidelines issued by the government.
 	Component A
 Component B
 Component C
 Under this, the farmer/ Developer/ Cooperative/ Panchayats/ Farmer Producer can install a 10,000 MW Solar Plant.
 Under this, the individual farmers can install a stand-alone solar agriculture pumps in off-grid area.
 Under this, the 35 lakh grid connected agriculture pumps will be solarised through Individual Pump and Feeder Level Solarisation.
 This solar plant shall be Ground or Stilt Mounted.
 For this, the farmers are supported to install stand-alone pump up to 7.5 hp capacity for the replacement of existed diesel pump.
 Individual farmers who have grid connected agriculture pump will be supported.
 State and centre will not provide any assistance under this. However, you can sell your generated electricity to the DISCOMs.
 Under this, you can avail a subsidy of 30% each from centre and state. Whereas rest 40% would be provided by the farmers.
 
 Central will provide a subsidy of 30% (up to 50% for NER/Hilly/islands).
 Whereas, the bank may provide loan of up to 70% of the cost.
 States are free to provide additional subsidy to reduce the farmer contribution.
 
 A maximum of 500 KW to 2 MW Renewable Power Generator can be setup in Barren/ Fallow/ Pasture/ Marshy/ Cultivable Land of Farmers.
 However, you can install a pump more than the given capacity but the financial support is limit to 7.5 hp.
 Such farmers can use the generated solar power for their irrigation needs and the excess generated power can be sold to DISCOM at fixed tariff rate.
 As of 31 Jan 2024, 4766 solar capacity sanction and 165.28 capacity installed
 As of 31 Jan 2024, 1294787 standalone pumps sanctioned out of which 285823 pumps were installed.
 As of 31 Jan 2024, 161204 IPS sanctioned out of which 2117 IPS were installed.

Whereas, 3376466 Feeder level pump sanctioned and 5267 were successfully installed.
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Farmers must have their own land.
 Priority will be given to those who have land in rural areas, off grid areas, and one who have sufficient land for its installation.
 Your land must be within 5 km radius of electric sub station.
 Documents Required
 Before submitting the application for PM KUSUM, the beneficiary must keep a list of documents which are given as:
 	Farmer land documents
 Lease Agreement (If any)
 Bank Account Details
 Khasra Khatauni Number
 Address Proof
 Passport Size photograph
 Self Declaration Letter
 GST registration certificate
 Identification Proof of the applicant
 		Aadhaar Card
 Voter ID
 PAN Card
 Driver License
 
 
 How to apply
 Eligible and interested farmers may apply for the PM KUSUM Scheme online.
 To submit the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha Evam Utthan Mahabhiyan scheme application online, you have to visit their official website first.
 Under the about scheme, you will get the state wise application link for PM KUSUM.
 After reaching to the portal, the beneficiary have to first choose the option from whether they want to lease their land or interested in solar agriculture pumps.
 Fill all the details asked in the respective application form and also upload the necessary documents.
 Review the application form before its final submission.
 Post submission, you will receive a successfully registration message with its details (like registration number).
 Important Link
 PM KUSUM Website
 PM KUSUM Scheme State Wise Online Application Link 
 Contact Details
 PM KUSUM Scheme Toll Free number: 1800-180-3333
 PM KUSUM Scheme Helpdesk Email: pmkusum-mnre@gov.in
 Ministry of New and Renewable Energy,
 	Atal Akshay Urja Bhawan, CGO Complex, Lodhi Road, New Delhi - 110 003, India.

 Overview of the scheme
 
 Name of the scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan
 Launch Year
 2023
 Benefits
 To provide benefits of Govt Scheme to every member of the Tribal Community
 Beneficiary
 Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG)
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Tribal Affairs
 Subscription

 Mode of Apply
 No need to apply
 Introduction
 In the budget speech of 2023-24, Indian Government announced the 'Pradhan Mantri Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan' (PM-JANMAN).
 Under this, they emphasize the development of tribal community by aiming a goal to provide benefit to every single member.
 As per the 2011 census, India has 10.45 Cr of ST population, out of which 75 communities are located in 18 States and UTs of Andaman and Nicobar.
 Such communities, have been categorised as 'Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups' (PVTGs).
 Since ages, these communities are deprive of basic amenities like road, electricity, medical and others.
 Due to this, these communities face vulnerability in the verticals of Social, Economic and Education Fields.
 To counter this and reach out to the single member of these Tribal Community, the govt announced the PM-JANMAN Scheme.
 The scheme has been launched on the occasion of Jan Jatiya Gaurav Diwas on November 15, 2023.
 For this, the govt announced a total outlay of Rs 24,104 Cr and on Jan 15, 2024 the government released 1st instalment of Rs 540 Cr for 1 lakh PMAY (G).
 Under this, the govt aim to cater 11 major activity with the intervention of 9 ministries.
 Primarily, the main scope of the scheme is to provide;
 	Safe Housing.
 Clean Drinking Water and Sanitation.
 Vocational Education and Skills.
 Healthcare.
 Road and Travel Connectivity.
 Provide sustainable livelihood opportunities.
 
 To monitor these development under PM JANMAN, the govt.

launched the PM Gatishakti Platform.

        " Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY)": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY)
 Launch Year
 2000
 Benefits
 To provide all weather road connectivity to rural areas.
 Beneficiary
 Rural Areas and habitation not connected with road.
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Rural Development
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 No need to apply
 Introduction
 Around 74% of total population of India living it its villages and as per the estimate about 330,000 from 825,000 village and habitation are not connected with road.
 Due to this, such people are unable to access the market, schools, hospitals and other essential needs and have to deal with a lot of problem in their day to day life.
 To overcome such issue and provide basic needs to such habitations, the central government announced a scheme in the year 2000 called 'Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana'.
 Under this, the central government with the help of state government aim to provide all weather road connectivity.
 Initially the scheme was centrally sponsored but later after some modification the funding a pattern changed to 60:40 for all states except 8 North eastern and 3 Himalayan states where the ratio is 90:10.
 Since 2000, till 2022, the 1,5719 habitation have been successfully connected with all weather road.
 For its implementation, the state and UT government will identify the one or two agency who will make a district rural road plan as per the eligibility.
 Thereupon, this plan is forwarded to state level standing committee, upon approval the state government will forward the proposal the ministry of rural development.
 Sanctioned project is likely to execute in a period of 9-12 months.
 As per the statistics; 753,932 KMs road length is completed and 8,920 road work is under progress.
 Currently, this is the third stage of the PMGSY that was launched in 2019, where government focuses on consolidation of 1.25 Lakh KM through routes and connected the habitation to the agricultural markets, Higher secondary school, and hospitals.
 In the first stage of PMGSY-I the main focus is to provide rural connectivity.

Later, in 2012 the PMGSY-II was announced where the prime focus is to improve the maintenance and consolidation of existing rural road networks.
 Benefits of Scheme
 To Provide all-weather road connectivity to all eligible people living in rural areas.
 It may help in transportation of goods and minimizing its spoilage.
 People may easily access the markets, school, healthcare, and other essential activities.
 Small business and entrepreneurship may seek growth after faster connectivity with the metro cities.
 Eligibility Criteria
 The minimum population of the rural area to connect with the road should be 500 person.
 	However, in case of hilly area this population size should not be less than 250.
 
 As the scheme, is funded by the state and central government so the availability of funds is also a key eligibility.
 Documents Required
 No documents are required for this scheme, the agency formed by the state government will process the application after identifying the required conditions.
 How to apply
 Individuals cannot apply for the PMGSY of their own.
 If they fulfil the conditions but are still deprived of the benefits of the scheme, they can approach their local administration for assistance.
 For this, they can contact their gram panchayat or others.
 Important Link

 Ministry of Rural Development Website
 Contact Details
 Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana Contact Number: 011-26716930, 26716936
 Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana Helpdesk: nrrda@pmgsy.nic.in.
 Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India
 	NBCC Tower, 5th Floor, Bhikaji Cama Place, Rama Krishna Puram, New Delhi, Delhi 110066

 Introduction
 As we know, there are numerous households in rural areas that lack access to clean and potable water.
 Since years, these households are depends on the ponds, well and other sources to fetch water for their daily needs.
 To understand these problems, under Jal Jeevan Mission the central government announce the 'Har Ghar Nal Yojana' in 2019.
 The main objective of the scheme is to supply tap water to nearly 16 Cr households by 2024.
 Scheme ensures to provide safe water to all households and prevent their children from various diseases like Diarrhoea.
 To achieve this target, the government has allocated 3.60 lakh crores Rs.
 Also, the functionality of the existing water connection will be ensured under this mission.
 As of 29 Feb 2024, a total of 14,42,26,979 tap water connection is provided under the Har Ghar Nal Yojana.
 Under the programme, Goa becomes the first state followed by Telangana and Andaman and Nicobar island to provide 100% tap water supply.
 Benefits of Scheme
 To provide Functional Household Tap Connection.
 With the help of safe potable water it may reduce the child mortality due to various water disease.
 Eligibility Criteria
 Applicants must be from rural areas.
 Households should not have any functional tap connection.
 Documents Required
 To apply for Har Ghar Nal Yojana, the applicants must be in a possession of following documents. However, the list may vary state wise, before applying applicants must confirm the same with the department of water resources.
 Identification Proof
 	Aadhar Card
 Voter ID
 Driver License
 
 Address Proof
 	Aadhar Card
 Utility Bills (Gas Connection, Electricity bills)
 
 Mobile Number
 Passport size photograph
 Domicile
 Stamp Duty (if required)
 How to apply
 Eligible applicants shall submit their Har Ghar Nal Yojana application offline.
 For this, they must collect the Har Ghar Jal Yojana Application form from the Water Resource department.
 After collecting the form, they have to fill all the mandatory details mentioned in the form.
 Thereafter, attach all the necessary documents to it and paste a latest photograph in the space given.
 Please submit this duly filled Har Ghar Nal Yojana application form with required connection fee to the department from where you collected it.
 Upon verification, the officials will provide the connection.

        " Swachh Bharat Mission": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Swachh Bharat Mission
 Launch Year
 2014
 Benefits
 To promote cleanliness and make India Open Defecation Free
 Beneficiary
 Urban and Rural Households
 Nodal Department
 Department of Drinking and Water Sanitation
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 Swachh Bharat Mission Application Mode is Online
 Introduction
 Whether its rural or urban, open defecation is quite common in India, instead of toilets people used to defecate in open fields.
 Due to this, our drinking water sources and food contaminated, which causes major diseases like diarrhoea, cholera, trachoma, malaria, ascariasis, intestinal worms etc.
 Not only this, the conventional sanitation and absence of toilets also cost India 6.4% of its GDP in 2006.
 It also affects the health of children's especially under age group of 5 because of their weak immunity.
 In addressing this issue across India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the world's largest sanitation mission, known as the 'Swachh Bharat Mission,' in 2014.
 Under this mission, the government aim to construct 10 crore individual toilets and they believe by October 2019 to make India an Open Defecation Free Country.
 They also ensure, no households should engage in the open defecation and avoid construction of new insanitary toilets during the mission.
 Along with, the already constructed pit latrines are converted to sanitary latrines.
 If there is a sewage system available, only a toilet structure will be constructed, whereas in its absence, an on-site treatment system shall be constructed.
 Under the scheme, the government will construct Households toilets, community toilets, public toilets and urinals.
 For its construction, the government will provide incentive as decided for rural and urban areas.
 Beneficiary Household Groups will be identified by the procedure designed by ULB.
 Similarly for the rural areas, the incentive for each individual household latrine (IHHL) construction is Rs 12000.
 As of Jan 30, 2024, over 5,09,680 villages declared themselves ODF.
 Benefits of Scheme
 As the scheme is associated to Cleanliness, so it may produce multiple benefits to the urban and rural people.
 	First, it may promote the cleanliness and hygiene among the people.
 Eliminate open defecation in rural and urban areas.
 Convert insanitary and single pit latrines into sanitary latrines.
 To improve solid waste management.
 It may help to reduce the air and water borne disease that causes due to open defecation.
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Individual or households of rural and urban area are eligible for the scheme.
 However, primarily the target group are those who are from low income households.
 You are must be on specific geographical areas which are in identified as sanitation needs.

        " PM Kisan Sampada Yojana": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 PM Kisan Sampada Yojana
 Launch Year
 2017
 Benefits
 To boost food processing sector, doubling the farmers income, and generate new employment.
 Beneficiary
 Farmers
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Food Processing Industry
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 Applicants may submit PM Kisan Sampada Yojana Application Online
 Introduction
 To boost the Agro Marine Processing and Development of Agro Processing Clusters, the Indian Government announced 'PM Kisan Sampada Scheme' in 2017.
 Basically it is an Umbrella scheme, under which the government implement eight scheme.
 Under the scheme, the government aims to develop modern infrastructure capable of efficiently managing the supply chain from farms to retail outlets.
 Post implementation it will help the government to double the income of the farmers and enables to generate new employment opportunities.
 This infrastructure will help to minimise the product wastage and help in the export of processing foods.
 While announcing the scheme, the government outlay a funds of 6000 Cr for 2016-2020 period.

Thereafter another 4600 Cr funds allocated till 2026
 With PM Kisan Sampada Yojana implementation the government aim to provide benefits to 20 lakh farmers across the nation.
 Entities like State Government organization, Joint Ventures, PSUs, SHGs, NGOs, Cooperatives, Private Sector Companies, Proprietorship firms etc are eligible for the scheme and submit their proposal to the government.
 To set up food processing units the government will provide grant as per the scheme available under the umbrella of PM Kisan Sampada Yojana.
 Its application shall be submitted online only with the required documents.
 Post approval of proposals the authority will issue the instalment grant.
 The proposed grant will be issued in three instalments, and for its release, the applicants must produce the notified documents.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Under the PM Kisan Sampada Scheme, the government is looking to provide the following benefits:
 	First, to create an infrastructure for food processing sector.
 Secondly, to ease the supply management from farm to retail.
 To reduce the wastage of farmers product.
 To double the income of the farmers.
 To create employment opportunities whether it is direct or indirect.
 To increase the processing level.
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 The PM Kisan Sampada Scheme is an umbrella scheme that encompasses eight different sub-schemes, each with its own eligibility criteria.
 Scheme Name
 Details
 Entities
 Mega Food Park
 
  
 Minimum land require for the scheme is 50 Acres for 75 years.
 Grant of 50% for General area and 75% for North East, Hill and Difficult area, which should not be more than 50 Cr.
 Only one Mega Food Park is allowed in one district.
 
 It will be implemented through Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV), whose net worth should not be less than 50 crore.
 Integrated Cold Chain and value Addition Infrastructure
 
 For Storage Infrastructure- 35% project cost will be grant to General Areas and 50% for N.E, Hill and applicant of difficult areas.
 Whereas, for Food Processing Infrastructure 50% project cost will grant to general area applicants and 75% to Hilly, N.E and Difficult areas.
 In both scenario the maximum grant is 10 Cr.
 The net worth of the promoters should not be less than 1.5 times of the grant sought.
 
 
 Government organisation, PSUs, Joint ventures, NGOs, SHGs, Cooperatives, FPOs, Private Companies, Partnership and Proprietorship may set up this unit.
 
 Creation or expansion of Food Processing Units
 
 Preference for this unit is given to those where Mega Food Park is set up followed by Agro Clusters, and designated food park.
 Grant of 35% of total project cost is given to General Area applicants and 50% to hilly, N.E, and Difficult areas applicants, which should not exceed 5 Cr.
 The minimum project cost for General area and N.E applicants should be 3 Cr. and 1 Cr.
 
 
 PSUs of central and state.

and 1 Cr.
 
 
 PSUs of central and state. Joint venture, FPOs, NGOs, Cooperative, SHGs, Corporate entity and Proprietorship firms may set up this unit.
  
 
 Infrastructure for Agro-Processing Clusters
 
 One unit in each district will be sanctioned.
 No APC Unit will be allowed if Mega Food Park is located in the same district.
 Grant of 35% for General area and 50% for Hilly and North East area will be provided which should not be more than 10 Cr.
 Applicants net worth shall not be less than the aid grant under the scheme.
 SC/ST applicants net worth shall not be less than 10% of the combined net worth of the entity.
 Net Worth Criteria is not applicable for government organisation.
  
 
 It can be set up by an entity, Government organisation, PSUs, Joint ventures, NGOs, SHGs, Cooperatives, FPOs, Private Companies, Partnership and Proprietorship.
 Creation of Backward and Forward Linkages
 
 Grant of 35% of total project cost will be provided to General Area Applicants and 50% for North East, Hilly and applicants of difficult areas, which should not exceed 5 Cr.
 Existing promoters of Food Processing Unit other than those who availed the MoPI grant.
 Group of co-operative producer, FPOs, SHGs, FPCs, which are linked to processing Units.
 Processed food retailer that have linkage at farm level or with food producers.
 Or entrepreneur who have an interest in food retail value and processing.
 
 
 Central and State PSUs, Joint Ventures, FPOs, SHGs, NGOs, Public and Private Companies, Proprietary and Partnership firms, Corporate entity and Limited Liability Partnership may apply for the set up.
 
 Operation Greens
 
 Net Worth of the applicant shall not be less than 1.5 times of the Aid sought.
 Only one application is accepted from an entity.
 
 State Agriculture and marketing federation, FPO, Cooperative, SHGs, Logistics operator, Service provider, Supply chain Operator, Companies, Retail and wholesale chains, central and state government entities, and Food Processor.
 Food Safety and Quality Assurance Infrastructure
 
 Under this, applicants of General area may avail 50% of grant for laboratory equipment, whereas North East, hilly area, and Difficult area may get 70%. Public Sector and Govt Sector will get 100% Grant.
 On the other hand, the grant for technical civil works for general area is 25% and 33% for North East, Hill and Difficult area.
 
 Organization of state and central government, Universities, Deemed University, and Private sector organisation are eligible for this.
 Human Resource and Institutions
 
 100% grant for a duration of three years is given to Govt organisation and Universities.
 Whereas, Private organisation/Universities/Institutions will get grant in aid of 50% in equipment cost only to General Area and 70% to North East and Difficult areas.
 
 Universities, IITs, Institutions of Central and state government, Organisation funded by the Govt, R&D laboratory, CSIR R&D unit in Pvt Sector are eligible for this.
 Documents Required
 In support of the PM Kisan Sampada Online Application, the applicants are requested to keep their required documents ready.

Here we shared a list of documents that will be required during the online form submission.
 	Detailed Project Report
 Certificate issued from CA or Statutory authority in support of net worth.
 Term Loan Sanction from the bank.
 Scheme appraisal note issued from the scheduled commercial bank.
 Registration Certificate, PAN, TAN, SC/ST Certificate (As applies)
 Ownership or lease details of lands.
 Application Fee submission proof.
 Correspondences for forward and backward linkages.
 Plant and machinery equipment quotations for the project proposed.
 Details of bank accounts.
 Self Attested translated documents if original documents are in regional language.
 
 How to apply
 You can submit the Expression of Interest for PM Kisan Sampada Yojana online.
 However, as of now the Ministry is accepting application for Research and Development scheme only.
 You can find the Online Application Link for PM Kisan Sampada Yojana from MOFPI website.
 For registration, you can select the R&D link available under the drop list of EOI Registration.
 Thereafter, opt whether registered with the NGO Darpan portal of Niti Ayog or not.
 Those registered in the portal may submit its details and proceed, whereas others may fill their application form with required details.
 Now you have to login to the PM Kisan Sampada Portal with the generated details.
 Post login, you have to fill its application with the details mentioned. 
 Upload the required documents for PM Kisan Sampada Application.
 Before final submission, take a cursory glance at the application form to confirm the details entered.
 Post PM Kisan Sampada application submission the proposals will be forwarded to a technical committee formed by the ministry.
 This committee will thoroughly evaluate the application form and documents details.
 After approval of proposals the authority will issue a sanction for first/second and third instalment of grant.

 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 PM Matsya Sampada Yojana
 Launch Year
 2020
 Benefits
 Strengthen the Fish Sector by modernising and doubling the farmer income.
 Beneficiary
 Fish Farmers and fishers
 Nodal Department
 Department of Fisheries
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 Application for PM Matsya Sampada Yojana Submitted through offline
 Introduction
 Do you know there are 16 million fishers and fish farmers whose livelihood depends on the fisheries and aquaculture.
 This sector is registering a huge growth and as per the statistics, in the last five years this sector YoY growth is 10.88%
 Whereas in terms of export this sector is standing tall at 13.93 lakh metric tones, which is equivalent to 46,589 Cr.
 Envisaging great potential in the sector, the government announced the PM Matsya Samapda Yojana in its 2019-2020 budget and launched it in the year 2020.
 Under this, the government aim to build a robust management and regulatory for the fish sector, which will ensure the social, physical and economic security of the fish farmers.
 For its implementation, the government allocates Rs 20,050 Cr for a period of five years from FY 2020-21 to FY 2024-25.
 Government aim to use the fisheries sector potential in a sustainable, fair, and accountable manner.
 By doing this, they aim to enhance the production and productivity.
 They also want to strengthen and modernise the value chain of the fisheries sector and for this they need to work on the post harvesting management and its quality.
 With its successful implementation, they are looking to double the income of the fish farmers and fishers.
 They firmly believe that, upon its successful implementation this sector is able to generate 55 lakhs new employment opportunities.
 In terms of production, the government aim to increase the fish production in the country to 22 million from 13.75 metric tons and increase the average aquaculture in the country to 5 tons from current 3 tons.
 Whereas, in terms of Economics valuation, they aim to increase the GVA contribution of fisheries sector to 9% from 7.28%.

Government aim to use the fisheries sector potential in a sustainable, fair, and accountable manner.
 By doing this, they aim to enhance the production and productivity.
 They also want to strengthen and modernise the value chain of the fisheries sector and for this they need to work on the post harvesting management and its quality.
 With its successful implementation, they are looking to double the income of the fish farmers and fishers.
 They firmly believe that, upon its successful implementation this sector is able to generate 55 lakhs new employment opportunities.
 In terms of production, the government aim to increase the fish production in the country to 22 million from 13.75 metric tons and increase the average aquaculture in the country to 5 tons from current 3 tons.
 Whereas, in terms of Economics valuation, they aim to increase the GVA contribution of fisheries sector to 9% from 7.28%.
 PMMSY is an umbrella scheme which will be implemented under two components namely Central Sector Scheme (CS) and Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS).
 Under CS the entire project is funded by the central government whereas under CSS the project cost will be shard by the state and centre.
 Benefits of Scheme
 With the launch of the PM Matsya Sampada Scheme, the government provide various benefits: -
 	To modernise and strengthen the sector.
 		For this they will work on the Infrastructure and post harvest management.
 
 To enhance fish production and its productivity.
 		For this, inland fisheries and aquaculture development and brood banks establishment is important.
 
 To use the sector in a sustainable and responsible manner.
 To double the income of the fishers and fish farmers.
 To generate new useful employment opportunities.
 To ensure social, physical, and economic security of the farmers.
 		They provide safety kits and motorised fishing vessels.
 Nets for traditional fishermen and boats.
 
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Only following applicants may apply for the PM Matsya Sampada Yojana who are its beneficiary:-
 	Fishers and Fish Farmers.
 Fish worker and its vendors.
 Development corporation of fisheries.
 SHGs and JLGs in fisheries sector.
 Fisheries cooperative and federation.
 Private firms and entrepreneur.
 Organisation and companies of fish farmers producer
 Scheduled Caste
 Scheduled Tribe
 Person with physical disability
 
 Documents Required
 To Apply for the PM Matsya Sampada Yojana, the beneficiary must possess some of their documents which are given as: -
 	Aadhar Card
 PAN Card
 Voter ID Card
 Bank Account Details
 Project Report
 Land Documents
 Business Registration Certificate
 SC/ST Certificate (If any)
 Disability Certificate (If any)
 Mobile Number
 Mandate Form
 Passport Size Photograph
 Fishing Vessel License
 Net License
 
 How to apply
 Eligible and interested beneficiary may submit their PM Matsya Sampada Application Proposal offline.
 Those who want to apply for Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) may follow the given process:
 	Submit a triplicate copy of DPR or Self Contained Proposal (SCP).
 From these, submit one copy to Department of Fisheries, Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying of GOI and other two copies to NFDB.
 Along with this, submit a duplicate copy of DPR/SCP to:
 		The Chief Executive, National Fisheries Development Board, Department of Fisheries, Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying, Government of India, Pillar No: 235, PVNR Expressway, SVPNPA Post, Hyderabad-500052

        " Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups": "
 Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups
 Launch Year
 2022
 Benefits
 Hassle and Collateral Free Credit or Loans
 Beneficiary
 DPIIT Register Startups
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Commerce and Industry
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 
 Applicants may register for DIPP Recognition Online
 Application process for Start-up Credit Guarantee Scheme is offline
 
 Introduction
 After US and China, India stands as the third largest hub for startup globally.
 According to the DPIIT, there are currently 123,073 DPIIT recognised startup operational in India.
 Remarkably, around 48% of these startups are from Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.
 However, despite the burgeoning startups ecosystem, many start-ups failed to sustained because of the financial crunch.
 Recognising this issue, the government has taken some proactive steps to support the startup body.
 In view to, the government announced the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups in 2022.
 Under this scheme, the beneficiary will get a credit guarantee up to specified limit against the loan issued by the Scheduled Banks, NBFCs etc.
 Along with this, they will get a collateral free credit or loan from the institutions.
 For individuals, the maximum guarantee is capped at 10 Cr or the actual credit amount, whichever is less.
 The guarantee offering under the scheme would be transaction based and umbrella based.
 On a single borrower basis, the Transaction Based Guarantee is provided to Member of Institution (As of 2024, there are 31 registered MIs).
 Whereas, Umbrella Based Guarantee offers guarantee to Venture Based Funds (VDF) registered under the AIF Regulation of SEBI.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The foremost benefit of the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups (CGSS) is they are offering Credit guarantee against your loan.
 Secondly, beneficiary will get a collateral free credit or loan from the MIs.
 Individual will receive a maximum credit guarantee of Rs 10 Cr or their actual outstanding credit amount, whichever is lower.
 Guarantee offers under the CGSS is transaction based or Umbrella Based.
 Scheme Type
 Default Cover Offered
 Transaction Based Guarantee
 
 80% if Loan amount is 3 Cr.
 75% if the loan amount is above 3 Cr.
 65% if the loan amount is above 5 Cr (up to 10 Cr).
 
 Umbrella Based Guarantee
 Actual loss or 5% of the pooled investment, whichever is lower (maximum 10 Cr per borrower).
 Eligibility Criteria
 To borrow Credit Guarantee under the CGSS have some specific criteria for startups, that are as follows:
 	Startups must be registered and recognised by the DPIIT.
 		For this, the company age or its operation should not exceed 10 years.
 Company must be incorporated as a Private limited or Registered partnership firm or Limited Liability Partnership.
 Since Inception, the Annual turnover of the company should not exceed Rs 100 Cr.
 Innovation and scalability are two prime aspects of the company which may generate wealth and employment.
 Ensure the company should not have any connection to splitting or reconstruction of any existing business.
 
 As per the RBI Guidelines, Startups must not be defaulted by any institution and labelled as Non Performing Asset.
 The Member of Institution certifies the eligibility for guarantee cover of the startup.
 Must have generated a stable revenue over the last 12 months.
 Scheduled bank and NBFCs must have a rating of BBB and above.

 Innovation and scalability are two prime aspects of the company which may generate wealth and employment.

 Company Registration Certificate
 Revenue Details
 Voter ID
 Aadhaar Card
 Passport Size Photograph
 Residence Proof
 Company Address Proof
 DIPP Recognition Certificate

 How to apply

 If your startup is not DIPP recognised then you have to recognised it first.
 For that, you have to create an investor account, if you don't have already.
 You can create your investor account by visiting the National Single Window System Website.
 Post Registration, login to the portal with the generated details.
 Thereafter, you can fill the 'Registration as a Startup' Application form with the required details.
 Once your startup get recognition on DIPP, then you can apply for a credit or loan offline from the Member of Institution that are on the NCGTC panel.

Rs. 25,000/- or 50% Cost of Vehicle, Whichever is Less.
Nodal Agency
Tamil Nadu Corporation for Development of Women.
Mode of Applying
Only Offline Mode.
Introduction
Amma Two Wheeler Scheme is the scheme of Tamil Nadu Government.
It is a scheme for working women of Tamil Nadu.
The scheme is monitored by Tamil Nadu State Rural Livelihood Mission.
It is operational from the year 2017.
This main objective of this scheme is to enables the working women to buy two wheeler for herself.
An assistance of Rs. 25,000/- or 50% Cost of Vehicle, whichever is less will be given to the eligible beneficiary for purchase of two wheeler.
Beneficiary can buy any vehicle of her own choice.
But the vehicle should be gearless or auto-geared two wheeler.
Engine capacity should be maximum 125 cc.
Having a Valid License/Learner License is mandatory to avail the benefit of the scheme.
Eligibility Conditions
The women should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
Age should be between 18 to 40 years.
Must Know Driving.
Have Valid Two Wheeler License/Learner License.
The annual income should not exceed to Rs. 2,50,000/-.
Only single women beneficiary is eligible to avail the benefit in a family.
Should have appeared for class 8th examination (Passed/Failed).
Priority will be given to :-
	Women living in remote places or mountainous areas.
Female Headed Families.
Deserted Women.
Destitute Widows.
Disabled Women.
Unmarried Women aged above 35 years.
Schedule Caste/Schedule Tribe.
Transgenders.

Eligible Beneficiaries
Registered Women Worker in the Organized Sector.
Registered Women Worker in the Unorganized Sector.
Women Employed in Shops and Establishment.
Self Employed Women.
Women Working in :-
	Government Aided Organizations.
Private Institutions.
Government Projects.
Panchayat Level Federations (PLF) or Village Poverty Reduction Committees (VPRCs).
Makkal Kattral Maiyam (Makamai).
Daily Wager.
Contract Employee.

Banking Correspondents.
Banking Facilitators.
ASHA Workers.
Documents Required
Aadhar Card.
Passport Size Photograph.
Proof of Age.
Proof of Residence :-
	EPIC Card.
Driving License.
Aadhar Card.
Utility Bills
in the applicant names.

Driving License/Learner Driving License (LLR)
Income Certificate /Self Certification.
Proof of Employment issued by :-
	Employer.
Organization.
Project Head.
Society in Case of Wage.
Salaried Employment.

Proof of Educational Qualification/Appearance for VIII standard Exam (Transfer Certificate, SSLC etc.

)
Schedule Caste/Schedule Tribe Certificate.
Differently Abled Identity Card.
Quotation of the Vehicle.
Reservation Details
Category
Reserved Percentage
Schedule Caste (SC)
21%

1%

4%
Selection Procedure
Collect Application Form from Block Offices, Urban Local Body Offices, and the Collectorates of the district free of cost.
Filled the Application Form correctly.
Attach all the required documents with the Application Form.
Submit it to the Block Office or Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) office.
The applicant can also send their duly filled application through Speed/Registered Post.
A unique application number will be allotted to all the received applications.
Acknowledgement receipt will be given to the applicant having unique application number on it.
Application will be scrutinized at different level.
After proper verification of the application and attached documents, the final list of eligible beneficiaries will be selected by District Level Selection Committee.
If the beneficiary fulfills all the eligible condition and willing to buy the vehicle from her own funds then she will have to submit her Subsidy Claim Form for releasing the subsidy.
The subsidy amount will directly transferred to beneficiaries bank account.
If the applicant wants to purchase the vehicle through loan then her application will be sent to bank or vehicle financing company.
Feature of the Scheme.
Most of the working women in Tamil Nadu finds difficult to reached their work place on time.
The problem gets even worse when it is time to come back from the office.
So, keeping this in mind Tamil Nadu Government launches Amma Two Wheeler Scheme for Working Women.
In this scheme, any working women who is willing to buy two wheeler will get subsidy from Tamil Nadu Government.
The amount of subsidy is Rs. 25,000/- or 50% of the cost of the vehicle, whichever is less.
Additional assistance of Rs.

25,000/- or 50% of the cost of the vehicle, whichever is less.
Additional assistance of Rs. 6,250/- will be given to disable beneficiary.
The remaining amount will be borne by the beneficiary by herself.
There is also a facility of loan through a bank or institutional loan for remaining amount.
Selected vehicle should be manufactured on or after 01.01.2018.
Only one women in a family is eligible to avail the benefit of the scheme.
The vehicles should only and only for the beneficiary's own use.
Vehicle should not be sold or transferred or gifted or lent to any other person for a minimum period of 3 years.

": "
Overview Of The Scheme

Name of Scheme
Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme.
Benefits
Financial Assistance to meet the cost of education.
Beneficiaries
Girl Students of Tamil Nadu.
Amount of Assistance
Rs. 1,000/- per month till the completion of the course.
Nodal Agency
Department of Social Welfare and Women Empowerment, Tamil Nadu.
Subscription
Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
Mode of Apply
Through Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Education Assurance Scheme Application Form.
Introduction
Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Education Assurance Scheme is a flagship scheme of Tamil Nadu Government.
This scheme has been named after the famous social and political activist and renowned author of Tamil Nadu Late Smt. Moovalur Ramamirtham.
It is run by Department of Social Welfare and Women Empowerment of Government of Tamil Nadu.
Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme is also called "Pudhumai Penn Scheme".
Many girls leave their studies after passing 12th because of their financial condition.
Even if the parents of those girls want, they are not able to teach them further because of the cost of education.
Due to all these reasons, girls are deprived of education and they get married early.
Keeping all these points in mind, Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme was started by the Government of Tamil Nadu.
The main objective of this scheme is to help girls financially to complete their further education.
Under this scheme, financial assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per month will be given to the eligible girls students.
This assistance will be provided till the girl completes her undergraduate course.
But only those girls are eligible for financial assistance under this scheme who completed their education of Class 6th to Class 12th from Tamil Nadu Government Schools.
Girls Students can apply for financial assistance for under graduate course by filling the Online Application Form of Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme.
Amount of Assistance
The below mentioned benefits will be provided to eligible Girls Students under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme :-
	Financial Assistance of Rs.

1,000/- per month will be given to the eligible girls students.
This assistance will be provided till the girl completes her undergraduate course.
But only those girls are eligible for financial assistance under this scheme who completed their education of Class 6th to Class 12th from Tamil Nadu Government Schools.
Girls Students can apply for financial assistance for under graduate course by filling the Online Application Form of Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme.
Amount of Assistance
The below mentioned benefits will be provided to eligible Girls Students under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme :-
	Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per Month will be provided to girls students till the completion of their course.

Eligibility
Only Girls Students are Eligible to Apply.
Girls who have passed Class 6th to Class 12th from Tamil Nadu Government School.
Girls studying in any Undergraduate Course.
Girls who have passed Class 6th to Class 8th from private school under Right to Education Act (RTE) and passed Class 9th to Class 12th from Tamil Nadu Government School are also eligible to apply.
Ineligibility
The below mentioned girls are not eligible to avail the benefit of per month financial assistance under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Scheme of Tamil Nadu Government :-
	Girls Who Have Passed 6th to 12th Class from Private School.
Girls Studying in Post Graduate Course.
Girls Studying Through Distance Mode.
Girls Studying in Open Universities.

Documents Required
Documents that are required at the time of applying for financial assistance under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Scheme are as follows :-
Domicile of Tamil Nadu.
Aadhar Card.
Caste Certificate (If Applicable).
10th Marksheet/Certificate.
12th Marksheet/Certificate.
Transfer Certificate from School.
Bank Account Details.
How to Apply
Girls Students can apply for financial assistance by filling Online Application Form of Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme.
Online Application Form of Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme is available at Pudhumai Penn Portal.
Girl Student has to Register herself first through her Mobile Number.
After entering the mobile number, an OTP will be received on the applicant's mobile number.
After entering OTP, the applicant has to enter the following personal details :-
	Date of Birth.
EMIS Number.
Name of the Applicant.
Father/Mother/Guardian Name.
Aadhar Number.
Community.
Mobile Number.
Email ID.
Photo of the Applicant.
Educational Category.
College District.
College Name.
Course.
Course Tenure.
Joining Year.
College Roll Number.

After filling all these details click on proceed button.
After that the applicant will have to fill the following details of school education from Class 6th to Class 12th :-
	District of the School.
Panchayat Town.
School Name.
Year of Passing.
Roll Number (Only of Class 10th and Class 12th).

Then fill the below mentioned bank details :-
	Bank Name.
Branch City.
Branch Name.
IFSC Code.
Account Number.
Re-enter Account Number.
Account Holder Name.

After filling all the details click on submit button and after that a preview form will appear on the screen.
Then after checking all the details click on complete registration and the applicant's form will be submitted.
After verification of the application from the Education Department, the applicant will be informed through SMS.
If the application is found to be correct, the applicant will continue to get the amount of assistance in the bank account regularly every month.
Features of the Scheme
Under this scheme, only those girls are eligible who have completed their studies from class 6th to class 12th from a government school.
The girl who has completed her studies under Right to Education from class 6th to class 8th and after that from a government school from class 9th to class 12th are also eligible under this scheme.
A girl who takes benefit of any other government scheme is also eligible to get benefit under this scheme.
Girls studying in any Undergraduate Course, Professional Course, Paramedical Course, Diploma, ITI, or any other recognised course are eligible to take benefits under this scheme.
Girls who have completed class 6 to 12 from any private school, studying in open university or distance mode, studying in post graduate course are not eligible under this scheme.
An amount of Rs.

697.78 Core has been made for this scheme in the budget estimate for the year 2022-2023.
After applying, the list of eligible students will be released only after due scrutiny of the applications.
The financial assistance amount of the scheme will be given every month in the account of the girl.
List of Eligible Courses
Following are the eligible courses for financial assistance under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme :-
	
Bachelor Degrees Courses like :-
					B.A
BSc.
B.Com.
B.B.A.
B.C.A.

Professional Courses like :-
					B.E.
B. Tech.
M.B.B.B.S.
B.D.S.
BSc. (Agriculture).
B.V.Sc.
B.F.Sc.
B.L.

Paramedical Courses like :-
					Nursing.
Pharmacy.
Medical Lab Technology.
Physiotherapy.

All Arts, Science and Fine Arts Courses.
Diploma or ITI or any other recognised course.


List of Eligible Government Schools
The following schools are also treated as Eligible Government Schools under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme :-
	
Adi Dravidar Welfare Schools.
Kallar Reclamation Schools.
Panchayat Union Primary and Middle Schools.
Schools Run by Municipalities and Municipal Corporation.
Tribal Welfare School.
Schools Run by Forest and Social Defence Departments.
Schools Run by Department of the Welfare of the Differently Abled.
Backward/Most Backward Welfare Schools.


Important Links

Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Education Assurance Scheme Official Guidelines.
Contact Details
Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme Helpline Numbers :-
	9150056809.
9150056805.
9150056801.
9150056810.

Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme Helpdesk Email :- mraheas@gmail.com.

Overview of the Scheme

Name of the Scheme
Tamil Nadu Unemployment Assistance Scheme.
Launched on
2006.
Beneficiaries
Registered Unemployed Youth of State.
Benefits
Monthly Financial Assistance.
Implementing Agency
Department of Employment and Training, Tamil Nadu.
Mode of Application
Offline through Application Form.
Introduction
Tamil Nadu Government started Unemployment Assistance Scheme for the welfare of unemployed youth of  the state.
Unemployment Assistance Scheme provides monthly financial assistance to youth of weaker sections to support their job search requirements, so that they can get the right job according to their qualification.
Tamil Nadu Unemployment Assistance Scheme was started in 2006 in order to reduce the hardship of people who are searching job in various sectors.
Scheme is implemented in the state by Department of Employment and Training, Tamil Nadu.
The state has transformed employment exchange as Career Centres by forming District Employment and Coaching cum Guidance Centres in every district.
State is providing a platform for job seekers and employers to connect through District Employment and Coaching cum Guidance Centres.
Scheme is providing great help to differently abled persons by providing them financial assistance as well as guidance for job placement.
Applicant need to exist in live register of employment office to avail benefits of scheme.
Applicant have to renew his registration in employment office every three year and renewal should be done within three months from due date. 
Differently abled persons need not have to renew their registration in employment exchange office.
The benefits of scheme can be availed by applying personally along with application form at employment office or at e-service centres with needed documents.
Assistance will be discontinued if the registered applicant gets a job during the grant period.
Every year self declaration about unemployment is must by the applicant to avail the benefit.

Overview Of the Scheme

Name of the Scheme
Chief Minister's Solar Rooftop Capital Incentive Scheme.
Launched in
2013.
Benefits

Installation of solar PV plants at subsidized cost.
Reduced Power bills.
Free comprehensive maintenance for first five years.

Beneficiaries
Domestic consumers with a TANGEDCO service connection
Nodal Agency
Tamil Nadu Energy Development Agency
Mode of Apply
Offline - Application form.
			Online - TEDA Portal.
Introduction
Chief Minister's Solar Rooftop Capital Incentive Scheme was launched in 2013 by government of Tamil Nadu.
Under this Scheme, Consumer can install Solar PV plants at their home at subsidized costs.
Subsidy of Rs.20,000 will be provided by state government of Tamil Nadu.
Solar PV plants will have free comprehensive maintenance for five years.
Installations of solar PV plants will result in reduction in Electricity bills.
Only Domestic consumers with a TANGEDCO service connection are eligible under this scheme.
Applicant can apply for Chief Minister's Solar Rooftop Capital Incentive Scheme either online or offline.
Eligibility
Only Domestic consumers with a TANGEDCO service connection are eligible under this scheme.
Subsidy will be applicable for 1kWp plants.
The Scheme only applies to grid-connected rooftop solar PV systems.
Benefits
Installation of solar PV plants at subsidized cost.
	Cost of Project
Rs.1,00,000
Subsidy by Central Government
Rs.30,000
Subsidy by State Government
Rs.20,000
Beneficiary Contribution
Rs.50,000

Reduced Power bills.
Low maintenance.
Free comprehensive maintenance for first five years.
Documents Required
Aadhaar Card.
Voter Id Card.
PAN Card.
Electricity DISCOM Bill.
Passport size photograph.
How to Apply
Applicant can apply for Chief Minister's Solar Rooftop Capital Incentive Scheme either online or offline.
	Offline

Download the Application form.
Fill up the Application form and attach the required documents.
Now submit the application form to TEDA through post or in person immediately.

Online

Applicant need to visit on TEDA Portal.
Now applicant need to click on "Apply Online".
Enter your details and continue with filling up the application form.
Now take a print of the submitted copy and submit it to TEDA through post or in person immediately.


After submission of application form registration number will be communicated through SMS.
Applications received will be scrutinized in tandem with TANGEDCO for the confirmation of Electricity Board's tariff category.
After successful verification applicant can avail the benefit of the scheme.
Features
New meters will be installed at beneficiary residence which can measure both energy import and energy export.
	Energy import - Energy transferred from TANGEDCO Distribution network to Consumers.
Energy Export - Energy transferred from Consumer to TANGEDCO Distribution network.

With solar net-metering the Consumer pays for the difference between import and export energy.
If the applicant moves to new address after registration, then new application need to be filed for new address. In this case application seniority of the old application will be canceled.
Approved cost for solar PV plants is for flat roofs only. If the roof is not flat and requires additional mounting structures, then additional cost will have to be born by the applicant.
Under this scheme, no Generation Based Incentive will be provided by Government of Tamil Nadu.
The selection of Beneficiaries shall be done on first come first served basis.
The entire solar Rooftops shall carry a warranty of five years with a panel warranty of 25 years.
Application Form
Chief Minister's Solar Roof Top Capital Incentive Scheme Application Form.

Overview of the Scheme

Name of Scheme
Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Launched on
15th September 2023.
Benefits
Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per Month.
Beneficiaries
Women of Tamil Nadu.

Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme Website.
Nodal Department
Department of Social Welfare & Women Empowerment, Tamil Nadu.
Subscription
Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
Mode of Application
Through Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme Application Form.
Introduction
Tamil Nadu Government started lots of welfare schemes in State.
Every scheme targets the needy section of society so that they can be treated as equal in mainstream life.
The most needy section of our society is Women who is a homemaker and handle all day care works single handedly.
Government of Tamil Nadu thinks that there is a need to empower the women of state financially as well.
So in the budget of 2023-2024, Tamil Nadu Government announced to start a new scheme for women empowerment called "Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme".
Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme is also called by some other major names such as :-
	"Tamil Nadu Financial Assistance for Women".
"Tamil Nadu Women Entitlement Fund".
"Tamil Nadu Women Artists Empowerment Scheme".
"Tamil Nadu Monthly Financial Assistance Scheme for Women".
"Kalaignar Mahalir Urimai Thittam Scheme".

The main objective behind launching Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme is to empower women homemaker by providing them monthly financial assistance.
Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per month will be provided to all eligible women of Tamil Nadu State under Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
All Women Heads of Household are eligible for financial assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per month.
This monthly financial assistance will help the women beneficiary to take care the daily expenses which was shaken after the price rise of daily use items.
Tamil Nadu Government launched Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme on 15th of September 2023.
The reason behind choosing this date because on that date there is a birth anniversary of Perarignar Anna who is a great son of Tamil Nadu and a brilliant scholar.
Government of Tamil Nadu allotted a whooping budget of Rs. 7,000/- Crore for Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme of Tamil Nadu Government is going to be the biggest socio economic welfare scheme for women in the country.
Tamil Nadu Government releases the official guidelines of Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme and the Registration of Beneficiary is also started.
Women Beneficiary can register themselves under Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme by visiting their nearest Ration Shop/ Fair Price Shop.
Registration will be done through Offline Application Form of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Women Beneficiary received a message from Tamil Nadu Government on 18-09-2023 regarding status of their Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme Application.
Some Women received the accepted message but some didn't.
Application of some women beneficiary got rejected due to some deficiencies in Application Form of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
They can file an appeal in the office of Revenue Divisional Officer within 30 days from the date of receiving the rejected message.
Women Beneficiary can also check the Payment Status and Application Status of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme Online.
Benefits of Scheme
The following benefits will be provided to eligible women beneficiaries of Tamil Nadu under Government of Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme :-
	Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per Month to Women Beneficiary.


Eligibility
Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Tamil Nadu.
Applicant should be a Women.
Women Beneficiary should be a Head of Household.
The Age of Women should be above 21 Years.
The Annual Family Income of Women Family Should be below Rs.

1,000/- per Month to Women Beneficiary.


Eligibility
Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Tamil Nadu.
Applicant should be a Women.
Women Beneficiary should be a Head of Household.
The Age of Women should be above 21 Years.
The Annual Family Income of Women Family Should be below Rs. 2,50,000/-.
The Family Land Holding of Women Family should be :-
	Less than 5 Acre of Wetland or Less than 10 Acre of Dry Land.

The Electricity Consumption of Women Family should not be more than 3,600 units per Years.
Documents Required
The below mentioned documents will be required to avail the benefit of monthly financial assistance under Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme :-
	Residence Proof of Tamil Nadu.
Aadhar Card.
Ration Card.
Income Certificate.
Caste Certificate. (If Applicable)
Bank Account Details.
Passport Size Photograph.
Mobile Number.

How to Apply
Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme was announced by the Government of Tamil Nadu in their 2023-2024 Budget.
Government of Tamil Nadu will going to launch Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme on 15th of September 2023 on the birth anniversary of Perarignar Anna.
Now the Tamil Nadu Government releases the Official Guidelines of Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Registration of Women Beneficiary under this scheme will be done in the camps organised by Government.
Initially the Registration Camps of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme will be held at Ration/ Fair Price Shops.
Registration Forms of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme is available at those shops.
Volunteers present at shop will help the women beneficiary to fill the application form of Magalr Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Beneficiary can check the District Wise Registration Camp Details of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme Here.
Visit the Registration Camp and Register themselves to get the benefit of financial assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per month under Tamil Nadu Government's Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.
Selected Women Beneficiary received a message on 18-09-2023 from Tamil Nadu Government.
But some Women did not get any SMS because their Application of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme is rejected.
But those women beneficiary didn't have to worry about it.
They can file an appeal within 30 days of receiving the SMS in front of Revenue Divisional Officer.
Revenue Divisional Officer will make sure that the deficiency in the Applications should be removed and Women Beneficiary will get the benefit of Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme of Tamil Nadu Government.
To file an appeal Women Beneficiary has to visit her nearest E Service Center.
Women Beneficiary can find her nearest E Service Center Here.
Women Beneficiary can also file Online Complaint for Tamil Nadu Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme.

Introduction
Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme is the social welfare scheme of Tamil Nadu Government for School Students.
Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme was announced by Chief Minister Sh. M. K Stalin on 07-05-2022.
And on the birth date of Perarignar Annna i.e. on 15-09-2022, Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme was officially launched at Madurai by Tamil Nadu Government.
Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme is known by many names in Tamil Nadu like :- "Stalin Breakfast Scheme" or "Morning Breakfast Scheme in Tamil Nadu" or "Tamil Nadu Breakfast Scheme".
The main objective behind launching Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme is :-
	To encourage children to join school for study.
To keep children out for suffering malnutrition.
To improve the nutritional status of school going children.

Tamil Nadu Government will provide Free Breakfast to all students of primary schools under Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme.
Students studying from Class 1st to Class 5th in Tamil Nadu Government Schools are eligible for free breakfast.
13 Types of Food Items will be provided to students in breakfast.
Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme of Tamil Nadu will be rolled out in phases.
In first phase 1,54,108 students of 1969 schools will be covered under Tamil Nadu Breakfast Scheme.
And In Second Phase, around 18,00,000/- students of 30,122 Tamil Nadu Government Primary School will be covered.
After deep analysis, Government of Tamil Nadu observes that the attendance in Government Schools of Tamil Nadu is increased by on average of 30 percent.
There is no need to apply anywhere for Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme.
Every Student studying from Class 1st to Class 5th are eligible for free breakfast in their government primary school.
Benefits of Scheme
The following benefits will be provided to Students of Primary School under Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Breakfast Scheme :-
	Free Breakfast will be Provided to all Primary School Students.
Breakfast has 13 Types of Food Items which will be distributed among Students.
Free Breakfast will be distributed daily from Monday to Friday on School Working Days.

Overview of the Scheme

Name of the Scheme
Tamil Nadu Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women.

Free of Cost Bus Travel in Tamil Nadu Government Run Buses.

Women of Tamil Nadu.

Mode of Application
No Need to Apply Anywhere for Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women.
Introduction
Tamil Nadu Government announces and implement lots of scheme for the welfare of people of Tamil Nadu.
One of the social welfare scheme for Tamil Nadu Women is Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme.
It was announced and launched in the year 2021.
The main objective behind launching Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme is to encourage women of Tamil Nadu for higher work participation and reduce the dependency on private mobility.
Most of the Working Women, Girls Students and Women Labourers doesn't have their own convenience to commute one place to another.
They regularly pay for travelling fare which overburden them financially.
So to unburden the Women of Tamil Nadu financially, Government came up with a idea to provide free of cost travel in government run buses.
Under Tamil Nadu Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme, No women have to any fare if they are travelling in Government of Tamil Nadu run buses.
Zero Fare Ticket will be issued to women beneficiary at the time of travelling.
Free of cost travel in government run buses will only valid up to 30 kilometers.
Women Beneficiary has to carry one photographed identity card for verification purpose.
Transgenders are also eligible for free of cost travel under Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme of Tamil Nadu.
Free of Cost Bus Service will only provided in Tamil Nadu Government run Ordinary/ City Buses or Buses operated under the control of Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation.
There is no need to apply anywhere to avail the benefit of free of cost travel in buses.
Women Beneficiary can directly travel free of cost under Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women of Government of Tamil Nadu.
Eligibility
Women Should be a Permanent Resident of Tamil Nadu.
Benefits of Scheme
The following benefits will be provided to eligible women/ transgender beneficiaries of Tamil Nadu under Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women :-
	Free of Cost Travel in Government of Tamil Nadu Buses.
No Need to Pay any Fare up to 30 Kilometers.

Documents Required
Any one of the below mentioned documents will be shown by Women Beneficiary to the Bus Conductor at the time of travelling to avail the benefit of Tamil Nadu Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women :-
	Aadhar Card.
Voter Identity Card.
School Identity Card.
College Identity Card.
Employee Identity Card.
Or Any Other Photographed Identity Card.

How to Apply
There is no need to apply anywhere for Tamil Nadu Zero Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women.
Eligible Women Beneficiary of Tamil Nadu will directly avail the benefit of free of cost bus service in Tamil Nadu Government Run Buses.
But there is a kilometer limit in this scheme.
Women Beneficiary can only travel for free in government run buses up to 30 kilometers within the Tamil Nadu State.
Photographed Identity Card for verification purpose is needed at the time of travelling.
Beneficiary Women can directly take the government run buses and avail the benefit of free of cost travel.

Mode of Apply
Through Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme Online Application Form.
Introduction
Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme is the major educational reform scheme of Tamil Nadu Government.
The main objective behind launching Pudhumai Penn Scheme is to encourage girls students to pursue higher education.
Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme is also called "Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Higher Education Assurance Scheme".
Department of Social Welfare and Women Empowerment of Government of Tamil Nadu is the nodal department of this scheme.
Lots of girls did not able to completed their education after 12th due to bad financial condition.
This will result the early marriage of girls.
So seeing this type of things in state, Tamil Nadu Government started Pudhumai Penn Scheme to provide monetary assitance to girls for completing their higher education.
Rs. 1,000/- per Month will be provided to all eligible girl students of Tamil Nadu after class 12th till they completed their graduation.
Only those Girls Students are eligible for financial assistance under Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme who completed their education of Class 6th to Class 12th from Tamil Nadu Government Schools.
Eligible Girls Students can apply for financial assistance under Pudhumai Penn Scheme by filling the Online Application Form of Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme.
Benefits of Scheme
Government of Tamil Nadu will provide below mentioned financial assistance to eligible girls beneficiaries under Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	Financial Assistance of Rs. 1,000/- per Month to Girls Students till the Completion of the Course.

Eligibility
Eligibility Conditions for Girl Beneficiaries in order to avail the benefit of financial assistance under Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme are as follows :-
	Only Girls Students are Eligible.
Girls who have passed Class 6th to Class 12th from Government of Tamil Nadu School.
Girls Presently Studying in any Undergraduate/ Professional Course.
Girls who have passed Class 6th to Class 8th from Private School under Right to Education Act (RTE) and Passed Class 9th to Class 12th from Government School are also eligible to apply.

Ineligibility
The below mentioned ineligibility conditions is set by Government of Tamil Nadu for Girl Beneficiaries under Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	Beneficiary Girls Who Have Passed Class 6th to Class 12th Class from Private School.
Girls Studying in Post Graduate Course.
Girls Studying Through Distance Mode.
Girls Studying in Open Universities.

Documents Required
Following Documents will required at the time of applying for financial assistance under Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	Residence Proof of Tamil Nadu.
Aadhar Card.
Caste Certificate (If Applicable).
Class 10th Marksheet.
Class 10th Certificate.
Class 12th Marksheet.
Class 12th Certificate.
Transfer Certificate of Previous School.
Bank Passbook.

How to Apply
Eligible Girl Beneficiaries can apply for financial assistance by filling Online Application of Pudhumai Penn Scheme.
Online Application of Pudhumai Penn Scheme is available at Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme Portal.
Beneficiary Girl has to Register themeselves first.
After Opening Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme Portal, Applicant Girl have to Register with her mobile number.
Mobile Number of Girl will be verified through OTP.
After entering OTP, the beneficiary has to enter the following details :-
	Personal Details.
Contact Details.
Education Related Details.

Click on Proceed Button after filling the above mentioned details.
After that the Girl Beneficiary will have to fill the details of school from Class 6th to Class12th.
Then fill the Bank Account Details.
Preview the Application Form of Pudhumai Penn Scheme carefully and Click on Submit Button after that.
Application Form and Documents will be subject to verification.
Girls will be notified through SMS on their mobile number if their application of Pudhumai Penn Scheme is selected.
Financial Assistance of Rs.

1,000/- per Month will be credited in the account of Girls Beneficiaries.
Features of the Scheme
Under Pudhumai Penn Scheme, only those girls are eligible who have completed their education of Class 6th to Class 12th from a Tamil Nadu Government School.
The beneficiary girl who has completed her studies under Right to Education from class 6th to class 8th from Private School and after that completed Class 9th to Class 12th from Government of Tamil Nadu School are also eligible for Pudhumai Penn.
Girls studying in any Undergraduate Course, Professional Course, Paramedical Course, Diploma, ITI, or any other recognised course are eligible to take benefit of financial assistance under Pudhumai Penn Scheme.
Below mentioned Girls are not eligible for Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	Who have completed their Class 6th to Class 12th Education from Private School.
Girls Studying in Open University.
Girls Studying through Distance Mode.
Girls Studying in Post Graduate Course.

Financial Assistance under Pudhumai Penn Scheme will be given every month in the bank account of the girl.
List of Eligible Courses
Girl Students studying in any of the following courses are eligible for financial assistance under Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	
Bachelor Degrees Courses like :-
					B.A.
BSc.
B.Com.
B.B.A.
B.C.A.

Paramedical Courses like :-
					Nursing.
Pharmacy.
Medical Lab Technology.
Physiotherapy.

Professional Courses like :-
					B.E.
B. Tech.
M.B.B.B.S.
B.D.S.
BSc. (Agriculture).
B.V.Sc.
B.F.Sc.
B.L.

Diploma or ITI or any other recognised course.
All Arts, Science and Fine Arts Courses.


List of Eligible Government Schools
The below mentioned schools are also treated as Government Schools and Girl Beneficiaries studied in these schools are also eligible for the benefit of Tamil Nadu Pudhumai Penn Scheme :-
	
Backward/Most Backward Welfare Schools.
Schools Run by Department of the Welfare of the Differently Abled.
Schools Run by Forest and Social Defence Departments.
Schools Run by Municipalities and Municipal Corporation.
Adi Dravidar Welfare Schools.
Kallar Reclamation Schools.
Panchayat Union Primary and Middle Schools.

Introduction
Lots of Youth wants to start their business to become Entrepreneurs.
But due to financial crunch and high cost of projects some of them drops the idea to start their business.
But Tamil Nadu Government came up with an initiative to help those unemployed youths who eagerly wants to start their own business.
Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme is going to be the major social welfare programme Tamil Nadu Government.
The main objective behind launching this programme is to support the youth of Tamil Nadu financially and help them to make their own employment generation venture.
This programme will help to generate employment for unemployed youth and as well as create employment opportunities for other people also.
Under Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme, Government of Tamil Nadu will provide capital subsidy to new entrepreneurs for setting up their own income generation activity.
Capital Subsidy of 25% of Total Project Cost or a Maximum of Rs.

2,50,000/- will be provided to eligible applicant under Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme.
Capital Subsidy will be provided on below mentioned maximum project cost :-
	Category
Project Cost
Manufacturing
Rs. 15,00,000/-
Business/ Trading
Rs. 5,00,000/-
Service
Rs. 5,00,000/-

Beneficiary has to contribute the following percentage of project cost from their own pocket :-
	For General Category Beneficiary :- 10% of Project Cost.
For Special Category Beneficiary :- 5% of Project Cost.

Remaining Amount of Project Cost will be provided as a bank loan to the applicant.
There will be no Collateral Security is required for bank loan.
The repayment period of bank loan is 5 years.
Only those beneficiaries are eligible for capital subsidy whose annual family income is below Rs. 5,00,000/- per year.
Eligible Entrepreneur of Tamil Nadu can apply for capital subsidy by filling the Online Application Form of Tamil Nadu Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme.
Benefits
The following benefits will be provided to Entrepreneurship/ Applicant under Tamil Nadu Government's Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme :-
	
Capital Subsidy of 25% of Project Cost or Maximum of Rs. 2,50,000/- will be provided to Entrepreneurs.
Bank Loan will be provided on Remaining Project Cost.
No Collateral Security Required.
5 Years of Loan Repayment Period.
Maximum Project Cost per Entrepreneur should be :-
					Rs. 15,00,000/- for Manufacturing.
Rs. 5,00,000/- for Business/ Trading.
Rs. 5,00,000/- for Service.



Eligibility
Applicant should be a Permanent Resident of Tamil Nadu.
Applicant should have passed minimum Class 8th.
The Annual Family Income of Applicant should be below Rs. 5,00,000/-.
The Age of Applicant should be :-
	
Between 18 Years to 35 Years for General Applicant.
Between 18 Year to 45 Years for below mentioned Special Category Applicant :-
					Women.
Minorities.
Backward Class.
Most Backward Class.
Schedule Caste.
Schedule Tribe.
Ex-Servicemen.
Transgenders.
Differently Abled.



Project Cost Contribution of Applicant should be :-
	10% of Total Project Cost for General Applicant.
5% of Total Project Cost for Special Category Applicant.

Documents Required
The below mentioned documents is required to avail the benefit of Tamil Nadu Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme :-
	
Residence Proof of Tamil Nadu.
Ration Card.
Class 8th Education Related Documents.
